video_name: Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U
video_trans:
00:00:39.684 --> 00:00:43.216
The jack handle and lug wrench are located
in a storage compartment in the side of
00:00:43.216 --> 00:00:46.160
the passenger seat base, by the step well.
00:00:46.160 --> 00:00:49.460
Just put your fingers under
the two slots and pull it open.
00:00:49.460 --> 00:00:52.100
The six-piece jack handle
is inside a pouch,
00:00:52.100 --> 00:00:54.360
simply unsnap the three
straps to remove it.
00:00:55.560 --> 00:00:59.872
Now assemble the jack handle by inserting
the male end with the locking button into
00:00:59.872 --> 00:01:03.017
the tube, making sure it lines up and
snaps into position.
00:01:03.017 --> 00:01:05.545
Do the same with the remaining pieces.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U_seg3.mp4
question: How do you open it?

video_name: Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc
video_trans:
00:00:15.940 --> 00:00:19.140
To turn it on, using the five-way
switch on your steering wheel,
00:00:19.140 --> 00:00:22.070
scroll down to Track Apps,
then Launch Control.
00:00:22.070 --> 00:00:24.232
[MUSIC]
00:00:24.232 --> 00:00:27.330
There, you'll see Launch Control and
RPM set.
00:00:27.330 --> 00:00:29.290
The RPM feature allows you to set and
00:00:29.290 --> 00:00:35.030
hold a preferred RPM to launch at,
anywhere between 3,000 and 4,500 RPMs.
00:00:35.030 --> 00:00:38.410
To select your RPM,
use the up and down arrows.
00:00:38.410 --> 00:00:41.490
This helps you control the amount of
torque distributed to the rear wheels
00:00:41.490 --> 00:00:44.570
based on engine speed,
tire temperature and
00:00:44.570 --> 00:00:46.645
surface condition to
help prevent wheel spin.
00:00:46.645 --> 00:00:47.540
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc_seg2.mp4
question: What does the RPM feature allows the driver to do?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:00:52.540 --> 00:00:56.902
To access the charge port light
preferences, using the touchscreen,
00:00:56.902 --> 00:01:00.113
touch settings, vehicle,
and charge port light.
00:01:00.113 --> 00:01:01.307
[MUSIC]
00:01:01.307 --> 00:01:03.600
The default setting is on.
00:01:03.600 --> 00:01:07.480
This means the port lights will illuminate
when you plug in, when the vehicle is
00:01:07.480 --> 00:01:13.080
charging, and anytime you press the unlock
button on your key fob or open the doors.
00:01:13.080 --> 00:01:16.370
Selecting Limited will prevent the port
lights from coming on while the vehicle
00:01:16.370 --> 00:01:17.860
is charging.
00:01:17.860 --> 00:01:20.410
And Off will disable
all lighting features.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg4.mp4
question: How do I change the setting for the port charge light?

video_name: Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI
video_trans:
00:00:16.330 --> 00:00:18.660
If your vehicle is equipped
with a manual transmission,
00:00:18.660 --> 00:00:22.950
be sure your vehicle is at a complete stop
before attempting to shift into reverse.
00:00:22.950 --> 00:00:26.670
Now, press the clutch pedal all
the way to the floor to disengage it.
00:00:26.670 --> 00:00:31.110
Then use your fingers to pull up on the
collar located below the gear shift knob,
00:00:31.110 --> 00:00:35.105
and move the gear shift lever all
the way to the left, then forward.
00:00:35.105 --> 00:00:39.315
Remember, the gear shift can only be moved
to reverse by raising the lock-out ring.
00:00:39.315 --> 00:00:42.525
It protects the transmission from
accidentally engaging reverse when you're
00:00:42.525 --> 00:00:44.679
intending to shift into first.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI_seg2.mp4
question: How can you shift into the reverse gear?

video_name: Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs
video_trans:
00:00:30.320 --> 00:00:34.199
And select either Auto, which extends or
retracts every time you open or
00:00:34.199 --> 00:00:35.160
close the doors.
00:00:35.160 --> 00:00:37.096
Out, to keep them open all the time,
00:00:37.096 --> 00:00:41.120
which can be helpful when
accessing items from a roof rack.
00:00:41.120 --> 00:00:45.570
Or Off, to disable them, which is
useful if you're using a hoist or jack.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs_seg3.mp4
question: When should I keep my runnings board out all the time?

video_name: Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM
video_trans:
00:01:13.142 --> 00:01:18.280
To turn Auto Unlock on or off, follow
the steps to enter the programming mode.
00:01:18.280 --> 00:01:21.570
Then press the door lock button and
then the door unlock button.
00:01:21.570 --> 00:01:25.338
The horn will chirp once,
if Auto Unlock was turned off.
00:01:25.338 --> 00:01:31.646
Or twice [NOISE], one short chirp and one
long chirp, if Auto Unlock was turned on.

video_name: Automatic Headlamps With Wiper-Activated Headlamp Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-FOL9B-e2Oz8
video_trans:
00:00:45.461 --> 00:00:48.467
Of course, if you don't want your
lights to stay on that long,
00:00:48.467 --> 00:00:51.260
you could always change the duration.
00:00:51.260 --> 00:00:55.306
Just go to the message center,
scroll to Settings, Lightning and
00:00:55.306 --> 00:00:56.687
then Autolamp Delay.
00:00:56.687 --> 00:01:00.422
Here you can select the length of
time you want them to stay on for.

video_name: One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk
video_trans:
00:00:56.930 --> 00:01:00.210
Keep in mind, if you continuously open and
close your windows in a short period of
00:01:00.210 --> 00:01:04.370
time, it may cause your window
to be temporarily disabled.
00:01:04.370 --> 00:01:08.270
Also, if you press the window switch
quickly from the first to second position,
00:01:08.270 --> 00:01:11.180
it can cause your window
to be temporarily disabled.
00:01:11.180 --> 00:01:14.977
If this happens, release the switch,
wait a moment, then press it again.
00:01:14.977 --> 00:01:18.983
And remember, touching the switch at
all while the window is opening or
00:01:18.983 --> 00:01:20.270
closing will stop it.
00:01:21.640 --> 00:01:22.260
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk_seg6.mp4

video_trans:

In addition the system can help you
back in to a parking perpendicular or
00:01:17.140 --> 00:01:19.240
traditional parking spot.

Just press the Active Park Assist

Signal to indicate which side you want to

video_name: 6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc
video_trans:
00:00:17.320 --> 00:00:20.822
Here's how it works, to use SelectShift,
00:00:20.822 --> 00:00:24.333
move your gear shift into S,
or Sport Mode.
00:00:24.333 --> 00:00:27.600
If your vehicle has the select shift
controls on the steering wheel,
00:00:27.600 --> 00:00:32.040
you'll pull the right paddle to upshift,
or the left paddle to downshift.
00:00:32.040 --> 00:00:35.990
If your controls are located on the
Shifter, you upshift by pressing the plus
00:00:35.990 --> 00:00:40.590
button on the Gear Shift Lever, or
downshift by pressing the minus button.

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:01:15.390 --> 00:01:16.460
When connecting a trailer,
00:01:16.460 --> 00:01:19.840
you can follow a connection checklist
to ensure nothing's been missed.
00:01:19.840 --> 00:01:23.850
To do so, from the towing menu,
scroll down to Connection Checklist,
00:01:23.850 --> 00:01:28.290
then choose type of trailer,
Conventional, Fifth Wheel or Gooseneck.
00:01:28.290 --> 00:01:30.980
And it will walk you through
the connection process to remind you of
00:01:30.980 --> 00:01:32.620
the necessary steps.
00:01:32.620 --> 00:01:33.660
Press OK to confirm.

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:00:11.045 --> 00:00:15.500
Lane-keeping system is made up
of two parts, Alert and Aid.
00:00:16.700 --> 00:00:18.860
The Alert mode lets you know if
you're drifting out of your lane.
00:00:19.928 --> 00:00:24.740
Using three short vibrations, it warns you
to steer your vehicle back into your lane.
00:00:24.740 --> 00:00:28.180
If you want to change the strength
of the vibration your car gives you,
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:31.245
you can adjust the intensity
setting in the message center.
00:00:31.245 --> 00:00:33.680
Lane-keeping will remember
the changes you make, so
00:00:33.680 --> 00:00:36.640
you won't have to reset it the next
time you turn on the system.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg2.mp4
question: Can I change the intensity of the alert level?

video_name: F-150 Box Side Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dcsLsT9KpiU
video_trans:
00:00:14.850 --> 00:00:17.220
To extend the step from
its stowed position,
00:00:17.220 --> 00:00:19.820
simply press down on the release
with your foot here.
00:00:20.840 --> 00:00:24.100
To help avoid injury,
the box step has a slow release
00:00:24.100 --> 00:00:27.220
that prevents the step from
springing out too quickly.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Box Side Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dcsLsT9KpiU_seg2.mp4

To turn off Dual-Zone mode,
press the Dual-Zone button again.
00:01:50.580 --> 00:01:53.710
When you do, the passenger side
temperature will automatically
00:01:53.710 --> 00:01:56.180
revert to the driver's side setting.

video_trans:

Keep in mind, if your transmitter stops
working which you're programming,
00:01:23.630 --> 00:01:25.890
you'll have to hold the function
button while you press and
00:01:25.890 --> 00:01:28.380
release the transmitter every two seconds.
00:01:28.380 --> 00:01:30.950
You'll see the indicator
light flash slowly at first
00:01:30.950 --> 00:01:34.590
then faster once the signal has
been sent and accepted again.
00:01:34.590 --> 00:01:35.175
Still with me?

question: What will the indicator light look like once the signal has been sent?

video_name: Transit Refueling _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vM-EW2gDMn0
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.359 --> 00:00:03.800
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.800 --> 00:00:07.792
Your transit's fuel door is conveniently
located inside the driver's door for
00:00:07.792 --> 00:00:09.550
quick and easy fill ups.
00:00:09.550 --> 00:00:13.380
To open the fuel filler door,
the driver's door must be open.
00:00:13.380 --> 00:00:16.990
Once it is, place your finger under
the filler door tab and pull.
00:00:16.990 --> 00:00:19.770
You'll notice it has the Easy Fuel
capless fuel filler, so
00:00:19.770 --> 00:00:21.870
there's no cap to twist off.
00:00:21.870 --> 00:00:23.970
Just insert the fuel
pump nozzle all they way,
00:00:23.970 --> 00:00:28.040
making sure it passes through both
spring-loaded flaps, then fill up.
00:00:28.040 --> 00:00:31.550
Once it's stopped filling, wait about
ten seconds before removing the nozzle,
00:00:31.550 --> 00:00:34.020
to allow any residual to drain out.
00:00:34.020 --> 00:00:36.690
Remove the nozzle and close the fuel door.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Refueling _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vM-EW2gDMn0_seg1.mp4
question: How will you use your finger to open the filler door?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w
video_trans:
00:00:40.240 --> 00:00:43.325
Here are a few important things you
should know when using Auto Start-Stop.
00:00:44.590 --> 00:00:48.468
Your electric power assisted steering
is inactive when your engine is off.
00:00:48.468 --> 00:00:52.270
And Auto Start-Stop may not shut the
engine off if your battery is charging,
00:00:52.270 --> 00:00:56.770
the engine is still warming up, or if
you're using the heat or air conditioner.
00:00:56.770 --> 00:01:00.930
So, if you AC is on because it's warm
outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:02.170 --> 00:01:03.260
One more thing.
00:01:03.260 --> 00:01:07.120
Your vehicle is equipped with a heavy duty
starter and battery to help compensate for
00:01:07.120 --> 00:01:08.930
the increased number of starts and stops.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w_seg3.mp4
question: What are some important things to know when using the auto star/stop feature?

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:00:20.160 --> 00:00:23.250
The TBC control is located on
your center console, here.
00:00:24.800 --> 00:00:28.320
It has a manual slide control lever
that apply the trailer's electric brakes
00:00:28.320 --> 00:00:30.610
independently of the tow vehicle.
00:00:30.610 --> 00:00:32.360
And a plus and minus gain adjust button.
00:00:33.570 --> 00:00:35.610
Pressing either of them,
adjust how much or
00:00:35.610 --> 00:00:39.140
how little power the TBC sends
to your trailer's brakes.
00:00:39.140 --> 00:00:41.150
If you press and hold the button,
you can raise or
00:00:41.150 --> 00:00:43.660
lower the gain setting continuously.

video_trans:
00:00:17.482 --> 00:00:22.109
There are a few in vehicle technology
features that can aid you when hooking up,
00:00:22.109 --> 00:00:25.160
backing up, and
maneuvering an attached trailer.
00:00:25.160 --> 00:00:29.640
The available center high mounted stop
lamp camera offers an elevated perspective
00:00:29.640 --> 00:00:34.000
and dynamic center guidelines to help line
up your vehicle with the fifth wheel or
00:00:34.000 --> 00:00:35.160
gooseneck trailer.
00:00:35.160 --> 00:00:40.120
There's also a 360 degree camera feature
that delivers multiple views from
00:00:40.120 --> 00:00:42.139
the top down and all four sides
00:00:42.140 --> 00:00:46.180
as well as  a customer placed trailer
camera kit option that can be mounted to
00:00:46.180 --> 00:00:47.540
the rear of your trailer,
00:00:47.540 --> 00:00:51.100
that provides added driver convenience
when backing up a trailer.
00:00:51.120 --> 00:00:55.160
And they all can be viewed on
the center stack console display screen.

video_name: SYNC Connect powered by FordPass - Activate Remote Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-MheqNWskp-s
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.405 --> 00:00:03.973
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.980 --> 00:00:07.180
Did you know that your vehicle may be
equipped with a feature
00:00:07.180 --> 00:00:11.520
that allows you to stay connected and control certain
features remotely, like unlock and
00:00:11.540 --> 00:00:14.900
lock your doors as well as
remote start your vehicle?
00:00:14.920 --> 00:00:19.208
All you need is the available
Sync Connect, a compatible smartphone, and
00:00:19.208 --> 00:00:20.170
Ford Pass.
00:00:20.170 --> 00:00:21.520
Let me tell you about it.
00:00:21.520 --> 00:00:25.340
The first thing you'll need to do is
download FordPass from the App Store or
00:00:25.340 --> 00:00:28.500
Google Play and
accept the terms and conditions.
00:00:28.500 --> 00:00:33.491
If you already have a Ford owner account,
you can log in using your username and
00:00:33.491 --> 00:00:34.350
password.
00:00:34.350 --> 00:00:38.920
If not, you can create an account via the
FordPass app with some basic information
00:00:38.920 --> 00:00:40.400
and a four digit PIN.
00:00:40.400 --> 00:00:43.820
You'll then need to add your
sync connect equipped vehicle.
00:00:43.820 --> 00:00:45.710
Go to the My Vehicles card.
00:00:45.710 --> 00:00:47.600
Click on Add Vehicle.
00:00:47.600 --> 00:00:50.610
To add a second vehicle hit the + button.
00:00:50.610 --> 00:00:55.500
Next, scan the VIN bar code by selecting
the Use Camera tab and point your
00:00:55.500 --> 00:00:59.920
phone's camera to the VIN label located
on your vehicle's driver door sill.
00:00:59.920 --> 00:01:02.530
You'll get a scanned successfully screen.
00:01:02.530 --> 00:01:05.570
Next, assign a vehicle nickname,
then, hit Finish.
00:01:06.590 --> 00:01:10.360
Next, you'll see this screen directing
you to activate SYNC Connect by
00:01:10.360 --> 00:01:13.200
touching the Activate SYNC Connect button.
00:01:13.200 --> 00:01:16.170
After a few minutes,
go to your vehicle and start it.
00:01:16.170 --> 00:01:19.630
You will then see this pop up
on the SYNC 3 touchscreen.
00:01:19.630 --> 00:01:20.800
Touch Allow to continue.
00:01:21.880 --> 00:01:25.843
Keep in mind, if you do not touch Allow
in the pop-up within 10 start-ups,
00:01:25.843 --> 00:01:28.306
you will not gain access
to remote features, and
00:01:28.306 --> 00:01:30.608
will need to reactivate
from the beginning.
00:01:30.608 --> 00:01:31.873
[MUSIC]
00:01:31.873 --> 00:01:36.091
Once you do, after a short period of time,
all remote features can be
00:01:36.091 --> 00:01:40.188
accessed from your smartphones
FordPass Vehicle Controls card.
00:01:40.188 --> 00:01:41.265
Any questions?
00:01:41.265 --> 00:01:44.705
Go to owner.ford.com or FordPass.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC Connect powered by FordPass - Activate Remote Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-MheqNWskp-s_seg1.mp4
question: How do I download sync connect on my smart phone?

video_name: How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA
video_trans:
00:01:16.650 --> 00:01:20.350
Here are a few more things you'll
need to know when using the feature.
00:01:20.350 --> 00:01:24.990
After setting up and selecting a trailer,
the display always shows you a small top
00:01:24.990 --> 00:01:27.910
view representation of your truck and
trailer.
00:01:27.910 --> 00:01:30.570
You'll also see two
different colored lines.
00:01:30.570 --> 00:01:34.766
A black line shows you where your
trailer is in relation to your vehicle.
00:01:34.766 --> 00:01:37.800
And a white line gives you a projection
of where your trailer will go
00:01:37.800 --> 00:01:40.420
based on your current
steering wheel position.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA_seg4.mp4
question: What does the color of the black line indicate to the driver?

video_name: 60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.348 --> 00:00:05.553
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.553 --> 00:00:07.440
Can these seat backs be folded down?
00:00:09.560 --> 00:00:11.150
>> Can I fold down just one side?
00:00:13.200 --> 00:00:15.320
>> Did you know that you
can fold down one or
00:00:15.320 --> 00:00:17.780
both of the rear seat
backs in your vehicle?
00:00:17.780 --> 00:00:21.680
And that's helpful when carrying
longer items like skis or golf bags.
00:00:21.680 --> 00:00:23.740
Here's how to do it.
00:00:23.740 --> 00:00:27.110
Find the release on top of the seat
back you want to fold down.
00:00:27.110 --> 00:00:31.715
Then, just push or pull up to release
the seat back and fold it down.
00:00:31.715 --> 00:00:35.235
Do the same thing on the other side
if you want to fold them both down.
00:00:35.235 --> 00:00:38.175
You'll get a full pass through
from the trunk that way.
00:00:38.175 --> 00:00:42.601
And for your convenience, the 2013 Fusion
Hybrid battery has been moved to the floor
00:00:42.601 --> 00:00:45.349
of the trunk, so
it won't block the pass through.
00:00:45.349 --> 00:00:47.900
And there's a clip that holds
your safety belts in place, so
00:00:47.900 --> 00:00:51.305
they won't get caught behind
when folding your seat back.
00:00:51.305 --> 00:00:52.395
Any questions?
00:00:52.395 --> 00:00:53.862
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:53.862 --> 00:00:54.529
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4_seg1.mp4
question: Where has the 2013 hybrid battery been moved to allow a full past-through from the trunk to the back seat?

00:00:07.792 --> 00:00:09.550
quick and easy fill ups.
00:00:09.550 --> 00:00:13.380
To open the fuel filler door,
the driver's door must be open.
00:00:13.380 --> 00:00:16.990
Once it is, place your finger under
the filler door tab and pull.
00:00:16.990 --> 00:00:19.770
You'll notice it has the Easy Fuel
capless fuel filler, so
00:00:19.770 --> 00:00:21.870
there's no cap to twist off.
00:00:21.870 --> 00:00:23.970
Just insert the fuel
pump nozzle all they way,
00:00:23.970 --> 00:00:28.040
making sure it passes through both
spring-loaded flaps, then fill up.
00:00:28.040 --> 00:00:31.550
Once it's stopped filling, wait about
ten seconds before removing the nozzle,
00:00:31.550 --> 00:00:34.020
to allow any residual to drain out.
00:00:34.020 --> 00:00:36.690
Remove the nozzle and close the fuel door.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Refueling _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vM-EW2gDMn0_seg1.mp4
question: Where is the transit's filler door?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:52.860 --> 00:01:54.050
When towing a trailer,
00:01:54.050 --> 00:01:58.308
pressing the Tow/Haul mode button located
at the end of the gear shift lever, here,
00:01:58.308 --> 00:02:03.220
activates the tow/haul feature which will
allow the adaptive cruise control system
00:02:03.220 --> 00:02:06.130
to automatically follow at
a slightly greater distance.
00:02:06.130 --> 00:02:09.120
This is handy since the extra
weight of a trailer requires more
00:02:09.120 --> 00:02:11.050
breaking distance if needed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg9.mp4
question: where is the tow haul feature located?

video_name: Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM
video_trans:
00:00:58.335 --> 00:01:04.330
To turn Autolock on or off, press the door
unlock button, then the door lock button.
00:01:04.330 --> 00:01:06.658
The horn will chirp once
if Autolock was turned off.
00:01:06.658 --> 00:01:13.142
Or twice, [NOISE] one short chirp, and
one long chirp if Autolock was turned on.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM_seg4.mp4
question: How do you know when the auto lock feature is enabled in your vehicle?

video_name: Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs
video_trans:
00:00:11.610 --> 00:00:14.840
First, you'll notice all the normal
climate features you would typically find
00:00:14.840 --> 00:00:16.150
on most cars.
00:00:16.150 --> 00:00:20.250
A climate system power button, which turns
the climate control system off and on.
00:00:20.250 --> 00:00:24.370
A fan speed control or a circulating air
button that let's you switch between
00:00:24.370 --> 00:00:27.450
outside air and
air circulating within the car.
00:00:27.450 --> 00:00:30.395
A distribution control that lets you
choose whether you want the air flow to
00:00:30.395 --> 00:00:34.505
come through the dashboard vents,
the floor vents, the defrost
00:00:34.505 --> 00:00:39.085
vent at the base of the windshield,
or a combination of multiple vents.
00:00:39.085 --> 00:00:41.552
An air conditioning or AC, button.
00:00:41.552 --> 00:00:44.288
Max defrost and rear defrost buttons.
00:00:44.288 --> 00:00:45.850
And a max A/C button.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs_seg2.mp4
question: What do each of the climate control buttons mean?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:13.850 --> 00:01:18.030
You can adjust your follow distance using
the gap control on your steering wheel.
00:01:18.030 --> 00:01:20.950
Pressing it up decreases your
follow distance setting and
00:01:20.950 --> 00:01:23.910
allows your car to follow
at a closer distance.
00:01:23.910 --> 00:01:26.589
And pressing it down increases
your follow distance and
00:01:26.589 --> 00:01:30.320
expands the distance between you and
a car in front of you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg6.mp4
question: What is occur in the down position?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:02:11.050 --> 00:02:15.020
And one more thing, If you wish to
change to the conventional cruise mode,
00:02:15.020 --> 00:02:19.220
go to the menu settings on your instrument
cluster and select Cruise Control and
00:02:19.220 --> 00:02:20.110
then choose Normal.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg10.mp4
question: What does choosing Cruise Control and then choosing Normal do?

video_name: Rear Decklid Release _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fjh0-VKzUEk
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.036
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.036 --> 00:00:08.658
There are a few convenient ways to gain
access to the rear luggage compartment in
00:00:08.658 --> 00:00:09.600
your vehicle.
00:00:09.600 --> 00:00:11.210
Let me explain.
00:00:11.210 --> 00:00:14.360
From the driver's seat, simply push
the trunk release button on the lower left
00:00:14.360 --> 00:00:18.520
side of the instrument panel next to the
steering column to unlatch the rear deck lid.
00:00:18.520 --> 00:00:20.230
With the standard Intelligent Access,
00:00:20.230 --> 00:00:24.120
you can get into your vehicle remotely
without reaching for your key fob.
00:00:24.120 --> 00:00:25.320
With your key fob on you,
00:00:25.320 --> 00:00:29.350
just press the trunk release button
located above the license plate here.
00:00:29.350 --> 00:00:32.071
It's that simple.
00:00:32.071 --> 00:00:33.095
Any questions?
00:00:33.095 --> 00:00:34.727
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:34.727 --> 00:00:44.727
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Rear Decklid Release _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fjh0-VKzUEk_seg1.mp4
question: Can I get into the vehicle remotely and how?

video_name: Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc
video_trans:
00:00:44.400 --> 00:00:48.970
Just push up on the stalk to the single
triangle for a normal, continuous wipe, or
00:00:48.970 --> 00:00:50.840
to the double triangle for faster wiping.
00:00:52.090 --> 00:00:54.560
To wash the windshield,
just pull the stock towards you.
00:00:55.630 --> 00:00:57.840
So far, so good, right?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc_seg3.mp4
question: How to wash the windshield?

video_name: Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc
video_trans:
00:00:28.130 --> 00:00:31.080
To raise or lower the seat,
pull up on the lever located on
00:00:31.080 --> 00:00:35.190
the side of the seat closest to the door
to raise it and press down to lower it.
00:00:36.770 --> 00:00:39.680
You can also change the angle
of the seatback by pulling up on
00:00:39.680 --> 00:00:41.980
the adjustment lever on
the side of the seatback.
00:00:41.980 --> 00:00:45.490
Leaning backward or forward to the desired
position and then releasing the lever.

In fact, you can choose from Sport Mode or

To deactivate,
press the button again one time.

The indicator light will turn off and

Any questions?

video_name: Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM
video_trans:
00:00:48.160 --> 00:00:49.250
Keep in mind,
00:00:49.250 --> 00:00:53.440
there are some factors that affect the
amount of energy being used while driving.
00:00:53.440 --> 00:00:57.330
For instance, mild or
aggressive acceleration or braking,
00:00:57.330 --> 00:01:01.905
your vehicle's speed, how much you use
accessories, such as climate control.
00:01:01.905 --> 00:01:06.232
The ambient temperature and other weather
conditions, as well as whether you're
00:01:06.232 --> 00:01:09.335
driving in the city or
on the highway, and the road grades.
00:01:09.335 --> 00:01:10.463
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM_seg4.mp4
question: How does the environment affect energy used by vehicle?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:01:01.460 --> 00:01:06.175
In fact, there are four different
gaps that you can choose from,
00:01:06.175 --> 00:01:11.504
one bar, two bars, three bars, or
four, and gives you the largest gap.
00:01:11.504 --> 00:01:14.031
Each one represents
a different driving style and
00:01:14.031 --> 00:01:17.590
will affect how quickly your vehicle
responds to changes in traffic.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg5.mp4
question: How many gaps can you chose from?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:01:17.518 --> 00:01:21.390
While in tow/haul mode, the truck
will react slower to driver input
00:01:21.390 --> 00:01:26.130
at higher speeds, which allow both truck
and trailer to follow your intended path,
00:01:26.130 --> 00:01:30.580
while also maintaining the ease of parking
and performing low speed maneuvers.
00:01:30.580 --> 00:01:34.490
When starting or turning off your vehicle,
you might hear a faint click sound,
00:01:34.490 --> 00:01:36.670
this is just part of
the system's initialization and
00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.270
shutdown process,
don't worry, this is normal.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg4.mp4
question: How will the truck react to the driver input?

video_name: Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs
video_trans:
00:01:20.240 --> 00:01:23.840
If you'd rather control your airflow
manually, adjust the fan speed or
00:01:23.840 --> 00:01:26.110
press any air distribution
button to turn it off.
00:01:27.320 --> 00:01:31.820
Then select the temperature you want,
the air distribution you want,
00:01:31.820 --> 00:01:35.960
A/C on or off, and to recirculate air.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs_seg5.mp4

video_name: What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I
video_trans:
00:00:38.005 --> 00:00:41.420
To adjust the auto lamp time delay,
or how long your head lamps
00:00:41.420 --> 00:00:46.290
stay on after you've turned off your car,
use the information display controls.
00:00:46.290 --> 00:00:51.210
Press the down arrow to find settings,
then press OK and the right arrow.
00:00:51.210 --> 00:00:55.520
And scroll down to vehicle, or
convenience depending on your vehicle.
00:00:55.520 --> 00:00:59.370
Next, press the right arrow and
scroll to auto lamp delay.
00:00:59.370 --> 00:01:03.880
Press the right arrow again,
select off or the time delay you wish.
00:01:03.880 --> 00:01:05.350
Then press OK to set it.

[MUSIC]
00:00:04.727 --> 00:00:08.310
Did you know that your car may be equipped
with a feature that's designed to help
00:00:08.310 --> 00:00:10.150
reduce the amount of fuel you use?
00:00:10.150 --> 00:00:12.840
It's called Auto Start-Stop technology.
00:00:12.840 --> 00:00:13.530
Let me explain.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w_seg1.mp4
question: What is the purpose of the Auto-Start-Stop Technology feature?

video_name: Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk
video_trans:
00:00:17.482 --> 00:00:22.109
There are a few in vehicle technology
features that can aid you when hooking up,
00:00:22.109 --> 00:00:25.160
backing up, and
maneuvering an attached trailer.
00:00:25.160 --> 00:00:29.640
The available center high mounted stop
lamp camera offers an elevated perspective
00:00:29.640 --> 00:00:34.000
and dynamic center guidelines to help line
up your vehicle with the fifth wheel or
00:00:34.000 --> 00:00:35.160
gooseneck trailer.
00:00:35.160 --> 00:00:40.120
There's also a 360 degree camera feature
that delivers multiple views from
00:00:40.120 --> 00:00:42.139
the top down and all four sides
00:00:42.140 --> 00:00:46.180
as well as  a customer placed trailer
camera kit option that can be mounted to
00:00:46.180 --> 00:00:47.540
the rear of your trailer,
00:00:47.540 --> 00:00:51.100
that provides added driver convenience
when backing up a trailer.
00:00:51.120 --> 00:00:55.160
And they all can be viewed on
the center stack console display screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk_seg2.mp4

The system also comes

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:01:31.820 --> 00:01:34.530
And here are some important
facts you should know.
00:01:34.530 --> 00:01:39.180
On certain vehicles, the system only
allows up to two remote starts an hour or
00:01:39.180 --> 00:01:41.020
between manual starts.
00:01:41.020 --> 00:01:43.730
On others, you can only run your car for
00:01:43.730 --> 00:01:48.030
35 minutes with remote start before
you need to manually start it.

video_trans:

Once conditions are favorable for the
system to work, the lines will turn green.
00:01:32.470 --> 00:01:34.270
This means it's ready to go.

video_name: Smart Trailer Tow Connector _ Ford How-To _ Ford-iOv4Uin0pKo
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.720
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.720 --> 00:00:08.109
Your vehicle may be equipped with
a feature that monitors key components of
00:00:08.109 --> 00:00:10.120
a trailer that you are towing.
00:00:10.120 --> 00:00:11.580
Let me explain.
00:00:11.580 --> 00:00:15.590
The smart trailer tow connector informs
you if something regarding your trailer
00:00:15.590 --> 00:00:19.820
needs your attention via your productivity
screen under the Towing menu.
00:00:19.820 --> 00:00:23.888
Such as burned out or unlit trailer
turn signal lamps, brake lights, and
00:00:23.888 --> 00:00:25.474
trailer battery problems.
00:00:25.474 --> 00:00:28.884
Any questions, go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:28.884 --> 00:00:38.884
[MUSIC]

video_name: EcoSelect _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Um28JeKN_iI
video_trans:
00:00:41.700 --> 00:00:45.715
One more thing: vehicles equipped with
EcoSelect will also get the benefits of
00:00:45.715 --> 00:00:49.360
EcoCruise, which helps maximize economy
while driving on hilly roadways,
00:00:49.360 --> 00:00:52.974
where the vehicle may temporarily lose a
small amount of speed while going uphill.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/EcoSelect _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Um28JeKN_iI_seg3.mp4
question: what can happen when a vehicle goes up a hill?

video_name: Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw
video_trans:
00:01:23.240 --> 00:01:24.670
One more thing.
00:01:24.670 --> 00:01:27.310
When storing summer tires,
be sure to store them
00:01:27.310 --> 00:01:32.024
away from direct heating devices where
the temperatures are above 19 degrees Fahrenheit
00:01:32.024 --> 00:01:36.900
as lower temperatures may
result in loss of rubber flexibility and
00:01:36.900 --> 00:01:39.470
develop surface cracks in the treads.
00:01:39.470 --> 00:01:43.636
If the tires have been stored and
conditioned at 19 degrees or cooler,
00:01:43.636 --> 00:01:47.190
warm them to 41 degrees Fahrenheit for
at least 24 hours
00:01:47.190 --> 00:01:50.510
before installing them on a vehicle or
checking the tire pressure.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw_seg3.mp4
question: How to properly store the summer tires?

video_trans:

If equipped with a diesel engine,
the lower door is available for
00:00:39.740 --> 00:00:42.260
adding diesel exhaust fluid only.

video_trans:

To turn Auto Unlock on or off, follow
the steps to enter the programming mode.
00:01:18.280 --> 00:01:21.570
Then press the door lock button and
then the door unlock button.
00:01:21.570 --> 00:01:25.338
The horn will chirp once,
if Auto Unlock was turned off.
00:01:25.338 --> 00:01:31.646
Or twice [NOISE], one short chirp and one
long chirp, if Auto Unlock was turned on.

video_name: Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk
video_trans:
00:01:28.840 --> 00:01:31.460
You'll also find
a Connection Checklist tab.
00:01:31.460 --> 00:01:33.332
Here, you can select a particular trailer,
00:01:33.332 --> 00:01:35.540
ensure you're wiring
is hooked up properly,
00:01:35.540 --> 00:01:39.030
your lights are functioning correctly,
and your mirrors are adjusted.
00:01:39.030 --> 00:01:42.310
Trailer Setup allows you to select
the type of trailer you're pulling
00:01:42.310 --> 00:01:45.470
such as Conventional,
Fifth Wheel, or Gooseneck.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk_seg5.mp4
question: What are the information we get form connection checklist?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:46.465 --> 00:00:50.790
When a trailer is properly connected and
driving over five miles per hour, BLIS
00:00:50.790 --> 00:00:55.270
with trailer coverage uses sensors in the
vehicle's tail end to extend the detection
00:00:55.270 --> 00:00:59.300
area rearward from the vehicle's side
mirrors to the end of the trailer.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg4.mp4
question: How does the camera's work when the car is with its trailer?

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:00:49.240 --> 00:00:51.890
Remote start is especially nice
when you want to cool off your
00:00:51.890 --> 00:00:53.670
car before getting in on a hot day.
00:00:54.880 --> 00:00:58.590
In fact, if your car has automatic
climate control it will actually
00:00:58.590 --> 00:01:02.520
gauge the temperature inside the car and
adjust it to a more comfortable setting.
00:01:02.520 --> 00:01:06.340
This means that your heated seats,
steering wheel, and
00:01:06.340 --> 00:01:10.090
defrost will turn on on colder days and
your air conditioning and
00:01:10.090 --> 00:01:11.960
cooled seats will turn
on when it is warm out.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s_seg4.mp4
question: How does the car know whether to use heat or air conditioning?

video_name: Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk
video_trans:
00:00:10.560 --> 00:00:14.130
Let me tell you about it. The message
center or the productivity screen
00:00:14.130 --> 00:00:17.920
has a 4.2 inch screen that's located
between the tachometer and speedometer.
00:00:19.030 --> 00:00:21.720
Use the five-way switch on the left
side of your steering wheel
00:00:21.720 --> 00:00:26.190
to scroll to the main menu. From here, you
can get to display mode, which shows
00:00:26.190 --> 00:00:29.940
you your distance to empty, transmission
temperature, tire pressure for
00:00:29.940 --> 00:00:34.570
each wheel, engine information,
MyKey status and a digital speedometer.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the message center or pro activity screen is located?

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:01:56.180 --> 00:01:58.840
And here are a few other tips
you might be interested in.
00:01:58.840 --> 00:02:02.180
To cool down your vehicle quickly,
press the Auto button, and
00:02:02.180 --> 00:02:05.850
turn the nob toward the cool
setting to reduce the temperature.
00:02:05.850 --> 00:02:08.476
To warm your vehicle up quickly,
press the Auto button, and
00:02:08.480 --> 00:02:11.160
turn your nob toward the warm
setting to increase it.
00:02:11.740 --> 00:02:16.036
To quickly defrost the windshield and side
windows, press the Max defrost button.
00:02:16.036 --> 00:02:17.348
Both the temperature and
00:02:17.348 --> 00:02:21.070
fan speed will automatically
adjust to the highest settings.
00:02:21.070 --> 00:02:21.710
In mild or
00:02:21.710 --> 00:02:25.910
warm temperatures, you may notice
that your A/C automatically turns on.
00:02:25.910 --> 00:02:29.300
It does this to help dehumidify
the air for defogging.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550_seg9.mp4
question: What button do you push in order to heat up your vehicle quickly?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:03:07.000 --> 00:03:09.700
Now, I'm going to tell you how to input
the measurements into the system's
00:03:09.700 --> 00:03:10.640
information display.
00:03:11.720 --> 00:03:15.190
To input the measurements you recorded
outside the vehicle, use the up and
00:03:15.190 --> 00:03:18.540
down arrows on the five-way switch on
the left side of the steering wheel
00:03:18.540 --> 00:03:21.130
to increase or
decrease the numbers as needed.
00:03:21.130 --> 00:03:24.444
Like this,
then OK to confirm each measurement and
00:03:24.444 --> 00:03:26.769
to move on to the next measurement.
00:03:26.769 --> 00:03:28.618
Once you've added the last measurement,
00:03:28.618 --> 00:03:31.761
the information display will show
you all of the entered measurements.
00:03:31.761 --> 00:03:35.591
If correct, select Confirm and hit OK.
00:03:35.591 --> 00:03:39.573
Once you've confirmed the measurements,
the system will automatically search for
00:03:39.573 --> 00:03:42.172
the sticker target and
highlight it with a red circle and
00:03:42.172 --> 00:03:44.391
the message will ask if
the sticker is circled.
00:03:44.391 --> 00:03:47.495
If it is, select yes to confirm.
00:03:47.495 --> 00:03:50.762
You'll get a confirmation message
letting you know setup is complete and
00:03:50.762 --> 00:03:51.927
measurements are saved.
00:03:51.927 --> 00:03:54.753
If you don't see the sticker circled,
select no.
00:03:54.753 --> 00:03:57.201
Make sure the measurements are correct and
that the trailer and
00:03:57.201 --> 00:03:59.115
vehicle are positioned straight.
00:03:59.115 --> 00:04:03.779
Finally, you'll need to drive the vehicle
straightforward between 4 and 25 miles per
00:04:03.779 --> 00:04:07.844
hour as directed until you get a message
confirming calibration is complete.
00:04:07.844 --> 00:04:08.911
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg6.mp4
question: How measurements are inputted into system's information display?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:00:32.110 --> 00:00:36.110
First, you'll need to connect your vehicle
to your trailer on a level surface.
00:00:36.110 --> 00:00:39.960
For best results, it's recommended to use
a draw bar with the appropriate rise or
00:00:39.960 --> 00:00:44.600
drop to position your trailer level to
the ground. Then line up your vehicle and
00:00:44.600 --> 00:00:47.360
trailer by pulling forward, so
they're in line with one another.
00:00:48.500 --> 00:00:51.994
Second, from inside the vehicle
to begin programming,
00:00:51.994 --> 00:00:56.797
press the center of the Pro Trailer Backup
Assist button located to the right of
00:00:56.797 --> 00:00:58.569
the steering wheel, here.
00:00:58.569 --> 00:01:02.792
Using the up and down and left and right
arrows of the five-way controls, spell out
00:01:02.792 --> 00:01:06.612
the name of the trailer using the right
arrow to advance to the next letter.
00:01:06.612 --> 00:01:08.489
Press OK once finished.
00:01:08.489 --> 00:01:11.508
Next, select the type of brake system for
your trailer.
00:01:11.508 --> 00:01:16.095
Electric, which is the default or
surge type and press OK.
00:01:16.095 --> 00:01:18.751
Now, select the brake effort for
your trailer.
00:01:18.751 --> 00:01:21.737
Low, which is the recommended setting for
most trailers,
00:01:21.737 --> 00:01:25.892
Medium or High if your trailer requires
more aggressive braking like if you have
00:01:25.892 --> 00:01:29.230
a larger, heavier trailer, for instance.
00:01:29.230 --> 00:01:33.586
And since Pro Trailer Backup Assist is not
currently compatible with fifth-wheel or
00:01:33.586 --> 00:01:37.592
gooseneck type trailers, conventional
will be the default trailer type.
00:01:37.592 --> 00:01:41.507
You'll get a message asking if you
want to add Pro Trailer Backup Assist.
00:01:41.507 --> 00:01:43.224
Select Yes to confirm.
00:01:43.224 --> 00:01:45.864
A prompt will direct you
to straighten the trailer,
00:01:45.864 --> 00:01:47.725
if necessary to continue the setup.
00:01:47.725 --> 00:01:51.208
You'll then get another message directing
you to put the vehicle in park and
00:01:51.208 --> 00:01:54.810
to place the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
target sticker on your trailer tongue.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg3.mp4
question: What type of trailer is compatible with pro trailer backup assist?

video_name: Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk
video_trans:
00:01:22.590 --> 00:01:26.600
A green bar indicates a positive
effect on your EV range,
00:01:26.600 --> 00:01:29.150
while an amber bar indicates
a negative effect.
00:01:29.150 --> 00:01:32.110
The longer the bar, the larger the impact.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk_seg7.mp4

video_name: Headlamp Adjustment _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Sp3McTgj4ck
video_trans:
00:00:29.830 --> 00:00:33.000
Before we start,
you'll need a tape measure, some tape, and
00:00:33.000 --> 00:00:34.550
a Phillips screwdriver.
00:00:34.550 --> 00:00:37.370
And you'll want to park about
25 feet from a garage door or
00:00:37.370 --> 00:00:39.580
a wall with your headlamps aimed at it.

video_trans:
00:00:13.395 --> 00:00:18.150
If your vehicle is equipped with a third
row power fold, you can use the power seat
00:00:18.150 --> 00:00:23.100
buttons located behind the third
row to fold the left, right, or
00:00:23.100 --> 00:00:29.370
both seats to either a stow, fold,
tailgate, or normal position.
00:00:29.370 --> 00:00:31.410
If you have a second row power fold and
00:00:31.410 --> 00:00:33.960
tumble control,
just press the button once, and
00:00:33.960 --> 00:00:38.720
the seat will automatically fold and then
tumble forward to access the third row.

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:02:18.866 --> 00:02:23.348
To switch between adaptive cruise control
or normal cruise use the 5-way switch on
00:02:23.348 --> 00:02:26.134
your steering wheel and
the information displays.
00:02:26.134 --> 00:02:30.544
Select Driver Assist, Cruise Control,
then select Adaptive to enable,
00:02:30.544 --> 00:02:33.847
or in Normal for
a conventional cruise control system.
00:02:33.847 --> 00:02:36.399
Meaning, it will not
automatically adjust speed,
00:02:36.399 --> 00:02:38.782
based on the speed of
the vehicle in front of you.

To deactivate,
press the button again one time.
00:00:53.260 --> 00:00:57.260
The indicator light will turn off and
return you back to Normal driving mode.
00:00:57.261 --> 00:00:58.331
Any questions?

video_name: Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk
video_trans:
00:00:35.570 --> 00:00:39.810
Trip view mode gives you a four quadrant
look that displays trip one and two.
00:00:39.810 --> 00:00:43.870
Both of which allow you to see your timer,
instantaneous fuel economy,
00:00:43.870 --> 00:00:46.620
miles traveled, and
average miles per gallon.
00:00:46.620 --> 00:00:50.340
Under the same mode, you also have a fuel
economy screen that displays your average
00:00:50.340 --> 00:00:55.430
miles per gallon, an instantaneous fuel
economy graph, miles to empty, and
00:00:55.430 --> 00:01:00.210
a fuel history which shows a bar graph of
your fuel history over a period of time,
00:01:00.210 --> 00:01:03.670
a compass as well as your
Auto StartStop status.

question: Can auto start be t

video_name: EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM
video_trans:
00:00:14.380 --> 00:00:16.190
It works a lot like
standard cruise control,
00:00:16.190 --> 00:00:19.196
in that it still maintains
your speed on flat roadways.
00:00:19.196 --> 00:00:21.470
But with ECO Cruise,
when you tap the brake, and
00:00:21.470 --> 00:00:25.410
then want to resume your previously set
speed, it accelerates gradually to get
00:00:25.410 --> 00:00:29.100
your vehicle back up to speed and
that can help save energy.
00:00:29.100 --> 00:00:33.160
Be aware that you may experience some
speed loss when first going up hill but
00:00:33.160 --> 00:00:37.110
after a short period of time,
it will catch up to your set speed.
00:00:37.110 --> 00:00:39.380
And if equipped with
adaptive cruise control,
00:00:39.380 --> 00:00:43.320
when your vehicle speed is slowed, it will
automatically accelerate again gradually
00:00:43.320 --> 00:00:47.890
once traffic is cleared. That gradual
acceleration may make it seem as if your
00:00:47.890 --> 00:00:50.930
vehicle isn't keeping up with
the speed you've set, it is.
00:00:50.930 --> 00:00:53.710
It's just that its more efficient
to gradually accelerate.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM_seg2.mp4
question: What happens gradually when you tap the brake?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w
video_trans:
00:00:14.600 --> 00:00:17.130
Auto Start-Stop technology is always on
00:00:17.130 --> 00:00:20.450
unless you turn it off by pushing
the Auto Start-Stop off button.
00:00:20.450 --> 00:00:23.760
So, it will be active every
time you start your vehicle.
00:00:23.760 --> 00:00:25.390
When you put your foot
on the brake pedal and
00:00:25.390 --> 00:00:29.625
come to a full start, like at a red light,
your engine automatically shuts off.
00:00:29.625 --> 00:00:31.530
You might not even notice it.
00:00:31.530 --> 00:00:34.720
But a light on the instrument cluster
will let you know that it's off.
00:00:34.720 --> 00:00:36.920
And, once you take your
foot off the brake pedal,
00:00:36.920 --> 00:00:40.240
your car automatically
restarts without any delay.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w_seg2.mp4
question: How to start or stop the vehicle with break peddle?

video_name: Easy Fuel Capless Fuel Filler _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Eh3snbTNR1k
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.456
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.456 --> 00:00:07.616
Your vehicle has a capless fuel filler
that saves time at the pump and
00:00:07.616 --> 00:00:09.680
keeps your hands cleaner.
00:00:09.680 --> 00:00:13.010
There's no cap to twist off and
it's simple to use.
00:00:13.010 --> 00:00:16.510
Just open your fuel door by either
putting a finger under the exposed tab
00:00:16.510 --> 00:00:17.530
on the door.
00:00:17.530 --> 00:00:19.800
Or by pushing it in a bit
until it releases and
00:00:19.800 --> 00:00:21.470
you can open it the rest of the way.
00:00:21.470 --> 00:00:25.440
Insert the nozzle all the way,
making sure it goes through both flaps.
00:00:25.440 --> 00:00:29.290
Fill up, then wait five seconds
before removing the nozzle and
00:00:29.290 --> 00:00:30.780
close the fuel door.
00:00:30.780 --> 00:00:32.840
If you're using a portable fuel container,
00:00:32.840 --> 00:00:36.160
you'll need to use the easy fuel funnel
provided with your vehicle to avoid
00:00:36.160 --> 00:00:38.470
damaging the seals on
the spring loaded flaps.
00:00:39.540 --> 00:00:43.720
And one more thing, to help protect
against fuel theft, splashing, or
00:00:43.720 --> 00:00:47.770
water getting in the tank, the capless
fuel filler is tamper resistant.
00:00:47.770 --> 00:00:51.440
And the self closing, spring loaded flaps
help keep fuel from sloshing out and
00:00:51.440 --> 00:00:54.550
water from leaking in when it rains or
when you wash your vehicle.
00:00:54.550 --> 00:00:55.650
Any questions?
00:00:55.650 --> 00:00:56.919
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:56.919 --> 00:01:06.919
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Easy Fuel Capless Fuel Filler _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Eh3snbTNR1k_seg1.mp4
question: How do you open the fuel door?

video_name: Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk
video_trans:
00:00:13.790 --> 00:00:16.520
Brake Coach works to help you
maximize the amount of energy
00:00:16.520 --> 00:00:19.350
captured through your
regenerative braking system.
00:00:19.350 --> 00:00:21.910
Regenerative braking works with
your standard brake system by
00:00:21.910 --> 00:00:25.170
recovering energy that is usually
lost through your friction brakes and
00:00:25.170 --> 00:00:27.350
engine drag during braking or coasting.
00:00:27.350 --> 00:00:31.810
And then storing that recovered energy
in your battery to help maximize efficiency.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk_seg2.mp4
question: How does regenerative braking work?

video_name: What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I
video_trans:
00:01:06.360 --> 00:01:09.450
And if you want to adjust
your interior illumination,
00:01:09.450 --> 00:01:12.920
meaning how bright your instrument
lights are, just press the plus or
00:01:12.920 --> 00:01:15.720
minus controls next to
the auto lamp controls.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I_seg4.mp4

video_name: Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU
video_trans:
00:01:37.610 --> 00:01:40.350
Your vehicle also has
something called side sensing.
00:01:40.350 --> 00:01:44.550
It's an enhancement to your forward and
reverse sensing systems that uses a chime
00:01:44.550 --> 00:01:48.420

touchscreen with red, yellow, and green
00:01:48.420 --> 00:01:52.160
highlights to indicate where the closest
object to your vehicle is detected.
00:01:52.160 --> 00:01:54.880
Red indicates the closest,
and green the farthest away.
00:01:56.054 --> 00:01:57.543
Any questions?
00:01:57.543 --> 00:01:59.036
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:59.036 --> 00:02:09.036
[MUSIC]

Your second row seats can move forward and

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:03:05.580 --> 00:03:08.610
To do so, touch the Alert button here.
00:03:08.610 --> 00:03:10.760
Then the Enable Alerts button.
00:03:10.760 --> 00:03:14.970
To set an alert, anytime you hear a song
or artist you want to be notified of,
00:03:14.970 --> 00:03:19.210
touch the Alert button,
choose either the artist, song title, or
00:03:19.210 --> 00:03:20.989
both, to add them to your alert.
00:03:22.030 --> 00:03:24.710
You'll get a message letting
you know they've been saved.
00:03:24.710 --> 00:03:26.470
Now, anytime that song or
00:03:26.470 --> 00:03:30.210
artist is being played on any channel
you'll receive a message on your screen
00:03:30.210 --> 00:03:35.150
asking if you'd like to tune to that
channel, delete, or disable alerts.

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:48.710 --> 00:00:51.282
Here are a few things you should know.
00:00:51.282 --> 00:00:55.670
Auto Start Stop will not shut
your engine off at every stop if
00:00:55.670 --> 00:00:59.510
the engine is still warming up,
if the outside temperature is too hot or
00:00:59.510 --> 00:01:03.710
too cold, or if the heat and
air conditioning is in high use.
00:01:03.710 --> 00:01:08.750
So if your AC's on because it's hot
outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:08.750 --> 00:01:12.490
It may also restart while stopped
to maintain interior comfort or
00:01:12.490 --> 00:01:14.420
to recharge the battery.
00:01:14.420 --> 00:01:17.680
Also, if you're towing a trailer or
using the four high or
00:01:17.680 --> 00:01:21.290
four low feature of the four-wheel
drive system, the start/stop feature
00:01:21.290 --> 00:01:25.180
automatically shuts off and will turn on
again once you disable those features.
00:01:26.260 --> 00:01:29.590
You can also use the five-way switch
located on your steering wheel
00:01:29.590 --> 00:01:33.540
to get to the information on demand screen
which tells you if your engine is off or
00:01:33.540 --> 00:01:34.350
why it's still running.
00:01:35.510 --> 00:01:39.130
And one more thing, your vehicle is
equipped with a heavy duty starter and
00:01:39.130 --> 00:01:42.268
battery to compensate for
the increased number of starts and stops.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg3.mp4
question: What is the best  tempeture for optimum functioning?

video_name: Proper Clutch Pedal Operation _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GW_gOBEPCYE
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.603
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.603 --> 00:00:06.620
To help avoid damaging
your transmission and
00:00:06.620 --> 00:00:08.691
to help provide a better
driving experience,
00:00:08.691 --> 00:00:12.640
there are a few things you should know
about proper clutch pedal operation.
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:14.215
Let me explain.
00:00:14.215 --> 00:00:18.445
The manual transmission in your vehicle
has six gears along with a reverse gear.
00:00:18.445 --> 00:00:22.265
When starting your vehicle, make sure that
your clutch pedal is fully depressed.
00:00:22.265 --> 00:00:25.575
In order for your transmission and
clutch to function at it's best,
00:00:25.575 --> 00:00:29.520
you need to press the clutch pedal all
the way to the floor before every shift.
00:00:29.520 --> 00:00:32.440
Then slowly release it while
pressing the accelerator.
00:00:32.440 --> 00:00:35.280
Not pressing the clutch pedal fully
between shifts can damage your
00:00:35.280 --> 00:00:40.780
transmission, and you may experience
a grinding sound, rapid jerking motion,
00:00:40.780 --> 00:00:44.400
or the car may stall if the clutch
is not properly engaged.
00:00:44.400 --> 00:00:46.080
And here's another thing you should know.
00:00:46.080 --> 00:00:48.920
Don't drive with your foot
resting on the clutch pedal, or
00:00:48.920 --> 00:00:52.230
use it to hold your vehicle at
a standstill while waiting on a hill.
00:00:52.230 --> 00:00:55.670
Doing so may overheat the clutch and
prematurely wear it out.
00:00:55.670 --> 00:00:58.548
This could nullify
a clutch warranty claim.
00:00:58.548 --> 00:00:59.583
Any questions?
00:00:59.583 --> 00:01:02.556
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:02.556 --> 00:01:12.556
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Proper Clutch Pedal Operation _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GW_gOBEPCYE_seg1.mp4
question: What can happen if the clutch is not properly engaged?

video_trans:

There are a few things that you may
need to know to prevent damaging them.
00:00:48.950 --> 00:00:51.430
Before you put a jack
underneath your vehicle,
00:00:51.430 --> 00:00:54.790
you'll need to ensure that the power
running boards are turned off.
00:00:54.790 --> 00:00:58.400
Also, when using a jack,
be sure to check your owner's manual for
00:00:58.400 --> 00:01:00.440
proper mounting locations.
00:01:00.440 --> 00:01:04.510
And when using a hoist lift be sure to
place the lift arms under the frame rails
00:01:04.510 --> 00:01:09.130
at all times to avoid damage to the under
body and running board components.
00:01:09.130 --> 00:01:10.250
Any questions?

video_name: Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA
video_trans:
00:00:11.960 --> 00:00:14.580
First, keep in mind that
convertible top fabric
00:00:14.580 --> 00:00:16.710
does not promote mildew growth itself.
00:00:16.710 --> 00:00:20.705
Mildew may develop on dirt or
other foreign substances if not removed.
00:00:20.705 --> 00:00:25.090
So keeping the fabric clean through
regular washings will enhance the life and
00:00:25.090 --> 00:00:26.696
beauty of the top material.
00:00:26.696 --> 00:00:29.595
When washing vehicles
with cloth top roofs.
00:00:29.595 --> 00:00:33.012
Start by vacuuming with a soft
bristle brush attachment and
00:00:33.012 --> 00:00:35.070
be sure to use a non detergent soap.
00:00:35.070 --> 00:00:40.925
Scrub gently in a circular pattern using
a terrycloth towel or soft bristle brush.
00:00:40.925 --> 00:00:44.030
More specifically horse hair or
soft nylon.
00:00:44.030 --> 00:00:45.950
Do not use stiff bristle brushes or
00:00:45.950 --> 00:00:49.420
any abrasive materials or
cleaners as they can damage the fabric.
00:00:50.840 --> 00:00:54.760
When finished, rinse thoroughly
removing all soap residues.
00:00:54.760 --> 00:00:59.040
Allow the top to air dry completely
before folding it otherwise, mold or
00:00:59.040 --> 00:01:02.340
mildew may develop and
discolor the cloth material.
00:01:02.340 --> 00:01:07.090
To clean away lint debris like cottonwood,
use a standard clothes lint roller or
00:01:07.090 --> 00:01:09.320
a vacuum attachment with
a soft bristle brush.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA_seg2.mp4
question: How to wash vehicle with cloth type roofs?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:01:55.850 --> 00:01:59.360
Now, I'm going to tell you how to place
the checkered sticker I just mentioned.
00:01:59.360 --> 00:02:03.473
The sticker acts as a target with
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist feature and
00:02:03.473 --> 00:02:07.537
rear-view camera used to track which
direction the trailer is moving.
00:02:07.537 --> 00:02:09.147
Take the checkered target sticker and
00:02:09.147 --> 00:02:11.419
measurement card with you
to the rear of the vehicle.
00:02:11.419 --> 00:02:15.521
You want to place the sticker within 7 to
22 inches from the center of the trailer
00:02:15.521 --> 00:02:16.198
hitch ball.
00:02:16.198 --> 00:02:19.879
You'll need to make sure to place the
sticker on a flat horizontal service that
00:02:19.879 --> 00:02:21.681
is visible by the rear-view camera.
00:02:21.681 --> 00:02:24.369
This is where an assistant
would be helpful.
00:02:24.369 --> 00:02:28.192
One the sticker is in place, you'll
need to use your tape measure to get and
00:02:28.192 --> 00:02:29.841
record several measurements.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg4.mp4
question: How to place the checkered sticker?

video_name: Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E
video_trans:
00:00:13.160 --> 00:00:14.870
With your front seats upright, look for
00:00:14.870 --> 00:00:18.560
the storage latch on the bottom
of the middle seat cushion, here.
00:00:18.560 --> 00:00:20.860
Pull the latch to release the seat and
pull it back.
00:00:21.950 --> 00:00:23.390
To access the cup holders,
00:00:23.390 --> 00:00:27.010
open the console lid, then lift
the cup holder tray out of the bin,
00:00:27.010 --> 00:00:32.330
spin it around, and latch it into place by
inserting the plastic tabs into the slots.
00:00:32.330 --> 00:00:35.180
Now push the seat cushion back into place.
00:00:35.180 --> 00:00:37.010
When you hear it latch,
you'll know it's secure.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E_seg2.mp4
question: how do you access the cup holders?

video_name: Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc
video_trans:
00:00:44.400 --> 00:00:48.970
Just push up on the stalk to the single
triangle for a normal, continuous wipe, or
00:00:48.970 --> 00:00:50.840
to the double triangle for faster wiping.
00:00:52.090 --> 00:00:54.560
To wash the windshield,
just pull the stock towards you.
00:00:55.630 --> 00:00:57.840
So far, so good, right?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc_seg3.mp4
question: How do you turn on the windshield wipers so that they engage at a normal continuous wipe?

video_name: Automatic Headlamps With Wiper-Activated Headlamp Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-FOL9B-e2Oz8
video_trans:
00:00:45.461 --> 00:00:48.467
Of course, if you don't want your
lights to stay on that long,
00:00:48.467 --> 00:00:51.260
you could always change the duration.
00:00:51.260 --> 00:00:55.306
Just go to the message center,
scroll to Settings, Lightning and
00:00:55.306 --> 00:00:56.687
then Autolamp Delay.
00:00:56.687 --> 00:01:00.422
Here you can select the length of
time you want them to stay on for.

video_name: Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI
video_trans:
00:01:41.440 --> 00:01:46.261
For more convenience, you can also set
it up to send you automatic reminders to
00:01:46.261 --> 00:01:50.935
prompt you to run a report by pressing on,
and then choose whether you want to
00:01:50.935 --> 00:01:55.338
be reminded every 5,000,
7,500, or 10,000 miles.
00:01:55.338 --> 00:01:59.490
You can opt out at any time by
turning automatic reminders off.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg5.mp4

video_name: Storage   Mustang _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oF8We3Di4Z0
video_trans:
00:00:17.339 --> 00:00:22.790
The center console has room for CD cases,
media devices, and charging cords.
00:00:22.790 --> 00:00:26.180
As well as a coin tray to store extra
change so you don't have to dig for
00:00:26.180 --> 00:00:27.590
it the next time you need it.
00:00:27.590 --> 00:00:32.810
The center console is also equipped with
a USB port, an auxiliary input jack and
00:00:32.810 --> 00:00:36.240
an SD card slot so
you can plug in your media devices.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Storage   Mustang _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oF8We3Di4Z0_seg3.mp4
question: Where is the sd card slot located?

video_trans:
00:01:34.980 --> 00:01:39.300
One more thing, if at any time you lose an
electrical connection to the trailer, you'll
00:01:39.300 --> 00:01:42.330
see a warning message in the instrument
cluster and hear an audible alert.

video_trans:
00:00:16.040 --> 00:00:19.980
The charge cord may be located behind
the driver's seat, depending on model.
00:00:19.980 --> 00:00:22.880
Just lift the carpeted
floor panel to access it.

video_name: Forward Collision Warning with Brake Support - F-Series _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1MCegMMMIS0
video_trans:
00:00:14.740 --> 00:00:18.920
The forward collision warning with brake
support, uses a radar sensor to detect
00:00:18.920 --> 00:00:22.445
slower moving vehicles traveling
in the same direction as you and
00:00:22.445 --> 00:00:24.880
warns you if you're
rapidly approaching them.
00:00:24.880 --> 00:00:28.520
If this happens, a red warning light
will illuminate on your windshield and
00:00:28.520 --> 00:00:30.110
the warning chime will sound.
00:00:30.110 --> 00:00:33.120
If you don't react after the alert and
continue to get closer to
00:00:33.120 --> 00:00:36.870
the other vehicle, the system will
pre-charge your breaks for rapid breaking.
00:00:36.870 --> 00:00:39.420
So, they can respond faster once
you do press your brake pedal.
00:00:40.470 --> 00:00:43.720
Once your brakes have been pre-charged,
even if you press them lightly,
00:00:43.720 --> 00:00:46.300
they'll apply full stopping
power to help stop you quickly.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Forward Collision Warning with Brake Support - F-Series _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1MCegMMMIS0_seg2.mp4
question: How does forward collision warning warn you if you are rapidly approaching another car?

video_name: MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM
video_trans:
00:00:51.980 --> 00:00:55.130
In addition to being able to personalize
your left side screen choices,
00:00:55.130 --> 00:00:58.734
there are also a few screens that
are only available in MyView.
00:00:58.734 --> 00:01:03.010
Like Accessory Power, which indicates the
electrical power demands being put on your
00:01:03.010 --> 00:01:04.650
vehicle from your climate system, and
00:01:04.650 --> 00:01:08.680
other accessories like your radio,
headlights, and windshield wipers.
00:01:08.680 --> 00:01:12.700
Coolant temp, which indicates if your
engine temperature is normal, or high.
00:01:12.700 --> 00:01:16.550
Keep in mind, whichever two choices you
select, the far right side of the screen
00:01:16.550 --> 00:01:19.540
will always display your fuel gauge and
battery gauge.
00:01:19.540 --> 00:01:20.860
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM_seg3.mp4
question: What are some examples of screens that are only available in MyView?

video_name: SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0
video_trans:
00:01:09.170 --> 00:01:13.070
To manually shift gears,
move your gear shift from D to M.
00:01:13.070 --> 00:01:15.820
Now, only your current gear will appear.
00:01:15.820 --> 00:01:19.590
And you can use the plus button to up
shift and the minus to down shift.
00:01:19.590 --> 00:01:23.690
Keep in mind, even though you're manually
changing gears, SelectShift will prevent
00:01:23.690 --> 00:01:28.510
some shifts if your engine speed is
too high or if your RPMs are too low.
00:01:28.510 --> 00:01:32.710
And if you come to a stop while in Manual
Mode, the transmission will automatically
00:01:32.710 --> 00:01:36.600
downshift to a lower gear for
easier acceleration when you drive away.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0_seg4.mp4
question: How do I switch to manual shift?

video_name: LED Lighting Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eAHk8oAbhyk
video_trans:
00:01:00.588 --> 00:01:05.024
High visibility LED box lights in the box
interior make it easy to find and
00:01:05.024 --> 00:01:07.350
load items in the dark.
00:01:07.350 --> 00:01:11.020
There are two lights located in
the rear corners that shine forward.
00:01:11.020 --> 00:01:14.770
There is also one in the high mounted
stop lamp on the rear of the cab.
00:01:14.770 --> 00:01:19.780
To turn them on and off from inside the
cab, just press the box lighting button, here.
00:01:19.780 --> 00:01:22.760
After ten minutes they
will turn off gradually.

To start your vehicle,
once inside just press and

push the Engine Start Stop button.

video_name: Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk
video_trans:
00:00:31.810 --> 00:00:36.120
When you come to a stop, the Brake Coach
screen appears in your display.
00:00:36.120 --> 00:00:38.830
And shows you your
braking efficiency score.
00:00:38.830 --> 00:00:41.820
You'll get higher percentages by
coming to gradual stops and
00:00:41.820 --> 00:00:46.220
100% means that you maximize
your braking efficiency.
00:00:46.230 --> 00:00:49.060
If at any time you want a quick
refresher on what this feature is,
00:00:49.076 --> 00:00:52.260
use the five way control on the left
side of your steering wheel.
00:00:52.260 --> 00:00:56.420
Go to the Main Menu,
scroll to Information, Tutorial,
00:00:56.420 --> 00:00:59.320
then select Brake Coach and
a brief description will appear.

video_trans:
00:02:03.200 --> 00:02:07.270
Replay allows you to listen to up to 44
minutes of previously cast contents from
00:02:07.270 --> 00:02:08.000
the current channel.
00:02:09.280 --> 00:02:13.060
The system will begin storing
content once a channel is selected.
00:02:13.060 --> 00:02:16.570
To replay a song,
just tape the seek back button once and
00:02:16.570 --> 00:02:18.700
it will jump back to the prior song.
00:02:18.700 --> 00:02:20.290
To jump multiple songs or
00:02:20.290 --> 00:02:24.960
listen to content farther back,
tap the seek back button multiple times.
00:02:24.960 --> 00:02:28.640
To return to real time content,
touch the Replay button again and
00:02:28.640 --> 00:02:31.040
it will bring you back to live audio.

video_name: How to Use Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GZQFXF_db7g
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.323
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.323 --> 00:00:07.842
Did you know your vehicle may be equipped
with a convenient feature that helps make
00:00:07.842 --> 00:00:10.070
maneuvering a trailer in reverse easy?
00:00:10.070 --> 00:00:12.320
It's called Pro Trailer Backup Assist.
00:00:12.320 --> 00:00:13.590
Let me tell you about it.
00:00:13.590 --> 00:00:15.940
Whether you're backing
a trailer into a job site or
00:00:15.940 --> 00:00:20.930
launching a boat, if you can turn a knob,
you can now back up your trailer with ease.
00:00:20.930 --> 00:00:23.630
Which means, whichever direction
you want your trailer to go,
00:00:23.630 --> 00:00:27.640
just turn the knob in that direction and
the system will take over the steering,
00:00:27.640 --> 00:00:30.770
instead of having to turn the wheel
in the opposite direction.
00:00:30.770 --> 00:00:34.150
To use it, press the center button on
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist knob.
00:00:34.150 --> 00:00:36.660
A list of available trailers will appear.
00:00:36.660 --> 00:00:37.840
Choose the one you want and
00:00:37.840 --> 00:00:40.990
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
will attempt to locate it.
00:00:40.990 --> 00:00:44.010
Once the targeting sticker is
located by the rearview camera,
00:00:44.010 --> 00:00:47.170
the screen will prompt you to
shift into reverse to activate it.
00:00:47.170 --> 00:00:50.450
Then follow the prompts displayed
on the information screen.
00:00:50.450 --> 00:00:52.390
With your hands off the steering wheel,
00:00:52.390 --> 00:00:55.820
use the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
knob to steer the trailer.
00:00:55.820 --> 00:00:59.730
Turn the knob left, or counter-clockwise,
when you want the rear of the trailer to
00:00:59.730 --> 00:01:04.340
go to the left, and right,
clockwise, to go right.
00:01:04.340 --> 00:01:07.070
You should also make it a habit
to use your side view mirrors
00:01:07.070 --> 00:01:10.230
as your primary visual aid
while maneuvering the trailer.
00:01:10.230 --> 00:01:14.190
Once the trailer is moving in
the direction you want, release the knob.
00:01:14.190 --> 00:01:17.450
Keep in mind, you may need to make
small adjustments with the knob to
00:01:17.450 --> 00:01:20.060
keep the trailer moving
along the desired path.
00:01:20.060 --> 00:01:23.820
As soon as the knob is either released or
turned back to the center position,
00:01:23.820 --> 00:01:26.132
the vehicle will follow
the trailer's path.
00:01:26.132 --> 00:01:28.660
You'll need to control the accelerator and
brakes.
00:01:28.660 --> 00:01:29.712
Any questions?
00:01:29.712 --> 00:01:31.599
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:01:31.599 --> 00:01:41.599
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Use Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GZQFXF_db7g_seg1.mp4
question: What should you use as your primary visual aid while maneuvering the trailer in reverse with Pro Trailer Backup Assist?

video_trans:

To turn it on, simply press the button
located on your gear shift lever.
00:01:30.699 --> 00:01:34.500
You'll know what's on when you see it
illuminated in your instrument cluster.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ_seg7.mp4

video_name: Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk
video_trans:
00:00:54.680 --> 00:00:57.700
The green area of the gauge
represents miles per charge
00:00:57.700 --> 00:01:00.590
that is greater than the rated value for
your vehicle.
00:01:00.590 --> 00:01:01.640
Still with me?
00:01:01.640 --> 00:01:02.740
Great.

video_name: USB Smart Charging _ Ford How-To _ Ford-p5P3bNlMr0c
video_trans:
00:00:25.360 --> 00:00:29.640
Unlike traditional USB charging ports
that provide 500 milliamps of power and
00:00:29.640 --> 00:00:31.060
can only charge a smartphone or
00:00:31.060 --> 00:00:35.260
media player, smart USB chargers can
provide up to two amps, and know just
00:00:35.260 --> 00:00:38.080
the right amount of power to deliver
to whatever device you're charging.
00:00:39.120 --> 00:00:42.743
Meaning, if you have one device plugged
in that needs two amps to charge, and
00:00:42.743 --> 00:00:46.255
another plugged in at the same time
that only needs one amp to fully charge,
00:00:46.255 --> 00:00:49.029
your smart USB port will deliver
the right amount to both.
00:00:49.029 --> 00:00:52.292
And that can help save battery power for
your vehicle.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/USB Smart Charging _ Ford How-To _ Ford-p5P3bNlMr0c_seg3.mp4
question: What does the new usb port features?

video_name: F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ
video_trans:
00:00:44.950 --> 00:00:48.607
In addition, your rear-view camera has
an enhancement that shows you an image of
00:00:48.607 --> 00:00:50.453
what's directly behind your vehicle.
00:00:50.453 --> 00:00:52.361
It's called Dynamic Hitch Assist and
00:00:52.361 --> 00:00:56.541
it has guidelines that can help you line up
your trailer when you're connecting it.
00:00:56.541 --> 00:01:00.271
The image appears in your center display
to help you maneuver when you're in
00:01:00.271 --> 00:01:04.710
reverse and to help you accurately
connect to your trailer without help.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ_seg4.mp4
question: How can the trailer be accurately connected?

Did you know that you can equip
a trailer with a feature that allows
00:00:07.200 --> 00:00:09.876

provide a warning if the tires of
00:00:09.876 --> 00:00:13.350

are significantly underinflated?
00:00:13.350 --> 00:00:14.850

00:00:14.850 --> 00:00:18.140
If one or more tires of a connected
trailer become underinflated,
00:00:18.140 --> 00:00:22.120
the trailer tire pressure monitoring
system, or TPMS, will display
00:00:22.120 --> 00:00:25.670
a pop-up warning in your instrument
display indicating which tire is low.
00:00:26.790 --> 00:00:27.623
Any questions?
00:00:27.623 --> 00:00:29.513
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:29.513 --> 00:00:39.513
[MUSIC]
