video_name: SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek
video_trans:
00:00:17.540 --> 00:00:21.110
An easy to read colorful homescreen
conveniently displays the phone and
00:00:21.110 --> 00:00:22.330
audio features.
00:00:22.330 --> 00:00:26.810
As well as new available navigation
screen, with a convientant swipe and
00:00:26.810 --> 00:00:29.808
pinch to zoom feature,
similar to your smart phone.
00:00:29.808 --> 00:00:33.160
And a redesigned feature bar is now
present along the bottom of the touch
00:00:33.160 --> 00:00:36.540
screen for a simple,
straightforward user experience.
00:00:36.540 --> 00:00:40.670
Keep in mind, if the feature menu bar
retracts below the display screen,
00:00:40.670 --> 00:00:44.270
you can simply touch the controls button
on the bottom left of the screen, here.

Did you know you can open or
00:00:05.774 --> 00:00:09.400
close your window all the way without
having to hold the button down?
00:00:09.400 --> 00:00:11.190
Here are a few simple
steps on how to use it.
00:00:12.320 --> 00:00:15.800
To open your window all the way,
press the switch down firmly and let go.
00:00:17.110 --> 00:00:20.270
To open it just a little, press it lightly
and let go when you want it to stop.

And during warmer weather, reduce
the energy needed for air conditioning by

video_name: Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM
video_trans:
00:00:13.395 --> 00:00:18.150
If your vehicle is equipped with a third
row power fold, you can use the power seat
00:00:18.150 --> 00:00:23.100
buttons located behind the third
row to fold the left, right, or
00:00:23.100 --> 00:00:29.370
both seats to either a stow, fold,
tailgate, or normal position.
00:00:29.370 --> 00:00:31.410
If you have a second row power fold and
00:00:31.410 --> 00:00:33.960
tumble control,
just press the button once, and
00:00:33.960 --> 00:00:38.720
the seat will automatically fold and then
tumble forward to access the third row.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM_seg2.mp4
question: Can you fold all of the third row seats down?

video_name: Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk
video_trans:
00:00:35.570 --> 00:00:39.810
Trip view mode gives you a four quadrant
look that displays trip one and two.
00:00:39.810 --> 00:00:43.870
Both of which allow you to see your timer,
instantaneous fuel economy,
00:00:43.870 --> 00:00:46.620
miles traveled, and
average miles per gallon.
00:00:46.620 --> 00:00:50.340
Under the same mode, you also have a fuel
economy screen that displays your average
00:00:50.340 --> 00:00:55.430
miles per gallon, an instantaneous fuel
economy graph, miles to empty, and
00:00:55.430 --> 00:01:00.210
a fuel history which shows a bar graph of
your fuel history over a period of time,
00:01:00.210 --> 00:01:03.670
a compass as well as your
Auto StartStop status.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk_seg3.mp4
question: What does trip/fuel mode do?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:00:16.900 --> 00:00:21.180
Adaptive cruise control with stop and go
keeps a constant speed without having to
00:00:21.180 --> 00:00:25.510
use the accelerator and brake pedal but it
also automatically maintains a comfortable
00:00:25.510 --> 00:00:28.330
preset distance from
the vehicle in front of you and
00:00:28.330 --> 00:00:31.350
can bring the vehicle to a complete
stop if needed in heavy traffic.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg2.mp4
question: How does the car control itself when the adaptive cruise control is on ?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:02:12.160 --> 00:02:16.400
To unfold the second row seats,
pull the longer strap on the seat back up.
00:02:16.400 --> 00:02:20.020
When you feel it unlock from the floor,
move the entire seat back and
00:02:20.020 --> 00:02:22.690
push down until you feel it
lock into position again.
00:02:22.690 --> 00:02:24.622
And until you hear it click.
00:02:24.622 --> 00:02:27.481
Finally, pull up on the short strap and
flip the seat back up.
00:02:27.481 --> 00:02:30.019
[MUSIC]
00:02:30.019 --> 00:02:31.043
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg5.mp4

video_name: Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc
video_trans:
00:01:06.820 --> 00:01:08.680
If you have the available power seats,
00:01:08.680 --> 00:01:12.510
using the switch located on the side of
the seat you can move the seats forward or
00:01:12.510 --> 00:01:15.320
backward by sliding it forward or
backward.
00:01:15.330 --> 00:01:18.970
To raise the seat bottom,
move the switch up or down.
00:01:20.160 --> 00:01:24.050
And to tilt, just lift the front of
the switch to tilt backward and
00:01:24.050 --> 00:01:25.500
press down to tilt forward.
00:01:25.500 --> 00:01:29.406
To set the firmest of the lumbar
support using the lumbar button,
00:01:29.406 --> 00:01:35.654
here, press the front of it to increase
the firmness and the back to decrease it.
00:01:35.654 --> 00:01:36.635
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc_seg5.mp4
question: Does the car have lumbar adjustment?

video_name: Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM
video_trans:
00:00:38.720 --> 00:00:42.410
Your second row seats can move forward and
back by lifting the bar under the front of
00:00:42.410 --> 00:00:45.399
the seat, and then sliding
the entire seat in either direction.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM_seg3.mp4

video_name: Headlamp Adjustment _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Sp3McTgj4ck
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en

[MUSIC]
00:00:03.554 --> 00:00:05.600
>> Why do people keep flashing
their headlamps at me?
00:00:06.850 --> 00:00:09.810
>> Why do my headlamps seem too
high when I'm towing my boat?
00:00:11.810 --> 00:00:13.705
>> Why am I having a hard
time seeing the road?
00:00:15.255 --> 00:00:17.945
>> If you're adding extra weight
to the rear of your vehicle,
00:00:17.945 --> 00:00:22.375
such as hauling a trailer or boat,
it may make your headlamps appear unlevel.
00:00:23.565 --> 00:00:26.220
And that might mean you'll
have to readjust them.
00:00:26.220 --> 00:00:27.370
I know what you're thinking.
00:00:27.370 --> 00:00:29.830
But don't worry, this won't be hard.

video_name: Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c
video_trans:
00:00:26.460 --> 00:00:29.570
To lock your doors, simply press
the sensor on the door handle for
00:00:29.570 --> 00:00:30.890
about a half a second.
00:00:30.890 --> 00:00:33.470
It'll have ridges or
a square sensor like this.
00:00:34.530 --> 00:00:36.300
When you hear them click,
you'll know they're locked.
00:00:37.450 --> 00:00:41.090
Or you can press the lock/unlock
button on the inside door panel
00:00:41.090 --> 00:00:44.280
before closing the door and
it will automatically lock.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c_seg3.mp4

video_name: Hands Free Liftgate _ Ford How-to _ Ford-nmWSzJn1Dfk
video_trans:
00:00:33.700 --> 00:00:37.760
If you don't want to use the hands-free
capability, you can always use the lift
00:00:37.760 --> 00:00:41.700
gate button on your key fob,
the button on the instrument panel, or
00:00:41.700 --> 00:00:45.000
the button located on the lift gate
handle just below the license plate.
00:00:46.060 --> 00:00:49.620
One more thing, if your vehicle is
equipped with an available trailer tow
00:00:49.620 --> 00:00:54.190
package, to open or close the lift gate,
just kick under the bumper to the left or
00:00:54.190 --> 00:00:56.120
right of the tow hitch.
00:00:56.120 --> 00:00:57.270
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Hands Free Liftgate _ Ford How-to _ Ford-nmWSzJn1Dfk_seg4.mp4
question: How can I open the trunk without using the no-hands feature?

video_name: Global-Open Windows Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-RTxhpkZucWw
video_trans:
00:00:15.750 --> 00:00:19.831
To open all of your windows at once and
vent the moon roof if you have one,
00:00:19.831 --> 00:00:24.141
press and hold the unlock button on
your key fob for at least three seconds.
00:00:24.141 --> 00:00:27.449
If you want to stop them from opening,
just press the lock or
00:00:27.449 --> 00:00:28.738
unlock button again.
00:00:28.738 --> 00:00:30.999
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Global-Open Windows Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-RTxhpkZucWw_seg2.mp4
question: How do you open all the windows at once and vent the moon roof?

video_name: Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk
video_trans:
00:00:10.560 --> 00:00:14.130
Let me tell you about it. The message
center or the productivity screen
00:00:14.130 --> 00:00:17.920
has a 4.2 inch screen that's located
between the tachometer and speedometer.
00:00:19.030 --> 00:00:21.720
Use the five-way switch on the left
side of your steering wheel
00:00:21.720 --> 00:00:26.190
to scroll to the main menu. From here, you
can get to display mode, which shows
00:00:26.190 --> 00:00:29.940
you your distance to empty, transmission
temperature, tire pressure for
00:00:29.940 --> 00:00:34.570
each wheel, engine information,
MyKey status and a digital speedometer.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk_seg2.mp4
question: How to operate pro activity screen?

video_name: EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM
video_trans:
00:01:34.090 --> 00:01:38.040
Of course, if you rather not use the
ECO Cruise feature it can be turned off
00:01:38.040 --> 00:01:41.265
using the five we controls on
the left side of the steering wheel.
00:01:41.265 --> 00:01:44.130
And scroll into settings in
your information display.
00:01:44.130 --> 00:01:47.490
Drivers Assist ECO Cruise then off.
00:01:47.490 --> 00:01:51.140
When ECO Cruise has been turned off
the next time you set a cruising speed,
00:01:51.140 --> 00:01:52.724
you will be using standard cruise control.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM_seg5.mp4
question: Where are the controls located?

video_name: Global-Open Windows Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-RTxhpkZucWw
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.900
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.900 --> 00:00:09.536
Your vehicle may have a feature that lets
you open or close your windows with your
00:00:09.536 --> 00:00:13.620
key file and that can help you cool
the inside of your car before you get in.
00:00:13.620 --> 00:00:14.690
Let me show you how it works.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Global-Open Windows Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-RTxhpkZucWw_seg1.mp4

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:00:24.510 --> 00:00:29.400
Let me explain, adaptive steering with
tow/haul mode, changes the ratio between
00:00:29.400 --> 00:00:32.570
the driver's actions with the steering
wheel, meaning how much the driver
00:00:32.570 --> 00:00:36.630
turns the steering wheel, and
how much the front wheels actually turn.
00:00:36.630 --> 00:00:39.660
At slower speeds, this allows
the front wheels to fully turn,
00:00:39.660 --> 00:00:42.520
with fewer rotations
of the steering wheel,
00:00:42.520 --> 00:00:45.980
which is helpful when performing
low speed maneuvers like parking.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:48.280
When traveling at higher speeds,
on a highway for
00:00:48.280 --> 00:00:52.500
instance, this feature further
optimizes the steering response,
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.235
enabling the vehicle to react more
precisely to driver input and
00:00:56.235 --> 00:00:59.065
provide a smoother vehicle response
to your steering wheel input.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg2.mp4
question: What is adaptive steering tow haul mode?

video_name: Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg
video_trans:
00:01:13.640 --> 00:01:16.560
Automatic start allows you to
test at your own pace, and
00:01:16.560 --> 00:01:18.280
begins once you hit the accelerator pedal.
00:01:20.080 --> 00:01:23.580
If you want to end the automatic start,
just hit okay on the five-way switch.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg_seg5.mp4
question: What is the automatic start setting?

video_name: Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog
video_trans:
00:00:11.850 --> 00:00:15.020
To use the step, first lower the tailgate,
00:00:15.020 --> 00:00:18.950
then press the black release button in
the center of the step molding, here.
00:00:18.950 --> 00:00:20.470
The step will pop out a little, so
00:00:20.470 --> 00:00:23.360
just pull it all the way until it
gently falls into a lower position.
00:00:24.710 --> 00:00:27.860
Next, grab the yellow bar
top to the left of the step.
00:00:27.860 --> 00:00:30.410
Pull until the black bar
is fully extended and
00:00:30.410 --> 00:00:32.920
lift it up until it's locked into place.
00:00:32.920 --> 00:00:35.280
Then, pull the chrome interior
bar all of the way up.
00:00:36.450 --> 00:00:39.410
You'll know the bar is fully
extended when you hear a click.
00:00:39.410 --> 00:00:42.930
The bar can be used as a grab handle to
help pull yourself up into the truck bed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog_seg2.mp4
question: Can the tail gate be opened automatically?

video_name: Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs
video_trans:
00:00:35.700 --> 00:00:38.331
Once installed, when shifted into reverse,
00:00:38.331 --> 00:00:42.858
pressing the auxiliary button on your
Sync 3 touchscreen turns the camera on.
00:00:42.858 --> 00:00:45.430
A rear view image will then appear
on your center console display.
00:00:45.430 --> 00:00:48.532
The camera will turn off when
shifted out of reverse, or
00:00:48.532 --> 00:00:51.910
when another camera view is
selected from the touch screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs_seg3.mp4
question: What does pressing the Aux button on the Sync 3 touchscreen do when in reverse?

video_name: Rear Folding Seats with Side Release and Folding Head Restraints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nTO2w5-8rIA
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.364
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.364 --> 00:00:09.020
Did you know that you can fold
the back seat down in your vehicle?
00:00:09.020 --> 00:00:10.590
Here's how to do it.
00:00:10.590 --> 00:00:13.670
First, fold the outside
head restraints down and
00:00:13.670 --> 00:00:16.160
lower the center head restraint like this.
00:00:16.160 --> 00:00:20.830
Next, find the lever located on
the side of the seat base, here, and
00:00:20.830 --> 00:00:22.920
pull the level up to
fold the seat back down.
00:00:24.180 --> 00:00:28.250
To unfold your seats, just pull the seat
back up into the lock position.
00:00:28.250 --> 00:00:28.920
You'll hear a click.
00:00:30.160 --> 00:00:31.300
And on some vehicles,
00:00:31.300 --> 00:00:34.870
you may see a red indicator on
the lever to let you know it's locked.
00:00:34.870 --> 00:00:36.584
Just give it a slight pull to make sure.
00:00:36.584 --> 00:00:40.486
Any questions?
00:00:40.486 --> 00:00:40.986
Go to www.FordOwner.com.
00:00:40.986 --> 00:00:50.942
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Rear Folding Seats with Side Release and Folding Head Restraints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nTO2w5-8rIA_seg1.mp4
question: How do I know when my backseats are locked in place once I unfold them?

video_name: How To Maximize EV Range _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fq63BXNCGUs
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:04.630 --> 00:00:07.470
Did you know that there are a few
things you can do to maximize
00:00:07.470 --> 00:00:10.140
the electric range of your
plug in hybrid vehicle?
00:00:10.140 --> 00:00:13.560
As with any vehicle, there are some
basic rules you can follow.
00:00:13.560 --> 00:00:14.980
Let me explain.
00:00:14.980 --> 00:00:18.350
For starters, make sure to keep
your tires properly inflated,
00:00:18.350 --> 00:00:22.610
accelerate gradually from a stop,
brake smoothly, use heat and
00:00:22.610 --> 00:00:26.130
air conditioning moderately,
and maintain the speed limit.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Maximize EV Range _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fq63BXNCGUs_seg1.mp4
question: What are the benefits of maintaining the speed limit?

video_name: USB Smart Charging _ Ford How-To _ Ford-p5P3bNlMr0c
video_trans:
00:00:15.380 --> 00:00:18.340
You may have a USB smart charge
port located in the lower
00:00:18.340 --> 00:00:21.120
storage compartment in the central stack,
here.
00:00:21.120 --> 00:00:25.360
To open the storage compartment, just
press in on the chrome bar and let go.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/USB Smart Charging _ Ford How-To _ Ford-p5P3bNlMr0c_seg2.mp4
question: How do you open the lower storage compartment?

video_name: Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk
video_trans:
00:00:23.520 --> 00:00:27.080
To get to the screen, use the five-way
switch on your steering wheel and
00:00:27.080 --> 00:00:33.070
scroll to Engage, Empower, MyView,
and then Miles/Full Charge.
00:00:33.070 --> 00:00:36.730
This screen will also show up when
you select EV Now mode using the EV
00:00:36.730 --> 00:00:37.640
button here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk_seg3.mp4
question: How can you get to the miles/full charge screen?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:45.680 --> 00:01:50.260
Keep in mind, braking at any time turns
off the adaptive cruise control function
00:01:50.260 --> 00:01:52.860
and gives you manual control
of your speed again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg8.mp4
question: What will happen if you brake the car while cruise control is activated?

video_name: Storage   Mustang _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oF8We3Di4Z0
video_trans:
00:00:09.970 --> 00:00:11.860
For starters,
there's a storage compartment for
00:00:11.860 --> 00:00:14.215
your sunglasses just to
the left of the steering wheel.
00:00:14.215 --> 00:00:17.339
To open it, just push in on the door,
then pull it open.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Storage   Mustang _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oF8We3Di4Z0_seg2.mp4
question: how do you open the sunglass storage compartment?

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:00:11.300 --> 00:00:15.100
The power button located in the upper
left corner of the function control panel
00:00:15.100 --> 00:00:17.050
turns your climate system on.
00:00:17.050 --> 00:00:21.020
You also have fan speed controls,
a recirculated air button
00:00:21.020 --> 00:00:25.320
that let's you switch between outside air
and air circulated within the vehicle.
00:00:25.320 --> 00:00:28.990
A distribution control that allows you to
choose whether you want the air flow to
00:00:28.990 --> 00:00:32.005
come through the instrument panel vents,
floor vents or
00:00:32.005 --> 00:00:34.115
through the defrost vent at
the base of the wind shield.
00:00:35.205 --> 00:00:39.003
You'll also find an A/C button,
a rear defrost button and
00:00:39.003 --> 00:00:41.945
Max A/C and Max Defrost buttons.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550_seg2.mp4
question: Where can I find the power button to control the climate panel?

video_name: Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk
video_trans:
00:01:39.921 --> 00:01:44.632
Adaptive steering helps reduce under steer
at higher speeds, while allowing the front
00:01:44.660 --> 00:01:48.720
wheels to turn fully with fewer turns
of the steering wheel at lower speeds.
00:01:48.720 --> 00:01:51.640
And when used with tow haul
the vehicle delays upshifts and
00:01:51.646 --> 00:01:55.359
provides engine breaking when descending
hilly roads with heavy loads.
00:01:55.359 --> 00:01:56.568
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk_seg7.mp4
question: When used with Tow Haul, what does Adaptive Steering allow you to do?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:02:52.200 --> 00:02:55.140
By the way for
quicker more efficient charging,
00:02:55.140 --> 00:02:59.510
it's recommended to upgrade to
an available 240 volt charging station.
00:02:59.510 --> 00:03:04.180
This can allow you to fully charge in
one third of the time it takes than with
00:03:04.200 --> 00:03:07.915
the supplied 120 volt charging cord.
Any questions?
00:03:07.915 --> 00:03:09.393
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:03:09.393 --> 00:03:19.393
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg8.mp4
question: Do I need to upgrade my charging station?

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:01:10.071 --> 00:01:13.546
To access the battery compartment
on Transit Wagon models,
00:01:13.546 --> 00:01:17.973
first remove the protective plastic
molding, by pulling up on the tabs, and
00:01:17.973 --> 00:01:19.420
sliding it towards you.
00:01:19.420 --> 00:01:23.326
Next, lift the fabric covered trim by
pulling up on the tabs, and tuck, or
00:01:23.326 --> 00:01:25.074
fold it to keep it out of your way.
00:01:25.074 --> 00:01:28.962
You'll need to remove the rear metal
battery cover by unscrewing two fastening
00:01:28.962 --> 00:01:30.130
bolts, here and here.
00:01:31.350 --> 00:01:34.113
Next, unfasten the two electrical cords,
00:01:34.113 --> 00:01:38.526
by unclipping them from the fasteners
like this, and remove the bar.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg4.mp4
question: What do you need to do to remove the rear metal battery cover?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:28.460 --> 00:01:32.470
Once conditions are favorable for the
system to work, the lines will turn green.
00:01:32.470 --> 00:01:34.270
This means it's ready to go.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg6.mp4
question: Must the conditions be met before it can work?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.314 --> 00:00:05.412
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.412 --> 00:00:08.575
Did you know that there's a system in your
car that can alert you if you begin to
00:00:08.575 --> 00:00:10.150
drift from your lane?
00:00:10.150 --> 00:00:11.045
Let me tell you about it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg1.mp4
question: What is lane keeping system in a car ?

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:00:29.580 --> 00:00:31.031
To help power your upfit needs,
00:00:31.031 --> 00:00:34.630
we've increased the circuit capacity
over the previous generation.
00:00:34.630 --> 00:00:37.300
There are now four 25 amp circuits.
00:00:37.300 --> 00:00:42.010
Plus two 40 amp circuits which can be
configured to be hot at all times.
00:00:42.010 --> 00:00:43.890
So you don't need to have
the vehicle running for power.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs_seg3.mp4
question: how many 25 ampere circuits are there?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:50.630 --> 00:01:53.520
Using the turn signal for
lane changes deactivates it.
00:01:53.520 --> 00:01:57.720
So it won't interfere in daily
driving with frequent turns and stops.
00:01:57.720 --> 00:02:01.630
Keep in mind, if you're driving and
don't have a firm grip on the wheel, or
00:02:01.630 --> 00:02:05.360
if you're on a straight part of the road
that doesn't require much steering input,
00:02:05.360 --> 00:02:09.290
the car may think you're not holding on,
and may alert you to do so.
00:02:09.290 --> 00:02:10.400
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg8.mp4
question: Does the car alert you to hold on to the wheel if it doesn't think you're doing so?

video_name: Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.947
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.947 --> 00:00:09.731
Your Mustang has a feature that allows you
to do a burn out to heat up your tires for
00:00:09.731 --> 00:00:12.040
an improved track experience.
00:00:12.040 --> 00:00:15.430
It's called Line Lock and
it's part of the Track Apps feature.
00:00:15.430 --> 00:00:19.830
When turned on, the front brakes are
locked so the rear wheels can spin freely.
00:00:19.830 --> 00:00:23.690
This is helpful when doing a burnout to
heat up the tires for better traction.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo_seg1.mp4
question: How does line lock give you better traction?

video_name: Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs
video_trans:
00:01:50.650 --> 00:01:54.288
To heat your car up and defrost
the windshield and side windows quickly,
00:01:54.288 --> 00:01:58.296
adjust the temperature control to your
desired setting or select max defrost.
00:01:58.296 --> 00:02:01.446
This will automatically turn your
air distribution to defrost,
00:02:01.446 --> 00:02:06.180
set the temperature to the hottest level
and the air flow to the maximum setting.
00:02:06.180 --> 00:02:10.650
In mild or warm temperatures you may
notice that your A/C also turns on.
00:02:10.650 --> 00:02:13.320
It does this to help dehumidify
the air for defogging.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs_seg7.mp4
question: Why does my A/C turn on by itself?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:02:18.866 --> 00:02:23.348
To switch between adaptive cruise control
or normal cruise use the 5-way switch on
00:02:23.348 --> 00:02:26.134
your steering wheel and
the information displays.
00:02:26.134 --> 00:02:30.544
Select Driver Assist, Cruise Control,
then select Adaptive to enable,
00:02:30.544 --> 00:02:33.847
or in Normal for
a conventional cruise control system.
00:02:33.847 --> 00:02:36.399
Meaning, it will not
automatically adjust speed,
00:02:36.399 --> 00:02:38.782
based on the speed of
the vehicle in front of you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg9.mp4
question: Where can you look on the information display to turn on your cruise control?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:00:16.900 --> 00:00:21.180
Adaptive cruise control with stop and go
keeps a constant speed without having to
00:00:21.180 --> 00:00:25.510
use the accelerator and brake pedal but it
also automatically maintains a comfortable
00:00:25.510 --> 00:00:28.330
preset distance from
the vehicle in front of you and
00:00:28.330 --> 00:00:31.350
can bring the vehicle to a complete
stop if needed in heavy traffic.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg2.mp4
question: what situation  that make the vehicle stop, while using adaptive speed control?

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:01:18.930 --> 00:01:22.610
Keep in mind, to help remind you when
power is flowing through the switch,
00:01:22.610 --> 00:01:24.700
it will remain illuminated
to let you know it's on.
00:01:25.880 --> 00:01:26.658
Any questions?
00:01:26.658 --> 00:01:28.720
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:01:28.720 --> 00:01:38.720
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs_seg5.mp4
question: How does it remind you of the power flowing through the switch?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:01:49.340 --> 00:01:54.030
Keep in mind, the charge port light
illumination will time out after 1 minute.
00:01:54.030 --> 00:01:57.439
If a fault is detected at any time,
all the lights will flash continuously.
00:01:58.760 --> 00:02:02.930
And if the charge scheduled for later,
the number of lights which represents your
00:02:02.930 --> 00:02:06.140
current minimum state of
charge will be solidly lit.
00:02:06.140 --> 00:02:08.550
And the charge port lights
will timeout after one minute.

video_name: Adjustable Tilt_Telescoping Steering Column _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TlWXbGtYrTQ
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.321 --> 00:00:04.941
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.941 --> 00:00:09.051
Your steering wheel can be adjusted to
make driving even more comfortable,
00:00:09.051 --> 00:00:10.370
let me show you how.
00:00:10.370 --> 00:00:12.990
First, make sure you're
comfortable in your seat.
00:00:12.990 --> 00:00:15.550
This will ensure that you're moving
your wheel to the correct position.
00:00:16.730 --> 00:00:20.680
Now, unlock the steering column by
pulling the release lever either down and
00:00:20.680 --> 00:00:24.000
away or down and toward you.
00:00:24.000 --> 00:00:28.730
Move the steering wheel to a good spot for
you by tilting it up or down, or
00:00:28.730 --> 00:00:32.140
by either pulling it toward you or
pushing it away from you.
00:00:33.230 --> 00:00:35.750
Once you have it in the right position,
lock it by
00:00:35.750 --> 00:00:40.410
pushing the same lever you used to unlock
it, only in the opposite direction.
00:00:40.410 --> 00:00:41.590
Any questions?
00:00:41.590 --> 00:00:42.115
Go to
00:00:42.115 --> 00:00:52.115
FordOwner.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adjustable Tilt_Telescoping Steering Column _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TlWXbGtYrTQ_seg1.mp4
question: Can the steering wheel be adjusted?

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:00:45.300 --> 00:00:48.655
In order to convert the 40 amp
relays to key off battery use,
00:00:48.655 --> 00:00:50.565
there are a few steps you'll need to take.
00:00:50.565 --> 00:00:53.995
First, you'll need to locate
the relay box under the engine hood,
00:00:53.995 --> 00:00:56.015
next to the driver side fender, here.
00:00:57.115 --> 00:01:00.950
Then remove the relay cover by
pressing the tab and lifting it off.
00:01:00.950 --> 00:01:03.060
Next, locate the five amp fuse.
00:01:04.180 --> 00:01:07.900
You'll then need to pull it out,
slide the spacer over, and place it so
00:01:07.900 --> 00:01:12.740
the left prong is in the far left slot and
the right prong is in the middle slot.
00:01:12.740 --> 00:01:16.900
Replace the cover and your 40 amp circuits
are now set to run on battery power
00:01:16.900 --> 00:01:18.930
even with the key out of the truck.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs_seg4.mp4
question: How to convert the 40 amp relays to keep off battery use?

video_name: Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs
video_trans:
00:01:50.650 --> 00:01:54.288
To heat your car up and defrost
the windshield and side windows quickly,
00:01:54.288 --> 00:01:58.296
adjust the temperature control to your
desired setting or select max defrost.
00:01:58.296 --> 00:02:01.446
This will automatically turn your
air distribution to defrost,
00:02:01.446 --> 00:02:06.180
set the temperature to the hottest level
and the air flow to the maximum setting.
00:02:06.180 --> 00:02:10.650
In mild or warm temperatures you may
notice that your A/C also turns on.
00:02:10.650 --> 00:02:13.320
It does this to help dehumidify
the air for defogging.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs_seg7.mp4
question: Why does the A/C automatically turn on in warmer climates?

video_name: BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0
video_trans:
00:00:14.355 --> 00:00:17.840
Let's start with BLIS or
Blind Spot Information System.
00:00:17.840 --> 00:00:19.930
Any time you put your vehicle in drive and
00:00:19.930 --> 00:00:23.140
you are going faster than six
miles per hour BLIS will turn on.
00:00:23.140 --> 00:00:27.410
After that it's always active when
your vehicle is drive or neutral.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0_seg2.mp4

video_trans:

By the way for
quicker more efficient charging,
00:02:55.140 --> 00:02:59.510
it's recommended to upgrade to
an available 240 volt charging station.
00:02:59.510 --> 00:03:04.180
This can allow you to fully charge in
one third of the time it takes than with
00:03:04.200 --> 00:03:07.915
the supplied 120 volt charging cord.
Any questions?
00:03:07.915 --> 00:03:09.393

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:34.270 --> 00:01:36.670
When you see yellow,
the Aid mode is active.
00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.550
Then you'll feel the steering wheel move
a little to help direct you to steer
00:01:39.550 --> 00:01:40.350
back into you lane.
00:01:41.510 --> 00:01:43.660
If you see red, the Alert mode is active,
00:01:43.660 --> 00:01:46.030
and you'll feel
the steering wheel vibrate.
00:01:46.030 --> 00:01:48.490
And if you don't see any lines,
the system is off.
00:01:49.660 --> 00:01:50.630
And don't worry.

video_name: SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0
video_trans:
00:00:20.990 --> 00:00:22.920
In an addition to
the traditional gear selections,
00:00:22.920 --> 00:00:26.330
your transmission has
two additional modes.
00:00:26.330 --> 00:00:28.990
Progressive range selection
that lets you lock out
00:00:28.990 --> 00:00:32.690
upper gears when the truck is heavily
loaded or when towing on grades.
00:00:32.690 --> 00:00:35.750
And manual,
that lets you manually select gears.

question: What are the two additional gear modes of the transmission?

video_name: BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0
video_trans:
00:00:58.497 --> 00:01:01.470
Now, let's talk about Cross-Traffic alert.
00:01:01.470 --> 00:01:05.650
It warns you of moving cars coming from
either side when you're in reverse or
00:01:05.650 --> 00:01:09.550
backing up and gives you three warnings,
a light on the corresponding
00:01:09.550 --> 00:01:13.470
side view mirror, a chime, and
a message in your message center.
00:01:14.470 --> 00:01:16.970
Extreme weather conditions
could block the sensors, but
00:01:16.970 --> 00:01:20.370
if that happens, you'll get a warning
message and a chime to let you know.
00:01:20.370 --> 00:01:23.234
And keep in mind,
as with the most radar, infrared, and
00:01:23.234 --> 00:01:27.246
ultrasonic-type sensing system,
there is the possibility of false alerts.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0_seg4.mp4
question: What can block and disable the sensors of the car?

video_name: Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU
video_trans:
00:01:02.570 --> 00:01:05.090
You can change the sensitivity
of the warning system
00:01:05.090 --> 00:01:09.630
to one of three settings by using the
five-way control on your steering wheel.
00:01:09.630 --> 00:01:14.240
Scroll to Driver Assist,
Pre-Collision, Alert Sensitivity, and
00:01:14.240 --> 00:01:17.290
then select High, Normal or Low.
00:01:17.290 --> 00:01:21.350
A lower setting can send fewer warnings,
while a higher setting will give earlier,
00:01:21.350 --> 00:01:22.890
more frequent warnings.
00:01:22.890 --> 00:01:26.820
Keep in mind, for the system to
function properly, the radar sensor and
00:01:26.820 --> 00:01:29.130
camera must be clear of obstruction.
00:01:29.130 --> 00:01:33.660
If any obstruction is detected, a message
will appear in the information display.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU_seg4.mp4
question: What selection under Driver Assist do you choose to get to Alert Sensitivity?

video_name: Double Pivot Mirror _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pdsBuJu7fnQ
video_trans:
00:00:15.090 --> 00:00:18.154
Your vehicle's rear view
mirror has two pivot points,
00:00:18.154 --> 00:00:21.621
one at the rear of the mirror housing and
one at the windshield.
00:00:21.621 --> 00:00:25.173
To adjust the mirror stem,
grab a hold of the mirror housing, and
00:00:25.173 --> 00:00:29.380
with a little pressure,
pull down to lower and push up to raise.
00:00:29.380 --> 00:00:31.430
It can also be pivoted side to side.
00:00:32.570 --> 00:00:35.620
The mirror housing can also
be adjusted left or right and
00:00:35.620 --> 00:00:37.692
tilted up or down with a little pressure.
00:00:37.692 --> 00:00:39.436
It's that simple.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Double Pivot Mirror _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pdsBuJu7fnQ_seg2.mp4
question: How many pivot points does the rear view mirror have?

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:01:15.390 --> 00:01:16.460
When connecting a trailer,
00:01:16.460 --> 00:01:19.840
you can follow a connection checklist
to ensure nothing's been missed.
00:01:19.840 --> 00:01:23.850
To do so, from the towing menu,
scroll down to Connection Checklist,
00:01:23.850 --> 00:01:28.290
then choose type of trailer,
Conventional, Fifth Wheel or Gooseneck.
00:01:28.290 --> 00:01:30.980
And it will walk you through
the connection process to remind you of
00:01:30.980 --> 00:01:32.620
the necessary steps.
00:01:32.620 --> 00:01:33.660
Press OK to confirm.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg5.mp4
question: Why follow a connection checklist when connecting a trailer?

video_name: Improve Your Windshield Wiper Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-esaKAXXG0KM
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.277
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.277 --> 00:00:06.654
Did you know that dirty glass or wiper
blades are one of the major reasons for
00:00:06.654 --> 00:00:09.020
streaks and
smears on your windshield when wiping?
00:00:10.170 --> 00:00:12.640
If this happens,
lift your wiper blades up and
  
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:16.680
clean the entire windshield glass,
as well as the rubber blades.
00:00:16.680 --> 00:00:19.270
Be sure to clean the windshield
using a neutral detergent
00:00:19.270 --> 00:00:23.030
such as Motorcraft Premium
Windshield Washer Concentrate or
00:00:23.030 --> 00:00:26.960
Motorcraft Ultra-Clear Spray
Glass Cleaner, and a soft cloth.
00:00:26.960 --> 00:00:28.090
Then rinse with clear water.
00:00:29.330 --> 00:00:32.405
In extreme cases,
you may need to use a mild abrasive,
00:00:32.405 --> 00:00:36.480
non-chlorinated cleaner, and
wash the wiper blades using a sponge or
00:00:36.480 --> 00:00:40.860
soft cloth and rubbing alcohol, or
Premium Windshield Washer Fluid.
00:00:40.860 --> 00:00:45.060
If your wipers continue to smear your
windshield, you may need to replace them.
00:00:45.060 --> 00:00:45.920
Any questions?
00:00:45.920 --> 00:00:48.075
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:48.075 --> 00:00:58.075
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Improve Your Windshield Wiper Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-esaKAXXG0KM_seg1.mp4
question: What is one of the major reasons for streaks and smears on the windshields?

video_name: How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA
video_trans:
00:01:16.650 --> 00:01:20.350
Here are a few more things you'll
need to know when using the feature.
00:01:20.350 --> 00:01:24.990
After setting up and selecting a trailer,
the display always shows you a small top
00:01:24.990 --> 00:01:27.910
view representation of your truck and
trailer.
00:01:27.910 --> 00:01:30.570
You'll also see two
different colored lines.
00:01:30.570 --> 00:01:34.766
A black line shows you where your
trailer is in relation to your vehicle.
00:01:34.766 --> 00:01:37.800
And a white line gives you a projection
of where your trailer will go
00:01:37.800 --> 00:01:40.420
based on your current
steering wheel position.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA_seg4.mp4

00:00:41.015 --> 00:00:45.980
Turn the car on,
press the car unlock button three times.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:50.945
Turn the car off, press the unlock
button three more times and
00:00:50.945 --> 00:00:52.895
turn the car on again.
00:00:52.895 --> 00:00:56.185
You'll hear a chirp to let you know
you've entered the programming mode.
00:00:56.185 --> 00:00:57.435
Still with me?
00:00:57.435 --> 00:00:58.335
Good.

video_name: Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg
video_trans:
00:01:24.640 --> 00:01:28.230
Countdown provides a racing
Christmas tree style start timer.
00:01:28.230 --> 00:01:31.480
To use it, scroll to accelerator
timer in the track apps menu,
00:01:31.480 --> 00:01:33.670
and follow the prompts.
00:01:33.670 --> 00:01:36.800
Colors will flash in half
second intervals: yellow,
00:01:36.800 --> 00:01:38.080
green, red.
00:01:38.080 --> 00:01:42.550
If the driver accelerates early the light
will turn red indicating a false start,
00:01:42.550 --> 00:01:43.730
and no data will be recorded.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg_seg6.mp4
question: What does the countdown start do?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:02:36.670 --> 00:02:39.370
Keep in mind,
anytime a trailer is connected and
00:02:39.370 --> 00:02:43.160
information is input, cross-traffic
alert automatically turns off.
00:02:44.260 --> 00:02:48.160
And finally, extreme weather
conditions could block the sensors, but
00:02:48.160 --> 00:02:52.450
if that happens, you'll get a warning
message and a chime to let you know.
00:02:52.450 --> 00:02:54.460
As with most radar, infrared and
00:02:54.460 --> 00:02:58.660
ultrasonic type sensing systems,
there is a possibility of false alerts.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg7.mp4
question: When will the Cross Traffic Alert turn off?

video_trans:
00:00:13.780 --> 00:00:16.370
The Miles/Full
Charge screen is located
00:00:16.370 --> 00:00:19.990
in the display trip menu on the left
side of the instrument cluster, and
00:00:19.990 --> 00:00:23.520
shows both average and
instantaneous miles per charge.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk_seg2.mp4

video_name: USB Smart Charging _ Ford How-To _ Ford-p5P3bNlMr0c
video_trans:
00:00:25.360 --> 00:00:29.640
Unlike traditional USB charging ports
that provide 500 milliamps of power and
00:00:29.640 --> 00:00:31.060
can only charge a smartphone or
00:00:31.060 --> 00:00:35.260
media player, smart USB chargers can
provide up to two amps, and know just
00:00:35.260 --> 00:00:38.080
the right amount of power to deliver
to whatever device you're charging.
00:00:39.120 --> 00:00:42.743
Meaning, if you have one device plugged
in that needs two amps to charge, and
00:00:42.743 --> 00:00:46.255
another plugged in at the same time
that only needs one amp to fully charge,
00:00:46.255 --> 00:00:49.029
your smart USB port will deliver
the right amount to both.
00:00:49.029 --> 00:00:52.292
And that can help save battery power for
your vehicle.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/USB Smart Charging _ Ford How-To _ Ford-p5P3bNlMr0c_seg3.mp4
question: Can you use the Smart USB chargers to charge electronics with different power needs?

video_trans:
WEBVTT

[MUSIC]

Did you know you can open or
00:00:05.774 --> 00:00:09.400
close your window all the way without
having to hold the button down?
00:00:09.400 --> 00:00:11.190
Here are a few simple
steps on how to use it.
00:00:12.320 --> 00:00:15.800
To open your window all the way,
press the switch down firmly and let go.
00:00:17.110 --> 00:00:20.270
To open it just a little, press it lightly
and let go when you want it to stop.

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:00:14.730 --> 00:00:17.840
The Trailer Brake Controller automatically
applies the trailer brakes when
00:00:17.840 --> 00:00:20.160
the tow vehicle's brakes are pressed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg2.mp4

video_name: F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ
video_trans:
00:01:34.500 --> 00:01:38.570
Trailer sway control works in conjunction
with the roll stability control system
00:01:38.570 --> 00:01:42.170
to determine if your trailer is swaying
and gradually applies your brakes.
00:01:42.170 --> 00:01:44.110
And if necessary,
reduces your engine power.
00:01:45.260 --> 00:01:47.780
Trailer tow mirrors are also
available to help improve
00:01:47.780 --> 00:01:49.850
rear visibility when
towing large trailers.

video_name: Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E
video_trans:
00:00:13.160 --> 00:00:14.870
With your front seats upright, look for
00:00:14.870 --> 00:00:18.560
the storage latch on the bottom
of the middle seat cushion, here.
00:00:18.560 --> 00:00:20.860
Pull the latch to release the seat and
pull it back.
00:00:21.950 --> 00:00:23.390
To access the cup holders,
00:00:23.390 --> 00:00:27.010
open the console lid, then lift
the cup holder tray out of the bin,
00:00:27.010 --> 00:00:32.330
spin it around, and latch it into place by
inserting the plastic tabs into the slots.
00:00:32.330 --> 00:00:35.180
Now push the seat cushion back into place.
00:00:35.180 --> 00:00:37.010
When you hear it latch,
you'll know it's secure.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E_seg2.mp4

video_name: Rear Folding Seats with Side Release and Folding Head Restraints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nTO2w5-8rIA
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.364
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.364 --> 00:00:09.020
Did you know that you can fold
the back seat down in your vehicle?
00:00:09.020 --> 00:00:10.590
Here's how to do it.
00:00:10.590 --> 00:00:13.670
First, fold the outside
head restraints down and
00:00:13.670 --> 00:00:16.160
lower the center head restraint like this.
00:00:16.160 --> 00:00:20.830
Next, find the lever located on
the side of the seat base, here, and
00:00:20.830 --> 00:00:22.920
pull the level up to
fold the seat back down.
00:00:24.180 --> 00:00:28.250
To unfold your seats, just pull the seat
back up into the lock position.
00:00:28.250 --> 00:00:28.920
You'll hear a click.
00:00:30.160 --> 00:00:31.300
And on some vehicles,
00:00:31.300 --> 00:00:34.870
you may see a red indicator on
the lever to let you know it's locked.
00:00:34.870 --> 00:00:36.584
Just give it a slight pull to make sure.
00:00:36.584 --> 00:00:40.486
Any questions?
00:00:40.486 --> 00:00:40.986
Go to www.FordOwner.com.
00:00:40.986 --> 00:00:50.942
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Rear Folding Seats with Side Release and Folding Head Restraints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nTO2w5-8rIA_seg1.mp4
question: How do you know the seats are locked into place when unfolded?

00:00:04.236 --> 00:00:07.441
Did you know your Mustang's front seats
can be adjusted in many ways to give
00:00:07.441 --> 00:00:09.250
you a more comfortable ride?
00:00:09.250 --> 00:00:10.850
Let me explain.
00:00:10.850 --> 00:00:13.300
The front seats in your car
can be adjusted manually or
00:00:13.300 --> 00:00:16.490
if equipped using the six-way power seat switch.

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:01:32.170 --> 00:01:34.792
Once the data of cruise is on,
it uses radar and
00:01:34.792 --> 00:01:39.048
camera technology to constantly scan for
slower vehicles in front of you.
00:01:39.048 --> 00:01:42.403
And automatically adjusts your
speed to maintain the gap.
00:01:42.403 --> 00:01:46.639
You may notice that on occasion, you go
slower than you initially set your cruise for.
00:01:46.639 --> 00:01:49.018
That's the system adjusting the speed.
00:01:49.018 --> 00:01:52.902
Once traffic speeds up,
you'll return to the speed you set.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg7.mp4
question: Does it have any test award or certificates?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:48.710 --> 00:00:51.282
Here are a few things you should know.
00:00:51.282 --> 00:00:55.670
Auto Start Stop will not shut
your engine off at every stop if
00:00:55.670 --> 00:00:59.510
the engine is still warming up,
if the outside temperature is too hot or
00:00:59.510 --> 00:01:03.710
too cold, or if the heat and
air conditioning is in high use.
00:01:03.710 --> 00:01:08.750
So if your AC's on because it's hot
outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:08.750 --> 00:01:12.490
It may also restart while stopped
to maintain interior comfort or
00:01:12.490 --> 00:01:14.420
to recharge the battery.
00:01:14.420 --> 00:01:17.680
Also, if you're towing a trailer or
using the four high or
00:01:17.680 --> 00:01:21.290
four low feature of the four-wheel
drive system, the start/stop feature
00:01:21.290 --> 00:01:25.180
automatically shuts off and will turn on
again once you disable those features.
00:01:26.260 --> 00:01:29.590
You can also use the five-way switch
located on your steering wheel
00:01:29.590 --> 00:01:33.540
to get to the information on demand screen
which tells you if your engine is off or
00:01:33.540 --> 00:01:34.350
why it's still running.
00:01:35.510 --> 00:01:39.130
And one more thing, your vehicle is
equipped with a heavy duty starter and
00:01:39.130 --> 00:01:42.268
battery to compensate for
the increased number of starts and stops.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg3.mp4
question: When does the autostop sign function?

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:01:08.050 --> 00:01:11.350
Here, you'll also see the park distance
control alert in the upper right corner.
00:01:12.360 --> 00:01:15.120
Press it again for
a split view of what's behind you.
00:01:15.120 --> 00:01:19.190
Split view will allow you to see cross
traffic or cars coming from either side
00:01:19.190 --> 00:01:22.218
and that can be helpful when you're
backing out of a parking space.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI_seg7.mp4
question: Where can I find the park distance control alert?

video_name: Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw
video_trans:
00:00:22.760 --> 00:00:25.970
Summer tires are ideal for
performance vehicles and
00:00:25.970 --> 00:00:29.366
do not have the same traction
characteristics of all-season tires.
00:00:29.366 --> 00:00:32.902
As they are designed for
superior traction, cornering, and
00:00:32.902 --> 00:00:37.010
braking performance for
both wet and dry road conditions.
00:00:37.010 --> 00:00:41.240
This is attributed to specialized tread
patterns, like less grooving, to provide
00:00:41.240 --> 00:00:46.159
more tire contact with the road, shallower
tread depth, and softer rubber compounds.
00:00:47.330 --> 00:00:51.550
Keep in mind, since summer tires
are composed of softer materials,
00:00:51.550 --> 00:00:53.360
they tend to lose flexibility.
00:00:53.360 --> 00:00:55.766
and are less suitable in colder temps and
00:00:55.766 --> 00:00:58.755
generally wear faster
than an all-season tire.
00:00:58.755 --> 00:01:02.646
And unlike all-season tires,
summer tires do not have a mud and
00:01:02.646 --> 00:01:05.601
snow traction rating and
are not recommended for
00:01:05.601 --> 00:01:09.870
cold weather below 45 degrees or
snowy and icy driving conditions.
00:01:11.220 --> 00:01:12.540
As a matter of fact,
00:01:12.540 --> 00:01:17.230
driving on summer tires in below
freezing conditions can damage them.
00:01:17.230 --> 00:01:21.590
If you must drive in these conditions,
Ford recommends using all-season or
00:01:21.590 --> 00:01:23.240
winter snow tires.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw_seg2.mp4
question: What are summer tires ideal for?

video_name: Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc
video_trans:
00:00:47.540 --> 00:00:52.500
To use Launch Control, select Launch
Control under the Track App menu.
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.105
Once enabled quickly press
the accelerator all the way to the floor.
00:00:56.105 --> 00:00:58.365
The feature will automatically
set your preferred RPM.
00:00:58.365 --> 00:01:01.535
You'll know it's set when you see
the set icon in the lower right
00:01:01.535 --> 00:01:02.795
corner of the display.
00:01:02.795 --> 00:01:03.296
When ready,
00:01:03.296 --> 00:01:06.265
quickly release the clutch while
maintaining pressure on the accelerator.
00:01:06.265 --> 00:01:08.252
[MUSIC]
00:01:08.252 --> 00:01:09.580
One more thing.
00:01:09.580 --> 00:01:12.110
You can turn it off by
following the same steps.
00:01:12.110 --> 00:01:14.220
Simply select Launch Control and press OK.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc_seg3.mp4
question: How will you press the accelerator after selecting the launch control under the track apps?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:01:55.850 --> 00:01:59.360
Now, I'm going to tell you how to place
the checkered sticker I just mentioned.
00:01:59.360 --> 00:02:03.473
The sticker acts as a target with
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist feature and
00:02:03.473 --> 00:02:07.537
rear-view camera used to track which
direction the trailer is moving.
00:02:07.537 --> 00:02:09.147
Take the checkered target sticker and
00:02:09.147 --> 00:02:11.419
measurement card with you
to the rear of the vehicle.
00:02:11.419 --> 00:02:15.521
You want to place the sticker within 7 to
22 inches from the center of the trailer
00:02:15.521 --> 00:02:16.198
hitch ball.
00:02:16.198 --> 00:02:19.879
You'll need to make sure to place the
sticker on a flat horizontal service that
00:02:19.879 --> 00:02:21.681
is visible by the rear-view camera.
00:02:21.681 --> 00:02:24.369
This is where an assistant
would be helpful.
00:02:24.369 --> 00:02:28.192
One the sticker is in place, you'll
need to use your tape measure to get and
00:02:28.192 --> 00:02:29.841
record several measurements.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg4.mp4
question: What kind of trailer tongue designs are there?

video_name: Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg
video_trans:
00:00:45.850 --> 00:00:48.990
The acceleration timer displays
the vehicle's rate of acceleration
00:00:48.990 --> 00:00:51.500
based on selected tests for speed.
00:00:51.500 --> 00:00:55.305
0 to 30 miles per hour,
0 to 60 miles per hour,
00:00:55.305 --> 00:00:57.775
0 to 100 miles per hour, or distance.
00:00:57.775 --> 00:00:59.665
1/8 mile, or 1/4 mile.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg_seg3.mp4
question: How many different acceleration timer tests are there?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:00:22.880 --> 00:00:24.570
When ready to charge the vehicle,
00:00:24.570 --> 00:00:28.560
first be sure that the cord is
completely unwound to avoid overheating.
00:00:28.560 --> 00:00:33.250
And plug the AC plug into an AC outlet,
making sure to use a dedicated line that
00:00:33.250 --> 00:00:37.010
no other appliances are connected to,
to avoid tripping a circuit.
00:00:37.010 --> 00:00:40.910
Then, connect the charging coupler
to the charge port on the vehicle.
00:00:40.910 --> 00:00:43.410
You'll know it's properly attached
when you hear a click and
00:00:43.410 --> 00:00:44.760
the lock release button pops up.
00:00:45.830 --> 00:00:49.580
The FORD charge port LED lights
will flash in sequence two times,
00:00:49.580 --> 00:00:52.540
to confirm an electrical
connection has been made.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg3.mp4
question: How will you confirm an electrical connection?

video_name: What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I
video_trans:
00:01:15.720 --> 00:01:19.010
Keep in mind, if you also have
wiper-activated headlamps and
00:01:19.010 --> 00:01:21.710
your headlamp switch is in
the auto-lamp position,
00:01:21.710 --> 00:01:24.880
your headlamps will come on
whenever your wipers are turned on.
00:01:24.880 --> 00:01:25.864
Any questions?
00:01:25.864 --> 00:01:28.476
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:28.476 --> 00:01:38.319
[MUSIC]

video_name: Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk
video_trans:
00:01:09.286 --> 00:01:12.334
The trailer tire pressure
monitoring system, or TPMS,
00:01:12.334 --> 00:01:16.778
displays the individual tire pressure of
a connected trailer and provides an alert
00:01:16.778 --> 00:01:21.304
message in your instrument cluster if one or more is significantly under inflated
00:01:21.304 --> 00:01:22.244
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk_seg4.mp4

video_name: SYNC Connect powered by FordPass - Activate Remote Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-MheqNWskp-s
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.405 --> 00:00:03.973
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.980 --> 00:00:07.180
Did you know that your vehicle may be
equipped with a feature
00:00:07.180 --> 00:00:11.520
that allows you to stay connected and control certain
features remotely, like unlock and
00:00:11.540 --> 00:00:14.900
lock your doors as well as
remote start your vehicle?
00:00:14.920 --> 00:00:19.208
All you need is the available
Sync Connect, a compatible smartphone, and
00:00:19.208 --> 00:00:20.170
Ford Pass.
00:00:20.170 --> 00:00:21.520
Let me tell you about it.
00:00:21.520 --> 00:00:25.340
The first thing you'll need to do is
download FordPass from the App Store or
00:00:25.340 --> 00:00:28.500
Google Play and
accept the terms and conditions.
00:00:28.500 --> 00:00:33.491
If you already have a Ford owner account,
you can log in using your username and
00:00:33.491 --> 00:00:34.350
password.
00:00:34.350 --> 00:00:38.920
If not, you can create an account via the
FordPass app with some basic information
00:00:38.920 --> 00:00:40.400
and a four digit PIN.
00:00:40.400 --> 00:00:43.820
You'll then need to add your
sync connect equipped vehicle.
00:00:43.820 --> 00:00:45.710
Go to the My Vehicles card.
00:00:45.710 --> 00:00:47.600
Click on Add Vehicle.
00:00:47.600 --> 00:00:50.610
To add a second vehicle hit the + button.
00:00:50.610 --> 00:00:55.500
Next, scan the VIN bar code by selecting
the Use Camera tab and point your
00:00:55.500 --> 00:00:59.920
phone's camera to the VIN label located
on your vehicle's driver door sill.
00:00:59.920 --> 00:01:02.530
You'll get a scanned successfully screen.
00:01:02.530 --> 00:01:05.570
Next, assign a vehicle nickname,
then, hit Finish.
00:01:06.590 --> 00:01:10.360
Next, you'll see this screen directing
you to activate SYNC Connect by
00:01:10.360 --> 00:01:13.200
touching the Activate SYNC Connect button.
00:01:13.200 --> 00:01:16.170
After a few minutes,
go to your vehicle and start it.
00:01:16.170 --> 00:01:19.630
You will then see this pop up
on the SYNC 3 touchscreen.
00:01:19.630 --> 00:01:20.800
Touch Allow to continue.
00:01:21.880 --> 00:01:25.843
Keep in mind, if you do not touch Allow
in the pop-up within 10 start-ups,
00:01:25.843 --> 00:01:28.306
you will not gain access
to remote features, and
00:01:28.306 --> 00:01:30.608
will need to reactivate
from the beginning.
00:01:30.608 --> 00:01:31.873
[MUSIC]
00:01:31.873 --> 00:01:36.091
Once you do, after a short period of time,
all remote features can be
00:01:36.091 --> 00:01:40.188
accessed from your smartphones
FordPass Vehicle Controls card.
00:01:40.188 --> 00:01:41.265
Any questions?
00:01:41.265 --> 00:01:44.705
Go to owner.ford.com or FordPass.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC Connect powered by FordPass - Activate Remote Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-MheqNWskp-s_seg1.mp4
question: What is the app that you should download to be connected and to control certain features remotely?

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:01:13.290 --> 00:01:17.170
And to help give you control of how long
your car stays running, you can program
00:01:17.170 --> 00:01:21.910
your engine to run in five, ten, or
15 minute intervals using the five way
00:01:21.910 --> 00:01:26.300
steering wheel controls on the left side
to navigate through the settings menu.
00:01:26.300 --> 00:01:28.010
And if you want some extra run time,
00:01:28.010 --> 00:01:31.820
you can repeat the remote
start process to extend it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s_seg5.mp4
question: What is the least duration for the car to keep running?

video_name: Proper Clutch Pedal Operation _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GW_gOBEPCYE
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.603
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.603 --> 00:00:06.620
To help avoid damaging
your transmission and
00:00:06.620 --> 00:00:08.691
to help provide a better
driving experience,
00:00:08.691 --> 00:00:12.640
there are a few things you should know
about proper clutch pedal operation.
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:14.215
Let me explain.
00:00:14.215 --> 00:00:18.445
The manual transmission in your vehicle
has six gears along with a reverse gear.
00:00:18.445 --> 00:00:22.265
When starting your vehicle, make sure that
your clutch pedal is fully depressed.
00:00:22.265 --> 00:00:25.575
In order for your transmission and
clutch to function at it's best,
00:00:25.575 --> 00:00:29.520
you need to press the clutch pedal all
the way to the floor before every shift.
00:00:29.520 --> 00:00:32.440
Then slowly release it while
pressing the accelerator.
00:00:32.440 --> 00:00:35.280
Not pressing the clutch pedal fully
between shifts can damage your
00:00:35.280 --> 00:00:40.780
transmission, and you may experience
a grinding sound, rapid jerking motion,
00:00:40.780 --> 00:00:44.400
or the car may stall if the clutch
is not properly engaged.
00:00:44.400 --> 00:00:46.080
And here's another thing you should know.
00:00:46.080 --> 00:00:48.920
Don't drive with your foot
resting on the clutch pedal, or
00:00:48.920 --> 00:00:52.230
use it to hold your vehicle at
a standstill while waiting on a hill.
00:00:52.230 --> 00:00:55.670
Doing so may overheat the clutch and
prematurely wear it out.
00:00:55.670 --> 00:00:58.548
This could nullify
a clutch warranty claim.
00:00:58.548 --> 00:00:59.583
Any questions?
00:00:59.583 --> 00:01:02.556
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:02.556 --> 00:01:12.556
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Proper Clutch Pedal Operation _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GW_gOBEPCYE_seg1.mp4
question: what happens if the clutch is not properly engaged?

00:00:18.140 --> 00:00:22.120

system, or TPMS, will display
00:00:22.120 --> 00:00:25.670
a pop-up warning in your instrument
display indicating which tire is low.
00:00:26.790 --> 00:00:27.623
Any questions?
00:00:27.623 --> 00:00:29.513
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:29.513 --> 00:00:39.513
[MUSIC]

video_name: Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI
video_trans:
00:00:16.330 --> 00:00:18.660
If your vehicle is equipped
with a manual transmission,
00:00:18.660 --> 00:00:22.950
be sure your vehicle is at a complete stop
before attempting to shift into reverse.
00:00:22.950 --> 00:00:26.670
Now, press the clutch pedal all
the way to the floor to disengage it.
00:00:26.670 --> 00:00:31.110
Then use your fingers to pull up on the
collar located below the gear shift knob,
00:00:31.110 --> 00:00:35.105
and move the gear shift lever all
the way to the left, then forward.
00:00:35.105 --> 00:00:39.315
Remember, the gear shift can only be moved
to reverse by raising the lock-out ring.
00:00:39.315 --> 00:00:42.525
It protects the transmission from
accidentally engaging reverse when you're
00:00:42.525 --> 00:00:44.679
intending to shift into first.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI_seg2.mp4
question: What is the model of the car?

video_name: Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM
video_trans:
00:00:29.510 --> 00:00:32.320
Electric range is the estimated
distance you can travel
00:00:32.320 --> 00:00:35.280
while in plug-in power
mode with the engine off.
00:00:35.280 --> 00:00:38.180
This range is based on
calculations determined by
00:00:38.180 --> 00:00:43.090
the amount of energy stored in the battery
and the energy being used while driving.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM_seg2.mp4
question: How is the electric range calculated?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:14.360
Here's how it works.
00:00:14.360 --> 00:00:18.500
Auto Start Stop automatically turns on
at startup unless you decided to turn it
00:00:18.500 --> 00:00:22.840
off using the on off button located
on the center console, here.
00:00:22.840 --> 00:00:25.570
You'll know it's activated when
you see the start-stop icon
00:00:25.570 --> 00:00:28.180
illuminated in your instrument cluster.
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:29.590
When you put your foot on the brake and
00:00:29.590 --> 00:00:33.690
come to a full stop, like at a red light,
your engine shuts off.
00:00:33.690 --> 00:00:35.580
You might not even notice it, but
00:00:35.580 --> 00:00:38.800
a light on the instrument cluster
will let you know the engine is off.
00:00:38.800 --> 00:00:39.580
But don't worry.
00:00:39.580 --> 00:00:44.100
Your climate control settings, radio,
and head lamps will function normally.
00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:45.870
And when you take your
foot off the brake pedal,
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.710
your car automatically restarts,
without any delay.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg2.mp4
question: How do you turn Auto Start Stop on?

video_name: Automatic Headlamps With Wiper-Activated Headlamp Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-FOL9B-e2Oz8
video_trans:
00:00:45.461 --> 00:00:48.467
Of course, if you don't want your
lights to stay on that long,
00:00:48.467 --> 00:00:51.260
you could always change the duration.
00:00:51.260 --> 00:00:55.306
Just go to the message center,
scroll to Settings, Lightning and
00:00:55.306 --> 00:00:56.687
then Autolamp Delay.
00:00:56.687 --> 00:01:00.422
Here you can select the length of
time you want them to stay on for.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Automatic Headlamps With Wiper-Activated Headlamp Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-FOL9B-e2Oz8_seg4.mp4
question: What should you do if you don't want your lights to stay on long?

video_name: Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk
video_trans:
00:01:32.110 --> 00:01:36.530
Keep in mind, the estimated range is
based on three impact categories.
00:01:36.530 --> 00:01:40.440
The first being driving style and
route, which is the energy used to
00:01:40.440 --> 00:01:45.160
propel your vehicle, like acceleration and
breaking behavior, road grades, and
00:01:45.160 --> 00:01:47.630
whether you're doing city or
highway driving.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk_seg8.mp4

video_name: 6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc
video_trans:
00:00:57.110 --> 00:01:01.446
Compared to a four or five speed,
the six speed SelectShift transmission,
00:01:01.446 --> 00:01:06.121
gives you greater acceleration from a dead
stop, in first and second gear, while
00:01:06.121 --> 00:01:10.486
higher gears give you better efficiency
with lower RPMs at highway speeds.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc_seg5.mp4

video_name: MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM
video_trans:
00:00:51.980 --> 00:00:55.130
In addition to being able to personalize
your left side screen choices,
00:00:55.130 --> 00:00:58.734
there are also a few screens that
are only available in MyView.
00:00:58.734 --> 00:01:03.010
Like Accessory Power, which indicates the
electrical power demands being put on your
00:01:03.010 --> 00:01:04.650
vehicle from your climate system, and
00:01:04.650 --> 00:01:08.680
other accessories like your radio,
headlights, and windshield wipers.
00:01:08.680 --> 00:01:12.700
Coolant temp, which indicates if your
engine temperature is normal, or high.
00:01:12.700 --> 00:01:16.550
Keep in mind, whichever two choices you
select, the far right side of the screen
00:01:16.550 --> 00:01:19.540
will always display your fuel gauge and
battery gauge.
00:01:19.540 --> 00:01:20.860
Any questions?

video_name: Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA
video_trans:
00:00:25.550 --> 00:00:28.610
You'll know if your child's seat can
be used with the LATCH system if it has
00:00:28.610 --> 00:00:33.220
either two rigid attachments with metal
connectors, or two flexible straps
00:00:33.220 --> 00:00:37.200
with metal hooks that can be connected
to the lower anchors in your seat.
00:00:37.200 --> 00:00:40.490
And if it has a belt strap with a metal
clip that's attached to the top back
00:00:40.490 --> 00:00:42.030
portion of the seat.
00:00:42.030 --> 00:00:43.180
Still with me?
00:00:43.180 --> 00:00:44.190
Great.

video_name: Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs
video_trans:
00:00:45.570 --> 00:00:48.950
There are a few things that you may
need to know to prevent damaging them.
00:00:48.950 --> 00:00:51.430
Before you put a jack
underneath your vehicle,
00:00:51.430 --> 00:00:54.790
you'll need to ensure that the power
running boards are turned off.
00:00:54.790 --> 00:00:58.400
Also, when using a jack,
be sure to check your owner's manual for
00:00:58.400 --> 00:01:00.440
proper mounting locations.
00:01:00.440 --> 00:01:04.510
And when using a hoist lift be sure to
place the lift arms under the frame rails
00:01:04.510 --> 00:01:09.130
at all times to avoid damage to the under
body and running board components.
00:01:09.130 --> 00:01:10.250
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs_seg4.mp4
question: What do you need to turn off before using a jack?

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:

You can change the camera view you see
using the camera button on the dash
00:01:03.930 --> 00:01:05.820
above the display screen.
00:01:05.820 --> 00:01:08.050
Push it once for a full rear view.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI_seg6.mp4

video_name: Headlamp Adjustment _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Sp3McTgj4ck
video_trans:
00:01:08.320 --> 00:01:12.670
Great, now let's talk about what to do
if your lights do need to be adjusted.
00:01:12.670 --> 00:01:16.450
Or if you're going to be towing
something and need to move them.
00:01:16.450 --> 00:01:20.920
First, open your hood, do you see
the adjuster on your head lamps?
00:01:22.118 --> 00:01:26.320
With your screwdriver, twist each one
until your beams are at the right level.
00:01:26.320 --> 00:01:28.830
And remember to leave the marks
on your door or wall so
00:01:28.830 --> 00:01:31.700
that you can readjust the lights
back when you need to.
00:01:31.700 --> 00:01:32.670
Any questions?

video_name: Adjustable Tilt_Telescoping Steering Column _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TlWXbGtYrTQ
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.321 --> 00:00:04.941
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.941 --> 00:00:09.051
Your steering wheel can be adjusted to
make driving even more comfortable,
00:00:09.051 --> 00:00:10.370
let me show you how.
00:00:10.370 --> 00:00:12.990
First, make sure you're
comfortable in your seat.
00:00:12.990 --> 00:00:15.550
This will ensure that you're moving
your wheel to the correct position.
00:00:16.730 --> 00:00:20.680
Now, unlock the steering column by
pulling the release lever either down and
00:00:20.680 --> 00:00:24.000
away or down and toward you.
00:00:24.000 --> 00:00:28.730
Move the steering wheel to a good spot for
you by tilting it up or down, or
00:00:28.730 --> 00:00:32.140
by either pulling it toward you or
pushing it away from you.
00:00:33.230 --> 00:00:35.750
Once you have it in the right position,
lock it by
00:00:35.750 --> 00:00:40.410
pushing the same lever you used to unlock
it, only in the opposite direction.
00:00:40.410 --> 00:00:41.590
Any questions?
00:00:41.590 --> 00:00:42.115
Go to
00:00:42.115 --> 00:00:52.115
FordOwner.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adjustable Tilt_Telescoping Steering Column _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TlWXbGtYrTQ_seg1.mp4
question: How do you move the steering wheel?

video_name: Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI
video_trans:
00:01:07.110 --> 00:01:10.760
You can also select to have a text message
notification sent to you when your vehicle
00:01:10.760 --> 00:01:13.060
health report is ready to be viewed.
00:01:13.060 --> 00:01:15.970
Likewise, you can choose
to be notified by text
00:01:15.970 --> 00:01:17.952
whenever there is an urgent
issue with your vehicle.
00:01:17.952 --> 00:01:20.120
Once you've saved your setting and
00:01:20.120 --> 00:01:23.930
agreed to terms,
you'll receive a text message to confirm.
00:01:23.930 --> 00:01:26.370
Reply yes, and you're all set.
00:01:26.370 --> 00:01:28.710
You can always opt out at any time.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg3.mp4
question: DOES ANY NEED TO SYNCHRONIZE MY PHONE WITH THE INFORMATION DISPLAY UNIT?

To operate,
simply press either the left or right or
00:00:46.262 --> 00:00:48.405
both side mirror spot light buttons.
00:00:48.405 --> 00:00:52.102
Plus, driver and passenger security
approach lamps illuminate the area
00:00:52.102 --> 00:00:54.350
around the front doors of your vehicle.
00:00:54.350 --> 00:00:58.841
And come on automatically when you

00:00:58.841 --> 00:01:00.588

video_name: Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w
video_trans:
00:00:14.600 --> 00:00:17.130
Auto Start-Stop technology is always on
00:00:17.130 --> 00:00:20.450
unless you turn it off by pushing
the Auto Start-Stop off button.
00:00:20.450 --> 00:00:23.760
So, it will be active every
time you start your vehicle.
00:00:23.760 --> 00:00:25.390
When you put your foot
on the brake pedal and
00:00:25.390 --> 00:00:29.625
come to a full start, like at a red light,
your engine automatically shuts off.
00:00:29.625 --> 00:00:31.530
You might not even notice it.
00:00:31.530 --> 00:00:34.720
But a light on the instrument cluster
will let you know that it's off.
00:00:34.720 --> 00:00:36.920
And, once you take your
foot off the brake pedal,
00:00:36.920 --> 00:00:40.240
your car automatically
restarts without any delay.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w_seg2.mp4
question: How do you turn off the auto start stop technology?

video_name: Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU
video_trans:
00:01:37.610 --> 00:01:40.350
Your vehicle also has
something called side sensing.
00:01:40.350 --> 00:01:44.550
It's an enhancement to your forward and
reverse sensing systems that uses a chime
00:01:44.550 --> 00:01:48.420
and a visual diagram display on your
touchscreen with red, yellow, and green
00:01:48.420 --> 00:01:52.160
highlights to indicate where the closest
object to your vehicle is detected.
00:01:52.160 --> 00:01:54.880
Red indicates the closest,
and green the farthest away.
00:01:56.054 --> 00:01:57.543
Any questions?
00:01:57.543 --> 00:01:59.036
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:59.036 --> 00:02:09.036

video_trans:
00:01:52.860 --> 00:01:54.050
When towing a trailer,
00:01:54.050 --> 00:01:58.308
