at the end of the gear shift lever, here,
00:01:58.308 --> 00:02:03.220
activates the tow/haul feature which will
allow the adaptive cruise control system
00:02:03.220 --> 00:02:06.130
to automatically follow at
a slightly greater distance.
00:02:06.130 --> 00:02:09.120
This is handy since the extra
weight of a trailer requires more
00:02:09.120 --> 00:02:11.050
breaking distance if needed.

video_trans:
00:00:22.160 --> 00:00:26.190
Vehicles equipped with Sirius XM
come with a pre-activated six month
00:00:26.190 --> 00:00:31.020
all access trial subscription, which
includes Sirius XM radio for your vehicle,
00:00:31.020 --> 00:00:36.450
plus the ability to enjoy Sirius XM while
outside your Ford by streaming online and
00:00:36.450 --> 00:00:38.130
on the Sirius XM app.
00:00:38.130 --> 00:00:41.070
Keep in mind,
in order to stream Sirius XM,
00:00:41.070 --> 00:00:45.250
you'll need to set up your account
with a username and password online.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs_seg2.mp4

video_trans:
00:00:23.260 --> 00:00:26.534
The Power Points will stay powered
after you've turned off your ignition.
00:00:26.534 --> 00:00:29.224
So, that you can keep charging
your devices even after you've
00:00:29.224 --> 00:00:30.094
left your vehicle.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Powerpoints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DRkQOe83jAY_seg3.mp4

video_name: EcoSelect _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Um28JeKN_iI
video_trans:
00:00:10.860 --> 00:00:14.460
To turn EcoSelect on,
simply press the Eco button located
00:00:14.460 --> 00:00:17.230
on the center console next
to the driver's seat.
00:00:17.230 --> 00:00:21.480
Here, you'll know it's on when you see
this icon in your information display.
00:00:21.480 --> 00:00:24.780
When activated, this feature is
designed to enhance fuel economy
00:00:24.780 --> 00:00:27.570
with some trade-offs in vehicle
performance and comfort.
00:00:27.570 --> 00:00:30.360
You may notice that your climate
system takes a bit longer to heat or
00:00:30.360 --> 00:00:33.880
cool the cabin, while also
altering other vehicle features.
00:00:33.880 --> 00:00:38.030
You may also experience less aggressive
acceleration and increased deceleration
00:00:38.030 --> 00:00:41.700
while coasting, which helps recharge
the battery more efficiently.

question: Where is the ECO button located in the car?

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:01:53.105 --> 00:01:57.020
If your vehicle includes the blind
spot information system BLIS,
00:01:57.020 --> 00:01:59.970
the system first prompts you to
set up your trailer BLIS feature.
00:02:00.980 --> 00:02:03.920
Next, a message appears in
the information display,
00:02:03.920 --> 00:02:06.570
asking if you want to
Add Trailer Reverse Guidance.
00:02:06.570 --> 00:02:07.350
Select Yes.
00:02:08.360 --> 00:02:12.620
A prompt will direct you to straighten the
trailer if necessary, to continue set up.
00:02:12.620 --> 00:02:15.790
You'll then get another message directing
you to use the quick start guide
00:02:15.790 --> 00:02:16.359
to proceed.

question: What happens first when you have BLIS?

video_trans:
00:00:35.290 --> 00:00:39.010
Easily controlled via a toggle switch
on the lower center stack here,
00:00:39.010 --> 00:00:40.980
you can choose from four
modes of operation.
00:00:40.980 --> 00:00:44.684
The mode you select will illuminate
in the information display.
00:00:44.684 --> 00:00:49.040
Normal, Sport +, Track, and Snow/Wet.

run a Vehicle Health Report,
00:02:36.200 --> 00:02:40.300
you must ensure nothing is plugged
into the on-board diagnostic port,
00:02:40.300 --> 00:02:41.750

Any questions?

video_trans:

Keep in mind stones, rocks, and
00:00:56.900 --> 00:01:01.420
dirt can create tiny pits on your
chrome bumper resulting in rust spots.
00:01:01.420 --> 00:01:05.320
If you notice rust spots appearing on your
bumper use a chrome polish to help remove
00:01:05.320 --> 00:01:09.710
the spots, maintain the luster, and
prevent the reoccurrence of new ones.

video_name: Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM
video_trans:
00:00:13.395 --> 00:00:18.150
If your vehicle is equipped with a third
row power fold, you can use the power seat
00:00:18.150 --> 00:00:23.100
buttons located behind the third
row to fold the left, right, or
00:00:23.100 --> 00:00:29.370
both seats to either a stow, fold,
tailgate, or normal position.
00:00:29.370 --> 00:00:31.410
If you have a second row power fold and
00:00:31.410 --> 00:00:33.960
tumble control,
just press the button once, and
00:00:33.960 --> 00:00:38.720
the seat will automatically fold and then
tumble forward to access the third row.

video_name: Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw
video_trans:
00:01:23.240 --> 00:01:24.670
One more thing.
00:01:24.670 --> 00:01:27.310
When storing summer tires,
be sure to store them
00:01:27.310 --> 00:01:32.024
away from direct heating devices where
the temperatures are above 19 degrees Fahrenheit
00:01:32.024 --> 00:01:36.900
as lower temperatures may
result in loss of rubber flexibility and
00:01:36.900 --> 00:01:39.470
develop surface cracks in the treads.
00:01:39.470 --> 00:01:43.636
If the tires have been stored and
conditioned at 19 degrees or cooler,
00:01:43.636 --> 00:01:47.190
warm them to 41 degrees Fahrenheit for
at least 24 hours
00:01:47.190 --> 00:01:50.510
before installing them on a vehicle or
checking the tire pressure.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw_seg3.mp4
question: What is the minimum recommended temperature to store tires?

video_trans:

And keep in mind, you can cancel the
parking process at any time by grabbing
00:01:34.440 --> 00:01:37.610
the steering wheel or
pressing the activation button again.

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:00:43.660 --> 00:00:44.710
Still with me?
00:00:44.710 --> 00:00:46.930
Great, then let's move on.
00:00:46.930 --> 00:00:49.210
In order to see what
the TBC is telling you,
00:00:49.210 --> 00:00:52.970
you'll want to have the towing screen up
on your 8-inch productivity screen.
00:00:52.970 --> 00:00:56.120
To get there, use the five-way
switch on your steering wheel,
00:00:56.120 --> 00:00:58.180
scroll to the right to the Towing tab.
00:00:58.180 --> 00:01:00.890
Select Towing Status, and hit OK.
00:01:00.890 --> 00:01:02.810
Then, you'll see the gain setting screen.
00:01:02.810 --> 00:01:04.940
This is what we talked about earlier.
00:01:04.940 --> 00:01:08.170
And the progress bar that lights up to
show you the amount of power going to
00:01:08.170 --> 00:01:11.000
the trailer brakes when you're
foot is on the brake pedal.
00:01:11.000 --> 00:01:15.390
Unless a trailer is connected,
the display will read no trailer detected.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg4.mp4
question: How can I access the TBC screen?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:01:52.902 --> 00:01:56.464
The stop and go feature comes in handy
while driving on the highway and
00:01:56.464 --> 00:01:57.947
heavy traffic conditions.
00:01:57.947 --> 00:02:00.656
If the vehicle ahead of
you comes to a stop your
00:02:00.656 --> 00:02:03.093
vehicle will also follow down to a stop.
00:02:03.093 --> 00:02:07.718
Once the lead vehicle begins moving within
a short period of about three seconds,
00:02:07.718 --> 00:02:10.346
your car will automatically
begin to follow.
00:02:10.346 --> 00:02:14.312
If it takes longer to move, you can press
the resume button on your steering wheel.
00:02:14.312 --> 00:02:18.866
Or tap the accelerator pedal to start
following the lead vehicle again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg8.mp4
question: What driving conditions is the stop and go feature most beneficial for?

video_name: Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA
video_trans:
00:00:25.550 --> 00:00:28.610
You'll know if your child's seat can
be used with the LATCH system if it has
00:00:28.610 --> 00:00:33.220
either two rigid attachments with metal
connectors, or two flexible straps
00:00:33.220 --> 00:00:37.200
with metal hooks that can be connected
to the lower anchors in your seat.
00:00:37.200 --> 00:00:40.490
And if it has a belt strap with a metal
clip that's attached to the top back
00:00:40.490 --> 00:00:42.030
portion of the seat.
00:00:42.030 --> 00:00:43.180
Still with me?
00:00:43.180 --> 00:00:44.190
Great.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA_seg3.mp4
question: Where does the belt strap connect on the seat?

video_name: Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ
video_trans:
00:00:46.760 --> 00:00:49.690
To put the seats back into their
original upright position,
00:00:49.690 --> 00:00:53.640
unfasten the prop rod and
stow it back into the slot in the floor.
00:00:53.640 --> 00:00:57.700
Then pull the entire seat down and
press it into its locked position.
00:00:57.700 --> 00:00:59.410
You'll hear it click into place.
00:00:59.410 --> 00:01:03.220
Finally, pull up on the shorter strap
closest to the seat back side, and
00:01:03.220 --> 00:01:04.600
flip the seat back up.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ_seg2.mp4

video_name: SYNC 3 Overview - Customizable Settings _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-4c3WN1usCGw
video_trans:
00:01:45.930 --> 00:01:50.082
To set valet mode, which locks out the
SYNC 3 screen to the valet attendant while
00:01:50.082 --> 00:01:52.920
driving your car, press the Valet tile.
00:01:52.920 --> 00:01:56.440
You get a message asking you to enter
a personal identification number of your
00:01:56.440 --> 00:01:58.750
choice and if you want to continue.
00:01:58.750 --> 00:02:00.580
If so, press Yes.
00:02:00.580 --> 00:02:02.867
Then type in your PIN and press Done.
00:02:02.867 --> 00:02:05.810
Re-enter the PIN to complete the process.
00:02:05.810 --> 00:02:07.980
Once you get your key back from the valet,
00:02:07.980 --> 00:02:11.890
you need to enter the PIN again to turn
Valet Mode off and unlock the screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC 3 Overview - Customizable Settings _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-4c3WN1usCGw_seg7.mp4
question: How do I set valet mode?

video_name: MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM
video_trans:
00:00:17.846 --> 00:00:22.105
Using the five-way controls on your
steering wheel, scroll to the main menu,
00:00:22.105 --> 00:00:25.400
Display/Trip, then scroll to MyView and
00:00:25.400 --> 00:00:27.740
press the right arrow on
the five-way controls.
00:00:27.740 --> 00:00:31.030
It takes you to the Options menu
where you can select Change MyView.
00:00:31.030 --> 00:00:35.100
From here, simply use the up or
down arrows to view the available content,
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:39.280
like Vehicle Range, Trip 1 and
2, Fuel History, Coach, etc,
00:00:39.280 --> 00:00:43.030
and the right and left arrows to move
between the left and right columns.
00:00:44.360 --> 00:00:46.710
Each time you select a screen
that you want to display,
00:00:46.710 --> 00:00:49.650
press the OK button on your
five-way control to save it.
00:00:49.650 --> 00:00:51.980
This will now be your MyView screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM_seg2.mp4
question: How to view and change the available content in the display screen?

video_name: EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM
video_trans:
00:00:53.710 --> 00:00:56.530
When ECO Cruise is on but
not active, the ECO and
00:00:56.530 --> 00:00:59.880
car icon in your information
display will be gray.
00:00:59.880 --> 00:01:03.720
Once active both ECO and
the car icon will turn green.
00:01:03.720 --> 00:01:06.140
Now just accelerate to the speed you want.
00:01:06.140 --> 00:01:09.450
Then press the set button on the left
side of your steering wheel.
00:01:09.450 --> 00:01:12.770
Your vehicle will keep a constant
speed until you brake.
00:01:12.770 --> 00:01:17.190
Keep in mind, if you do brake but
then want to resume your set speed again,
00:01:17.190 --> 00:01:20.490
you can press the resume button on
the left side of your steering wheel.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM_seg3.mp4
question: How do I get to the empower screen?

video_name: Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU
video_trans:
00:00:54.660 --> 00:00:58.290
Active Park Assist can also help you get
out of a tight parallel parking space,
00:00:58.290 --> 00:01:01.080
which is great if someone is parked
too close in front of or behind you.
00:01:02.190 --> 00:01:05.320
Just press the same active park
assist button you used to park.
00:01:05.320 --> 00:01:08.410
Let go of the steering wheel then
simply follow the prompts displayed on
00:01:08.410 --> 00:01:09.370
your screen.
00:01:09.370 --> 00:01:12.750
Once again you just accelerate,
shift, and brake as needed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU_seg3.mp4
question: How do you activate active park assist?

video_name: Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc
video_trans:
00:00:57.840 --> 00:01:01.330
Okay, now let's take
a look at the rear wipers.
00:01:01.330 --> 00:01:05.880
The switch at the end of the stock allows
you to turn them on and select your speed.
00:01:05.880 --> 00:01:08.010
The first position is for
intermittent wiping.
00:01:10.050 --> 00:01:11.860
The second is for a continuous wipe.
00:01:13.570 --> 00:01:16.120
And O is off for the wiper.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc_seg4.mp4

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:00:54.590 --> 00:00:59.120
Once adaptive cruise is on, it uses radar
to constantly scan for slower vehicles in
00:00:59.120 --> 00:01:03.100
front of you and automatically adjust
your speed to maintain the gap.
00:01:03.100 --> 00:01:04.630
You may notice that on occasion,
00:01:04.630 --> 00:01:07.600
you go slower than you
initially set your cruise for.
00:01:07.600 --> 00:01:10.540
But don't worry,
the system is still working.
00:01:10.540 --> 00:01:13.850
Once traffic is cleared,
you'll return to the speed you set.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg5.mp4
question: Can the adaptive cruise feature automatically adjust your vehicle speed?

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:03:05.580 --> 00:03:08.610
To do so, touch the Alert button here.
00:03:08.610 --> 00:03:10.760
Then the Enable Alerts button.
00:03:10.760 --> 00:03:14.970
To set an alert, anytime you hear a song
or artist you want to be notified of,
00:03:14.970 --> 00:03:19.210
touch the Alert button,
choose either the artist, song title, or
00:03:19.210 --> 00:03:20.989
both, to add them to your alert.
00:03:22.030 --> 00:03:24.710
You'll get a message letting
you know they've been saved.
00:03:24.710 --> 00:03:26.470
Now, anytime that song or
00:03:26.470 --> 00:03:30.210
artist is being played on any channel
you'll receive a message on your screen
00:03:30.210 --> 00:03:35.150
asking if you'd like to tune to that
channel, delete, or disable alerts.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs_seg10.mp4
question: How do I add a song title alert?

video_name: Inflatable Rear Safety Belt Owner Tips _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GIbrDEGm-hc
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.090 --> 00:00:06.099
[MUSIC]
00:00:06.099 --> 00:00:10.110
Your vehicle may be equipped with
inflatable rear outboard safety belts.
00:00:10.110 --> 00:00:13.222
They work similarly to standard
belts in everyday use.
00:00:13.222 --> 00:00:16.254
But in the event of an accident
they work a little differently.
00:00:16.254 --> 00:00:17.647
Let me explain.
00:00:17.647 --> 00:00:22.222
Unlike a standard safety belt the
inflatable outboard rear safety belt uses
00:00:22.222 --> 00:00:23.303
two retractors.
00:00:23.303 --> 00:00:25.981
One for your torso and one for your lap.
00:00:25.981 --> 00:00:30.081
To fasten it, just grab the tongue, that's
the part that connects the torso and
00:00:30.081 --> 00:00:30.820
lap portion.
00:00:30.820 --> 00:00:36.081
Pull the entire belt over your body at the
same time, then latch it into the buckle.
00:00:36.081 --> 00:00:39.196
Make sure to insert the tongue in
a straight-in motion to the buckle.
00:00:39.196 --> 00:00:42.434
This will help ensure
the inflation mechanism lines up.
00:00:42.434 --> 00:00:44.869
And that it inflates properly if needed.
00:00:44.869 --> 00:00:49.316
If you're in an accident, the crash system
in your vehicle will determine when, and
00:00:49.316 --> 00:00:52.176
if, the inflatable rear
safety belts should deploy.
00:00:52.176 --> 00:00:56.496
If they're needed, the air bags will
inflate with cold, compressed gas and
00:00:56.496 --> 00:01:01.149
expand across the passengers' bodies to
distribute the forces from the crash over
00:01:01.149 --> 00:01:03.551
a larger area to reduce
the risk of injury.
00:01:03.551 --> 00:01:04.604
Any questions?
00:01:04.604 --> 00:01:06.484
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:06.484 --> 00:01:16.484
[MUSIC]

video_name: Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI
video_trans:
00:01:07.110 --> 00:01:10.760
You can also select to have a text message
notification sent to you when your vehicle
00:01:10.760 --> 00:01:13.060
health report is ready to be viewed.
00:01:13.060 --> 00:01:15.970
Likewise, you can choose
to be notified by text
00:01:15.970 --> 00:01:17.952
whenever there is an urgent
issue with your vehicle.
00:01:17.952 --> 00:01:20.120
Once you've saved your setting and
00:01:20.120 --> 00:01:23.930
agreed to terms,
you'll receive a text message to confirm.
00:01:23.930 --> 00:01:26.370
Reply yes, and you're all set.
00:01:26.370 --> 00:01:28.710
You can always opt out at any time.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg3.mp4
question: What kind of informations can I get at my mobile phone for my car?

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:00:20.160 --> 00:00:23.250
The TBC control is located on
your center console, here.
00:00:24.800 --> 00:00:28.320
It has a manual slide control lever
that apply the trailer's electric brakes
00:00:28.320 --> 00:00:30.610
independently of the tow vehicle.
00:00:30.610 --> 00:00:32.360
And a plus and minus gain adjust button.
00:00:33.570 --> 00:00:35.610
Pressing either of them,
adjust how much or
00:00:35.610 --> 00:00:39.140
how little power the TBC sends
to your trailer's brakes.
00:00:39.140 --> 00:00:41.150
If you press and hold the button,
you can raise or
00:00:41.150 --> 00:00:43.660
lower the gain setting continuously.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg3.mp4
question: where is the TBG control located?

video_name: Electric Parking Brake Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Qrl3w8RBP6Q
video_trans:
00:00:28.647 --> 00:00:32.229
Your brakes also have something
called a Drive Away Release.
00:00:32.229 --> 00:00:36.990
Once you've closed the door, buckled in,
turned on the ignition, shifted into
00:00:36.990 --> 00:00:41.971
gear and pressed the accelerator, your
parking brake will automatically release.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Parking Brake Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Qrl3w8RBP6Q_seg4.mp4
question: What is a drive away release?

video_name: How to Use the F-Series 110-Volt Power Outlets _ Ford How-To _ Ford-b3Sw3NUj8wo
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.081 --> 00:00:03.902
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.902 --> 00:00:06.147
Your vehicle may be equipped
with power outlets,
00:00:06.147 --> 00:00:09.900
where you can charge devices like laptops,
rechargeable power tools, and more.
00:00:09.900 --> 00:00:12.030
Let me explain.
00:00:12.030 --> 00:00:14.190
There are two outlets in your vehicle.
00:00:14.190 --> 00:00:18.710
One in the instrument panel, here, and
one in the rear of the center console
00:00:18.710 --> 00:00:21.650
that is easily accessible for
someone in the back seat.
00:00:21.650 --> 00:00:25.510
The outlets can charge when your truck is
running ,and can deliver up to 400 watts
00:00:25.510 --> 00:00:29.650
when you're parked or idling, and
up to 300 watts when you're driving.
00:00:29.650 --> 00:00:33.970
Keep in mind, when using power tools,
the power outlets are only to be used for
00:00:33.970 --> 00:00:37.600
recharging and
should not be used as a main power source.
00:00:37.600 --> 00:00:38.303
Any questions?
00:00:38.303 --> 00:00:40.149
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:40.149 --> 00:00:50.149
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Use the F-Series 110-Volt Power Outlets _ Ford How-To _ Ford-b3Sw3NUj8wo_seg1.mp4
question: What happens if the outlet shuts itself off?

00:01:56.290 --> 00:01:59.780
other factors that include drops
in efficiency due to warmer or

cooler temperatures, and low voltage
accessories, such as lights and fans.

information on your power distribution and
00:01:39.090 --> 00:01:40.430
steering angle.

and settings shows you driver selectable

with Cross Traffic Alert,

video_name: Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc
video_trans:
00:01:06.820 --> 00:01:08.680
If you have the available power seats,
00:01:08.680 --> 00:01:12.510
using the switch located on the side of
the seat you can move the seats forward or
00:01:12.510 --> 00:01:15.320
backward by sliding it forward or
backward.
00:01:15.330 --> 00:01:18.970
To raise the seat bottom,
move the switch up or down.
00:01:20.160 --> 00:01:24.050
And to tilt, just lift the front of
the switch to tilt backward and
00:01:24.050 --> 00:01:25.500
press down to tilt forward.
00:01:25.500 --> 00:01:29.406
To set the firmest of the lumbar
support using the lumbar button,
00:01:29.406 --> 00:01:35.654
here, press the front of it to increase
the firmness and the back to decrease it.
00:01:35.654 --> 00:01:36.635
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc_seg5.mp4
question: How to move the seat forward or backward?

video_name: Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc
video_trans:
00:01:16.120 --> 00:01:17.350
Here's one more thing you should know.
00:01:18.500 --> 00:01:21.640
To wash the rear windows push
the stalk away from you.
00:01:21.640 --> 00:01:23.904
The washer will spray for
as long as you push it.
00:01:23.904 --> 00:01:27.710
Any questions go to FordOwner.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc_seg5.mp4

video_name: Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ
video_trans:
00:00:46.760 --> 00:00:49.690
To put the seats back into their
original upright position,
00:00:49.690 --> 00:00:53.640
unfasten the prop rod and
stow it back into the slot in the floor.
00:00:53.640 --> 00:00:57.700
Then pull the entire seat down and
press it into its locked position.
00:00:57.700 --> 00:00:59.410
You'll hear it click into place.
00:00:59.410 --> 00:01:03.220
Finally, pull up on the shorter strap
closest to the seat back side, and
00:01:03.220 --> 00:01:04.600
flip the seat back up.

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:03:34.680 --> 00:03:38.160
Okay, now, I'm going to tell you how to input
the measurements into the systems
00:03:38.165 --> 00:03:42.200
information display using
the five-way steering wheel controls.
00:03:42.200 --> 00:03:46.380
To input the measurements you recorded
outside of the vehicle, use the up and
00:03:46.380 --> 00:03:49.900
down arrows on the five-way switch on
the left side of the steering wheel
00:03:49.900 --> 00:03:53.960
to increase or
decrease the numbers as needed, like this.
00:03:53.960 --> 00:03:58.510
Then OK to confirm each measurement and
to and to move onto the next measurement.
00:03:58.510 --> 00:04:00.310
Once you've added the last measurement,
00:04:00.310 --> 00:04:03.740
the information display will show
you all of the entered measurements.
00:04:03.740 --> 00:04:06.255
If correct select confirm and hit OK.
00:04:07.400 --> 00:04:10.570
Once you confirm the measurements
the system will automatically search for
00:04:10.570 --> 00:04:13.720
the sticker target and
highlight it with the red circle.
00:04:13.720 --> 00:04:15.990
A message will ask if
the sticker is circled.
00:04:15.990 --> 00:04:18.590
If it is, select Yes to confirm.
00:04:18.590 --> 00:04:21.730
You'll get a confirmation message
letting you know set-up is complete and
00:04:21.730 --> 00:04:22.640
measurements are saved.
00:04:23.870 --> 00:04:26.850
If you do not see the sticker circled,
select no.
00:04:26.850 --> 00:04:29.210
Make sure the measurements are correct,
and that the trailer and
00:04:29.210 --> 00:04:31.530
vehicle are positioned straight.
00:04:31.530 --> 00:04:35.710
Finally, you'll need to drive the vehicle
straight forward between four and
00:04:35.710 --> 00:04:37.340
25 miles per hour as directed,
00:04:37.340 --> 00:04:41.100
until you get a message confirming
calibration is complete.
00:04:41.100 --> 00:04:44.100
Keep in mind,
once you input your trailer's information
00:04:44.100 --> 00:04:47.360
into the information display,
it is stored for easy recall.
00:04:47.360 --> 00:04:49.960
So, you'll only need to do this one time.
00:04:49.960 --> 00:04:52.868
Every additional trailer will
require repeating the process.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg5.mp4
question: How to set up the Trailer reverse Guidance of the car?

video_name: What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I
video_trans:
00:00:38.005 --> 00:00:41.420
To adjust the auto lamp time delay,
or how long your head lamps
00:00:41.420 --> 00:00:46.290
stay on after you've turned off your car,
use the information display controls.
00:00:46.290 --> 00:00:51.210
Press the down arrow to find settings,
then press OK and the right arrow.
00:00:51.210 --> 00:00:55.520
And scroll down to vehicle, or
convenience depending on your vehicle.
00:00:55.520 --> 00:00:59.370
Next, press the right arrow and
scroll to auto lamp delay.
00:00:59.370 --> 00:01:03.880
Press the right arrow again,
select off or the time delay you wish.
00:01:03.880 --> 00:01:05.350
Then press OK to set it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I_seg3.mp4
question: What will the auto delay do?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:50.630 --> 00:01:53.520
Using the turn signal for
lane changes deactivates it.
00:01:53.520 --> 00:01:57.720
So it won't interfere in daily
driving with frequent turns and stops.
00:01:57.720 --> 00:02:01.630
Keep in mind, if you're driving and
don't have a firm grip on the wheel, or
00:02:01.630 --> 00:02:05.360
if you're on a straight part of the road
that doesn't require much steering input,
00:02:05.360 --> 00:02:09.290
the car may think you're not holding on,
and may alert you to do so.
00:02:09.290 --> 00:02:10.400
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg8.mp4
question: Why does my vehicle alert me to hold on to the steering wheel?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:01:49.340 --> 00:01:54.030
Keep in mind, the charge port light
illumination will time out after 1 minute.
00:01:54.030 --> 00:01:57.439
If a fault is detected at any time,
all the lights will flash continuously.
00:01:58.760 --> 00:02:02.930
And if the charge scheduled for later,
the number of lights which represents your
00:02:02.930 --> 00:02:06.140
current minimum state of
charge will be solidly lit.
00:02:06.140 --> 00:02:08.550
And the charge port lights
will timeout after one minute.

video_name: Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs
video_trans:
00:00:19.430 --> 00:00:23.030
To activate them, using the five-way
switch on your steering wheel,
00:00:23.030 --> 00:00:26.219
go to the Settings tab on your
8-inch productivity screen.
00:00:26.219 --> 00:00:30.320
Scroll to Advanced Settings >
Vehicle > Power Running Boards.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs_seg2.mp4
question: What is the purpose of Power Running Boards option?

video_name: Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ
video_trans:
00:01:04.600 --> 00:01:08.660
For even more cargo room,
you can also remove the seats completely.
00:01:08.660 --> 00:01:12.770
To do so, just follow the same steps
you used to tumble them forward.
00:01:12.770 --> 00:01:15.530
Then grab the yellow release
lever underneath the seat bottom,
00:01:15.530 --> 00:01:18.820
pull up to unlock it from the floor
mounts, then lift them out.
00:01:20.320 --> 00:01:21.098
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ_seg3.mp4

video_name: 6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc
video_trans:
00:00:17.320 --> 00:00:20.822
Here's how it works, to use SelectShift,
00:00:20.822 --> 00:00:24.333
move your gear shift into S,
or Sport Mode.
00:00:24.333 --> 00:00:27.600
If your vehicle has the select shift
controls on the steering wheel,
00:00:27.600 --> 00:00:32.040
you'll pull the right paddle to upshift,
or the left paddle to downshift.
00:00:32.040 --> 00:00:35.990
If your controls are located on the
Shifter, you upshift by pressing the plus
00:00:35.990 --> 00:00:40.590
button on the Gear Shift Lever, or
downshift by pressing the minus button.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc_seg3.mp4
question: How will you up shift and down shift if the controls are located on the shifter?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:26.290 --> 00:00:28.460
When a vehicle enters into
a lane to the right or
00:00:28.460 --> 00:00:33.215
left, BLIS warns you with a solid light
on the corresponding side view mirror.
00:00:33.215 --> 00:00:36.115
The light will stay on until the vehicle
has moved out of your blind spot.
00:00:37.155 --> 00:00:39.805
Also, whenever you
activate your turn signal,
00:00:39.805 --> 00:00:42.995
if a vehicle is within the blind
spot zone, BLIS will give you
00:00:42.995 --> 00:00:46.465
a flashing light warning on
the corresponding side view mirror.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg3.mp4

video_trans:
00:00:25.360 --> 00:00:29.640
Unlike traditional USB charging ports
that provide 500 milliamps of power and
00:00:29.640 --> 00:00:31.060
can only charge a smartphone or
00:00:31.060 --> 00:00:35.260
media player, smart USB chargers can
provide up to two amps, and know just
00:00:35.260 --> 00:00:38.080
the right amount of power to deliver
to whatever device you're charging.
00:00:39.120 --> 00:00:42.743
Meaning, if you have one device plugged
in that needs two amps to charge, and
00:00:42.743 --> 00:00:46.255
another plugged in at the same time
that only needs one amp to fully charge,
00:00:46.255 --> 00:00:49.029
your smart USB port will deliver
the right amount to both.
00:00:49.029 --> 00:00:52.292
And that can help save battery power for
your vehicle.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/USB Smart Charging _ Ford How-To _ Ford-p5P3bNlMr0c_seg3.mp4
question: How many amps does the smart usb charger provide?

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:01:10.071 --> 00:01:13.546
To access the battery compartment
on Transit Wagon models,
00:01:13.546 --> 00:01:17.973
first remove the protective plastic
molding, by pulling up on the tabs, and
00:01:17.973 --> 00:01:19.420
sliding it towards you.
00:01:19.420 --> 00:01:23.326
Next, lift the fabric covered trim by
pulling up on the tabs, and tuck, or
00:01:23.326 --> 00:01:25.074
fold it to keep it out of your way.
00:01:25.074 --> 00:01:28.962
You'll need to remove the rear metal
battery cover by unscrewing two fastening
00:01:28.962 --> 00:01:30.130
bolts, here and here.
00:01:31.350 --> 00:01:34.113
Next, unfasten the two electrical cords,
00:01:34.113 --> 00:01:38.526
by unclipping them from the fasteners
like this, and remove the bar.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg4.mp4
question: how do you access the rear battery cover?

video_name: Lane Keeping System - Programming  Ford How-To _ Ford-jzG6YDWMWek
video_trans:
00:00:29.350 --> 00:00:31.890
Here, you can change the mode to alert
00:00:31.890 --> 00:00:34.440
which will vibrate your steering
wheel if you start to drift.
00:00:36.040 --> 00:00:39.990
Aid, which uses the steering system to
help direct you to steer the car back
00:00:39.990 --> 00:00:40.886
into the target lane.
00:00:40.886 --> 00:00:44.480
Or Alert + Aid which gives
you both sets of cues.
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.870
Unlike when you're in the alert mode,
in the combined mode,
00:00:48.870 --> 00:00:52.520
you won't feel the alert vibration
until you're further out of your lane.

video_trans:
00:00:54.590 --> 00:00:59.120
Once adaptive cruise is on, it uses radar
to constantly scan for slower vehicles in
00:00:59.120 --> 00:01:03.100
front of you and automatically adjust
your speed to maintain the gap.
00:01:03.100 --> 00:01:04.630
You may notice that on occasion,
00:01:04.630 --> 00:01:07.600
you go slower than you
initially set your cruise for.
00:01:07.600 --> 00:01:10.540
But don't worry,
the system is still working.
00:01:10.540 --> 00:01:13.850
Once traffic is cleared,
you'll return to the speed you set.

video_trans:

Don't worry.
00:00:27.820 --> 00:00:29.450
If you'd rather choose when to lock or
00:00:29.450 --> 00:00:33.910
unlock your doors, you can turn off
either or both features at any time.
00:00:33.910 --> 00:00:36.740

Here's how.
00:00:37.316 --> 00:00:41.015

press the car unlock button three times.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:50.945
Turn the car off, press the unlock
button three more times and
00:00:50.945 --> 00:00:52.895
turn the car on again.
00:00:52.895 --> 00:00:56.185

you've entered the programming mode.

Still with me?
00:00:57.435 --> 00:00:58.335
Good.

video_name: SecuriCode Invisible Keypad Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fAfBR_UIK4Q
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.524 --> 00:00:03.984
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.984 --> 00:00:07.619
Did you know that you can unlock
your doors and open your trunk or
00:00:07.619 --> 00:00:10.033
manual lift gate without a key or remote?
00:00:10.033 --> 00:00:14.721
With SecuriCode, you just enter a code
on your keypad, and voila, you're in.
00:00:14.721 --> 00:00:16.501
Let me show you how it works.

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:59.300 --> 00:01:02.040
To set the blind spot
detection on a trailer,
00:01:02.040 --> 00:01:06.000
use the five way switch on your steering
wheel and select type of trailer.
00:01:06.000 --> 00:01:09.920
Keep in mind, BLIS only supports
conventional-type trailers.
00:01:09.920 --> 00:01:12.764
Other types selected with
automatically turn off the BLIS and
00:01:12.764 --> 00:01:14.700
cross-traffic alert feature.
00:01:14.700 --> 00:01:17.980
Next, you'll be asked if you want
to set up BLIS with a trailer.
00:01:17.980 --> 00:01:20.010
If no, BLIS turns off.
00:01:20.010 --> 00:01:24.960
If yes, you'll be asked if the trailer is
less than nine feet wide and 33 feet long.
00:01:24.960 --> 00:01:26.720
Now, enter length of trailer,
00:01:26.720 --> 00:01:29.890
which is the length of the hitch
bulb to the end of the trailer.
00:01:29.890 --> 00:01:34.230
You do so by toggling up or down,
using the menu buttons to increase or
00:01:34.230 --> 00:01:36.560
decrease the measurement by three feet.
00:01:36.560 --> 00:01:38.790
You'll need to select
the length that is equal to or
00:01:38.790 --> 00:01:43.070
greater than three feet of the actual
trailer to allow for full coverage.
00:01:43.070 --> 00:01:49.240
For example, if the actual measured length
is 25 feet, input the length to 27 feet.
00:01:49.240 --> 00:01:52.290
Once the length has been entered,
the setup is saved.
00:01:52.290 --> 00:01:54.570
If the trailer has been connected but
no information for
00:01:54.570 --> 00:01:58.890
that trailer has been entered, the system
will ask for trailer information.
00:01:58.890 --> 00:02:03.250
If no trailer information is entered, BLIS
and cross-traffic alert will be disabled.
00:02:04.320 --> 00:02:07.620
It's important to remember that if you
select a trailer in the display screen
00:02:07.620 --> 00:02:11.790
prior to connecting the trailer, the
system will load that configuration, and
00:02:11.790 --> 00:02:14.560
you'll get a message in the instrument
cluster when the trailer is connected.
00:02:16.000 --> 00:02:19.592
Correct trailer information must be
stored under towing information for
00:02:19.592 --> 00:02:22.695
BLIS with trailer blind spot
coverage to be active while towing.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg5.mp4
question: How do I measure the length of my trailer to input into the BLIS blind spot detector to make sure I have adequately cover the entire blindspot caused by my trailer?

illumination will time out after 1 minute.
00:01:54.030 --> 00:01:57.439

all the lights will flash continuously.
00:01:58.760 --> 00:02:02.930

the number of lights which represents your
00:02:02.930 --> 00:02:06.140
current minimum state of
charge will be solidly lit.
00:02:06.140 --> 00:02:08.550
And the charge port lights
will timeout after one minute.

An easy to read colorful homescreen
conveniently displays the phone and
00:00:21.110 --> 00:00:22.330
audio features.
00:00:22.330 --> 00:00:26.810
As well as new available navigation
screen, with a convientant swipe and
00:00:26.810 --> 00:00:29.808

00:00:29.808 --> 00:00:33.160
And a redesigned feature bar is now

00:00:33.160 --> 00:00:36.540
screen for a simple,

00:00:36.540 --> 00:00:40.670
Keep in mind, if the feature menu bar

00:00:40.670 --> 00:00:44.270

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:00:32.110 --> 00:00:36.110
First, you'll need to connect your vehicle
to your trailer on a level surface.
00:00:36.110 --> 00:00:39.960
For best results, it's recommended to use
a draw bar with the appropriate rise or
00:00:39.960 --> 00:00:44.600
drop to position your trailer level to
the ground. Then line up your vehicle and
00:00:44.600 --> 00:00:47.360
trailer by pulling forward, so
they're in line with one another.
00:00:48.500 --> 00:00:51.994
Second, from inside the vehicle
to begin programming,
00:00:51.994 --> 00:00:56.797
press the center of the Pro Trailer Backup
Assist button located to the right of
00:00:56.797 --> 00:00:58.569
the steering wheel, here.
00:00:58.569 --> 00:01:02.792
Using the up and down and left and right
arrows of the five-way controls, spell out
00:01:02.792 --> 00:01:06.612
the name of the trailer using the right
arrow to advance to the next letter.
00:01:06.612 --> 00:01:08.489
Press OK once finished.
00:01:08.489 --> 00:01:11.508
Next, select the type of brake system for
your trailer.
00:01:11.508 --> 00:01:16.095
Electric, which is the default or
surge type and press OK.
00:01:16.095 --> 00:01:18.751
Now, select the brake effort for
your trailer.
00:01:18.751 --> 00:01:21.737
Low, which is the recommended setting for
most trailers,
00:01:21.737 --> 00:01:25.892
Medium or High if your trailer requires
more aggressive braking like if you have
00:01:25.892 --> 00:01:29.230
a larger, heavier trailer, for instance.
00:01:29.230 --> 00:01:33.586
And since Pro Trailer Backup Assist is not
currently compatible with fifth-wheel or
00:01:33.586 --> 00:01:37.592
gooseneck type trailers, conventional
will be the default trailer type.
00:01:37.592 --> 00:01:41.507
You'll get a message asking if you
want to add Pro Trailer Backup Assist.
00:01:41.507 --> 00:01:43.224
Select Yes to confirm.
00:01:43.224 --> 00:01:45.864
A prompt will direct you
to straighten the trailer,
00:01:45.864 --> 00:01:47.725
if necessary to continue the setup.
00:01:47.725 --> 00:01:51.208
You'll then get another message directing
you to put the vehicle in park and
00:01:51.208 --> 00:01:54.810
to place the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
target sticker on your trailer tongue.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg3.mp4
question: How does pro trailer backup assist work ?

video_name: Forward Collision Warning with Brake Support - F-Series _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1MCegMMMIS0
video_trans:
00:00:14.740 --> 00:00:18.920
The forward collision warning with brake
support, uses a radar sensor to detect
00:00:18.920 --> 00:00:22.445
slower moving vehicles traveling
in the same direction as you and
00:00:22.445 --> 00:00:24.880
warns you if you're
rapidly approaching them.
00:00:24.880 --> 00:00:28.520
If this happens, a red warning light
will illuminate on your windshield and
00:00:28.520 --> 00:00:30.110
the warning chime will sound.
00:00:30.110 --> 00:00:33.120
If you don't react after the alert and
continue to get closer to
00:00:33.120 --> 00:00:36.870
the other vehicle, the system will
pre-charge your breaks for rapid breaking.
00:00:36.870 --> 00:00:39.420
So, they can respond faster once
you do press your brake pedal.
00:00:40.470 --> 00:00:43.720
Once your brakes have been pre-charged,
even if you press them lightly,
00:00:43.720 --> 00:00:46.300
they'll apply full stopping
power to help stop you quickly.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Forward Collision Warning with Brake Support - F-Series _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1MCegMMMIS0_seg2.mp4
question: What will happen when my brakes are precharged?

video_name: Powerpoints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DRkQOe83jAY
video_trans:
00:00:23.260 --> 00:00:26.534
The Power Points will stay powered
after you've turned off your ignition.
00:00:26.534 --> 00:00:29.224
So, that you can keep charging
your devices even after you've
00:00:29.224 --> 00:00:30.094
left your vehicle.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Powerpoints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DRkQOe83jAY_seg3.mp4
question: What allows you to keep charging your device when the vehicle is off?

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:01:28.318 --> 00:01:30.480
The Search channels using voice command,
00:01:30.480 --> 00:01:32.680
use the voice button on your
steering wheel, wait for
00:01:32.680 --> 00:01:37.990
the beep then say browse Sirius, and
a full list of categories will appear.
00:01:37.990 --> 00:01:42.270
Touch the one you want to hear and once
you decide, touch the voice button and
00:01:42.270 --> 00:01:45.390
then say the channel number,
like, Sirius channel 36.
00:01:45.390 --> 00:01:50.290
Or you can use the Voice button and just
say the name or number of the channel,
00:01:50.290 --> 00:01:54.200
like ALT Nation, for example,
and it will tune to that channel.

Of course, if you rather not use the
ECO Cruise feature it can be turned off
00:01:38.040 --> 00:01:41.265
using the five we controls on
the left side of the steering wheel.
00:01:41.265 --> 00:01:44.130
And scroll into settings in

00:01:44.130 --> 00:01:47.490
Drivers Assist ECO Cruise then off.
00:01:47.490 --> 00:01:51.140
When ECO Cruise has been turned off

you will be using standard cruise control.

video_name: Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc
video_trans:
00:00:15.940 --> 00:00:19.140
To turn it on, using the five-way
switch on your steering wheel,
00:00:19.140 --> 00:00:22.070
scroll down to Track Apps,
then Launch Control.
00:00:22.070 --> 00:00:24.232
[MUSIC]
00:00:24.232 --> 00:00:27.330
There, you'll see Launch Control and
RPM set.
00:00:27.330 --> 00:00:29.290
The RPM feature allows you to set and
00:00:29.290 --> 00:00:35.030
hold a preferred RPM to launch at,
anywhere between 3,000 and 4,500 RPMs.
00:00:35.030 --> 00:00:38.410
To select your RPM,
use the up and down arrows.
00:00:38.410 --> 00:00:41.490
This helps you control the amount of
torque distributed to the rear wheels
00:00:41.490 --> 00:00:44.570
based on engine speed,
tire temperature and
00:00:44.570 --> 00:00:46.645
surface condition to
help prevent wheel spin.
00:00:46.645 --> 00:00:47.540
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc_seg2.mp4

video_trans:

There's also a rear view camera,
just above the license plate,
00:01:01.920 --> 00:01:04.260
that works independently from
the one in the front, and
 
00:01:04.260 --> 00:01:07.590
shows what's directly behind
you while you're in reverse.
00:01:07.590 --> 00:01:10.100
Another car icon in the upper
right side of the screen,
00:01:10.100 --> 00:01:13.720
the park distance control display,
also shows up when you're in reverse.
00:01:13.720 --> 00:01:15.290
And uses red, yellow, and
00:01:15.290 --> 00:01:19.380
green indicators to show you where
the closest obstacles detected are.

question: what is the function of rear view camera?

video_name: Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw
video_trans:
00:00:22.760 --> 00:00:25.970
Summer tires are ideal for
performance vehicles and
00:00:25.970 --> 00:00:29.366
do not have the same traction
characteristics of all-season tires.
00:00:29.366 --> 00:00:32.902
As they are designed for
superior traction, cornering, and
00:00:32.902 --> 00:00:37.010
braking performance for
both wet and dry road conditions.
00:00:37.010 --> 00:00:41.240
This is attributed to specialized tread
patterns, like less grooving, to provide
00:00:41.240 --> 00:00:46.159
more tire contact with the road, shallower
tread depth, and softer rubber compounds.
00:00:47.330 --> 00:00:51.550
Keep in mind, since summer tires
are composed of softer materials,
00:00:51.550 --> 00:00:53.360
they tend to lose flexibility.
00:00:53.360 --> 00:00:55.766
and are less suitable in colder temps and
00:00:55.766 --> 00:00:58.755
generally wear faster
than an all-season tire.
00:00:58.755 --> 00:01:02.646
And unlike all-season tires,
summer tires do not have a mud and
00:01:02.646 --> 00:01:05.601
snow traction rating and
are not recommended for
00:01:05.601 --> 00:01:09.870
cold weather below 45 degrees or
snowy and icy driving conditions.
00:01:11.220 --> 00:01:12.540
As a matter of fact,
00:01:12.540 --> 00:01:17.230
driving on summer tires in below
freezing conditions can damage them.
00:01:17.230 --> 00:01:21.590
If you must drive in these conditions,
Ford recommends using all-season or
00:01:21.590 --> 00:01:23.240
winter snow tires.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw_seg2.mp4
question: What tires are ideal for performance vehicles?

video_name: Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM
video_trans:
00:00:12.100 --> 00:00:14.900
>> Your car has a few features
that automatically lock or
00:00:14.900 --> 00:00:16.770
unlock all of your doors.
00:00:16.770 --> 00:00:19.910
Autolock will lock all of your doors
when your vehicle is moving and
00:00:19.910 --> 00:00:23.270
reaches a preset speed, and
Auto Unlock will unlock all
00:00:23.270 --> 00:00:26.970
of the doors when the car is turned
off and the driver's door is opened.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM_seg2.mp4
question: When do the doors of the car get unlocked?

video_name: Reverse Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Y33ztmJemJ0
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.216
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.216 --> 00:00:06.520
Did you know that your vehicle can
sense when something is behind you?
00:00:06.520 --> 00:00:10.020
It can, thanks to an available
reverse sensing system.
00:00:10.020 --> 00:00:11.940
Let me show you how it works.
00:00:11.940 --> 00:00:16.397
If your vehicle is in reverse, like when
you're backing out of or into a parking
00:00:16.397 --> 00:00:20.454
spot or garage, the reverse sensing
uses sensors on the rear bumpers and
00:00:20.454 --> 00:00:23.804
a warning sound to let you know
if something's behind you.
00:00:23.804 --> 00:00:27.069
If you have both forward and
reverse sensing, sensors on the front and
00:00:27.069 --> 00:00:30.450
back of your vehicle will detect
objects when you're in reverse.
00:00:30.450 --> 00:00:33.392
This is really helpful when you're
parallel parking since your front bumper
00:00:33.392 --> 00:00:34.669
swings when you're backing up.
00:00:34.669 --> 00:00:36.614
[MUSIC]
00:00:36.614 --> 00:00:41.960
And one more thing, the sensors have to be
clear of snow, ice, or mud to work right.
00:00:41.960 --> 00:00:46.220
So make sure to check them periodically
and be aware that outside conditions or
00:00:46.220 --> 00:00:48.690
noises may also trigger the system.
00:00:48.690 --> 00:00:49.800
Any questions?
00:00:49.800 --> 00:00:51.377
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:51.377 --> 00:01:01.377
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Reverse Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Y33ztmJemJ0_seg1.mp4
question: Where are the reverse sensors located?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:00:44.181 --> 00:00:46.430
To adjust the gap setting,
press the up and
00:00:46.430 --> 00:00:49.590
down arrows on your steering
wheel control switch.
00:00:49.590 --> 00:00:52.240
Pressing it up decreases your
follow distance setting and
00:00:52.240 --> 00:00:54.330
allows your car to follow
at a closer distance.
00:00:55.530 --> 00:00:58.530
And pressing it down, increases
your follow distance setting, and
00:00:58.530 --> 00:01:01.460
expands the distance between you and
a car in front of you.

Here, you'll also see the park distance
control alert in the upper right corner.
00:01:12.360 --> 00:01:15.120
Press it again for
a split view of what's behind you.
00:01:15.120 --> 00:01:19.190
Split view will allow you to see cross
traffic or cars coming from either side
00:01:19.190 --> 00:01:22.218
and that can be helpful when you're
backing out of a parking space.

Using your heated mirrors is simple.
00:00:29.065 --> 00:00:30.033

your heated mirrors will turn on too.
00:00:34.330 --> 00:00:37.460
Keep in mind, if you have an auto

00:00:37.460 --> 00:00:40.520

video_name: SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0
video_trans:
00:00:20.990 --> 00:00:22.920
In an addition to
the traditional gear selections,
00:00:22.920 --> 00:00:26.330
your transmission has
two additional modes.
00:00:26.330 --> 00:00:28.990
Progressive range selection
that lets you lock out
00:00:28.990 --> 00:00:32.690
upper gears when the truck is heavily
loaded or when towing on grades.
00:00:32.690 --> 00:00:35.750
And manual,
that lets you manually select gears.

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.355 --> 00:00:04.090
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.090 --> 00:00:07.953
Your vehicle may have a large moonroof
that opens over the front row to provide
00:00:07.953 --> 00:00:09.331
fresh air and a great view.
00:00:09.331 --> 00:00:10.896
Let me explain.
00:00:10.896 --> 00:00:14.250
There's a sunshade covering your moon roof
that that helps block out the glare of
00:00:14.250 --> 00:00:17.220
the sun, and keeps the temperature
of your vehicle more comfortable.

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:01:17.518 --> 00:01:21.390
While in tow/haul mode, the truck
will react slower to driver input
00:01:21.390 --> 00:01:26.130
at higher speeds, which allow both truck
and trailer to follow your intended path,
00:01:26.130 --> 00:01:30.580
while also maintaining the ease of parking
and performing low speed maneuvers.
00:01:30.580 --> 00:01:34.490
When starting or turning off your vehicle,
you might hear a faint click sound,
00:01:34.490 --> 00:01:36.670
this is just part of
the system's initialization and
00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.270
shutdown process,
don't worry, this is normal.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg4.mp4
question: What is the purpose of tow-haul mode?

video_name: Double Pivot Mirror _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pdsBuJu7fnQ
video_trans:
00:00:15.090 --> 00:00:18.154
Your vehicle's rear view
mirror has two pivot points,
00:00:18.154 --> 00:00:21.621
one at the rear of the mirror housing and
one at the windshield.
00:00:21.621 --> 00:00:25.173
To adjust the mirror stem,
grab a hold of the mirror housing, and
00:00:25.173 --> 00:00:29.380
with a little pressure,
pull down to lower and push up to raise.
00:00:29.380 --> 00:00:31.430
It can also be pivoted side to side.
00:00:32.570 --> 00:00:35.620
The mirror housing can also
be adjusted left or right and
00:00:35.620 --> 00:00:37.692
tilted up or down with a little pressure.
00:00:37.692 --> 00:00:39.436
It's that simple.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Double Pivot Mirror _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pdsBuJu7fnQ_seg2.mp4
question: How many pivot points does the mirror have?

video_name: Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U
video_trans:
00:00:12.858 --> 00:00:16.194
The jack is located under
the passenger seat. To get to it,
00:00:16.194 --> 00:00:18.530
simply move the seat all the way forward,
00:00:18.530 --> 00:00:22.937
using either the power control button
located on the side closest to the door,
00:00:22.937 --> 00:00:26.650
or the manual adjust seat bar
located under the front of the seat.
00:00:26.650 --> 00:00:29.475
Lift the cover panel by pulling up on it.
00:00:29.475 --> 00:00:33.807
It's held in position with Velcro, so
just give it a little tug.
00:00:33.807 --> 00:00:38.574
Now unstrap the jack by stretching
the rubber hold down strap and releasing,
00:00:38.574 --> 00:00:39.684
then lift it out.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U_seg2.mp4
question: where is the jack located?

video_trans:

applies the trailer brakes when

video_trans:

Kind: captions
Language: en

00:00:04.720 --> 00:00:08.109
Your vehicle may be equipped with
a feature that monitors key components of
00:00:08.109 --> 00:00:10.120
a trailer that you are towing.
00:00:10.120 --> 00:00:11.580
Let me explain.
00:00:11.580 --> 00:00:15.590
The smart trailer tow connector informs
you if something regarding your trailer
00:00:15.590 --> 00:00:19.820
needs your attention via your productivity
screen under the Towing menu.
00:00:19.820 --> 00:00:23.888
Such as burned out or unlit trailer
turn signal lamps, brake lights, and
00:00:23.888 --> 00:00:25.474
trailer battery problems.
00:00:25.474 --> 00:00:28.884
Any questions, go to Owner.Ford.com.

video_trans:
00:00:57.840 --> 00:01:01.330
Okay, now let's take
a look at the rear wipers.
00:01:01.330 --> 00:01:05.880
The switch at the end of the stock allows
you to turn them on and select your speed.
00:01:05.880 --> 00:01:08.010
The first position is for
intermittent wiping.
00:01:10.050 --> 00:01:11.860
The second is for a continuous wipe.
00:01:13.570 --> 00:01:16.120
And O is off for the wiper.

video_name: Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk
video_trans:
00:00:17.482 --> 00:00:22.109
There are a few in vehicle technology
features that can aid you when hooking up,
00:00:22.109 --> 00:00:25.160
backing up, and
maneuvering an attached trailer.
00:00:25.160 --> 00:00:29.640
The available center high mounted stop
lamp camera offers an elevated perspective
00:00:29.640 --> 00:00:34.000
and dynamic center guidelines to help line
up your vehicle with the fifth wheel or
00:00:34.000 --> 00:00:35.160
gooseneck trailer.
00:00:35.160 --> 00:00:40.120
There's also a 360 degree camera feature
that delivers multiple views from
00:00:40.120 --> 00:00:42.139
the top down and all four sides
00:00:42.140 --> 00:00:46.180
as well as  a customer placed trailer
camera kit option that can be mounted to
00:00:46.180 --> 00:00:47.540
the rear of your trailer,
00:00:47.540 --> 00:00:51.100
that provides added driver convenience
when backing up a trailer.
00:00:51.120 --> 00:00:55.160
And they all can be viewed on
the center stack console display screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk_seg2.mp4
question: Where can the cameras be viewed?

video_trans:

To turn off Dual-Zone mode,
press the Dual-Zone button again.
00:01:50.580 --> 00:01:53.710
When you do, the passenger side
temperature will automatically
00:01:53.710 --> 00:01:56.180
revert to the driver's side setting.

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.405 --> 00:00:05.194
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.194 --> 00:00:09.670
Your vehicle may have a convenient feature
that you'll find helpful on sunny days.
00:00:09.670 --> 00:00:13.960
It's called the slide on rod sun visor
extension, and it adds an extra few inches
00:00:13.960 --> 00:00:17.200
to your sun visor arm to help
block the sunlight better.
00:00:17.200 --> 00:00:18.960
It's easy to use.
00:00:18.960 --> 00:00:21.650
Just rotate the visor toward
your side window, and
00:00:21.650 --> 00:00:23.610
pull it toward the rear
of the car to extend it.
00:00:24.730 --> 00:00:28.070
Then, push it back into
place to retract it.
00:00:28.070 --> 00:00:29.220
Any questions?
00:00:29.220 --> 00:00:30.742
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:30.742 --> 00:00:40.742
[MUSIC]

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:03:07.000 --> 00:03:09.700
Now, I'm going to tell you how to input
the measurements into the system's
00:03:09.700 --> 00:03:10.640
information display.
00:03:11.720 --> 00:03:15.190
To input the measurements you recorded
outside the vehicle, use the up and
00:03:15.190 --> 00:03:18.540
down arrows on the five-way switch on
the left side of the steering wheel
00:03:18.540 --> 00:03:21.130
to increase or
decrease the numbers as needed.
00:03:21.130 --> 00:03:24.444
Like this,
then OK to confirm each measurement and
00:03:24.444 --> 00:03:26.769
to move on to the next measurement.
00:03:26.769 --> 00:03:28.618
Once you've added the last measurement,
00:03:28.618 --> 00:03:31.761
the information display will show
you all of the entered measurements.
00:03:31.761 --> 00:03:35.591
If correct, select Confirm and hit OK.
00:03:35.591 --> 00:03:39.573
Once you've confirmed the measurements,
the system will automatically search for
00:03:39.573 --> 00:03:42.172
the sticker target and
highlight it with a red circle and
00:03:42.172 --> 00:03:44.391
the message will ask if
the sticker is circled.
00:03:44.391 --> 00:03:47.495
If it is, select yes to confirm.
00:03:47.495 --> 00:03:50.762
You'll get a confirmation message
letting you know setup is complete and
00:03:50.762 --> 00:03:51.927
measurements are saved.
00:03:51.927 --> 00:03:54.753
If you don't see the sticker circled,
select no.
00:03:54.753 --> 00:03:57.201
Make sure the measurements are correct and
that the trailer and
00:03:57.201 --> 00:03:59.115
vehicle are positioned straight.
00:03:59.115 --> 00:04:03.779
Finally, you'll need to drive the vehicle
straightforward between 4 and 25 miles per
00:04:03.779 --> 00:04:07.844
hour as directed until you get a message
confirming calibration is complete.
00:04:07.844 --> 00:04:08.911
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg6.mp4
question: How fast should the vehicle be driven until you get a message confirming calibration is complete?

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:01:04.550 --> 00:01:07.340
Thereâ€™s also an option that
lets you skip channels or
00:01:07.340 --> 00:01:09.690
lock them out from young listeners.
00:01:09.690 --> 00:01:14.240
From the listing screen, anytime you touch
the skip button next to a specific channel
00:01:14.240 --> 00:01:18.680
or use the seek up and down buttons,
that channel will be automatically skipped
00:01:18.680 --> 00:01:22.640
when manually tuned using the tune up or
tune down buttons.
00:01:22.640 --> 00:01:25.220
Touching the lock button
followed by your PIN number
00:01:25.220 --> 00:01:28.318
will prevent that channel
from being listened to.

video_name: 6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc
video_trans:
00:00:17.320 --> 00:00:20.822
Here's how it works, to use SelectShift,
00:00:20.822 --> 00:00:24.333
move your gear shift into S,
or Sport Mode.
00:00:24.333 --> 00:00:27.600
If your vehicle has the select shift
controls on the steering wheel,
00:00:27.600 --> 00:00:32.040
you'll pull the right paddle to upshift,
or the left paddle to downshift.
00:00:32.040 --> 00:00:35.990
If your controls are located on the
Shifter, you upshift by pressing the plus
00:00:35.990 --> 00:00:40.590
button on the Gear Shift Lever, or
downshift by pressing the minus button.

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:01:40.620 --> 00:01:44.480
When in reverse, you can change the camera
view you see by using the camera button on
00:01:44.480 --> 00:01:48.280
the dash above the screen and pushing
it until you get the view you want.
00:01:48.280 --> 00:01:51.390
Keep in mind, the change camera view
function only works when you're
00:01:51.390 --> 00:01:55.210
driving forward at six miles per hour or
below for safety purposes.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI_seg9.mp4
question: How can I change the camera view when in reverse?

video_name: Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk
video_trans:
00:01:02.740 --> 00:01:04.950
Every time that you turn your vehicle off,
and
00:01:04.950 --> 00:01:07.280
you've used plug in
energy during your trip,
00:01:07.280 --> 00:01:10.870
the Next Full Charge screen will appear on
the right side of your instrument cluster.
00:01:10.870 --> 00:01:15.470
It will show your estimated miles per
full charge, just like on the left side,
00:01:15.470 --> 00:01:19.880
plus additional information about how your
energy usage has impacted your estimate
00:01:19.880 --> 00:01:22.590
as compared to the rated
the electric range for your vehicle.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk_seg6.mp4
question: When does the next full charge screen appear?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:02:11.050 --> 00:02:15.020
And one more thing, If you wish to
change to the conventional cruise mode,
00:02:15.020 --> 00:02:19.220
go to the menu settings on your instrument
cluster and select Cruise Control and
00:02:19.220 --> 00:02:20.110
then choose Normal.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg10.mp4
question: Can you switch between adaptive and normal cruise control options?

video_name: Heated Mirrors _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DOQi4JZSeRQ
video_trans:
00:00:27.500 --> 00:00:29.065
Using your heated mirrors is simple.
00:00:29.065 --> 00:00:30.033
[MUSIC]
00:00:30.033 --> 00:00:34.330
When you turn on your rear defrost,
your heated mirrors will turn on too.
00:00:34.330 --> 00:00:37.460
Keep in mind, if you have an auto
dimming driver's side mirror,
00:00:37.460 --> 00:00:40.520
it will take longer to defrost
because of the thicker glass.
00:00:40.520 --> 00:00:44.100
Any questions,
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Heated Mirrors _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DOQi4JZSeRQ_seg2.mp4
question: How do you activate the heated mirrors.

video_name: MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM
video_trans:
00:00:17.846 --> 00:00:22.105
Using the five-way controls on your
steering wheel, scroll to the main menu,
00:00:22.105 --> 00:00:25.400
Display/Trip, then scroll to MyView and
00:00:25.400 --> 00:00:27.740
press the right arrow on
the five-way controls.
00:00:27.740 --> 00:00:31.030
It takes you to the Options menu
where you can select Change MyView.
00:00:31.030 --> 00:00:35.100
From here, simply use the up or
down arrows to view the available content,
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:39.280
like Vehicle Range, Trip 1 and
2, Fuel History, Coach, etc,
00:00:39.280 --> 00:00:43.030
and the right and left arrows to move
between the left and right columns.
00:00:44.360 --> 00:00:46.710
Each time you select a screen
that you want to display,
00:00:46.710 --> 00:00:49.650
press the OK button on your
five-way control to save it.
00:00:49.650 --> 00:00:51.980
This will now be your MyView screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM_seg2.mp4
question: What two functions can you select on the options menu?

video_name: Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs
video_trans:
00:00:11.610 --> 00:00:14.840
First, you'll notice all the normal
climate features you would typically find
00:00:14.840 --> 00:00:16.150
on most cars.
00:00:16.150 --> 00:00:20.250
A climate system power button, which turns
the climate control system off and on.
00:00:20.250 --> 00:00:24.370
A fan speed control or a circulating air
button that let's you switch between
00:00:24.370 --> 00:00:27.450
outside air and
air circulating within the car.
00:00:27.450 --> 00:00:30.395
A distribution control that lets you
choose whether you want the air flow to
00:00:30.395 --> 00:00:34.505
come through the dashboard vents,
the floor vents, the defrost
00:00:34.505 --> 00:00:39.085
vent at the base of the windshield,
or a combination of multiple vents.
00:00:39.085 --> 00:00:41.552
An air conditioning or AC, button.
00:00:41.552 --> 00:00:44.288
Max defrost and rear defrost buttons.
00:00:44.288 --> 00:00:45.850
And a max A/C button.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs_seg2.mp4
question: How do you turn on the A/C?

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:00:20.160 --> 00:00:23.250
The TBC control is located on
your center console, here.
00:00:24.800 --> 00:00:28.320
It has a manual slide control lever
that apply the trailer's electric brakes
00:00:28.320 --> 00:00:30.610
independently of the tow vehicle.
00:00:30.610 --> 00:00:32.360
And a plus and minus gain adjust button.
00:00:33.570 --> 00:00:35.610
Pressing either of them,
adjust how much or
00:00:35.610 --> 00:00:39.140
how little power the TBC sends
to your trailer's brakes.
00:00:39.140 --> 00:00:41.150
If you press and hold the button,
you can raise or
00:00:41.150 --> 00:00:43.660
lower the gain setting continuously.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg3.mp4
question: What is the use of the plus and minus gain adjust button

video_name: One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk
video_trans:
00:00:21.330 --> 00:00:24.540
To close your window all the way,
firmly pull up on the switch and let go.
00:00:25.650 --> 00:00:28.060
To close it part way,
pull up lightly and let go.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk_seg2.mp4
question: How to close the window part way?

video_name: Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI
video_trans:
00:01:03.660 --> 00:01:06.870
Track provides more of
a performance driving experience
00:01:06.870 --> 00:01:10.650
as the engine responds directly to your
input, and takes on a more powerful tone.
00:01:10.650 --> 00:01:15.280
When you're in track mode a performance
oriented advance track calibration
00:01:15.280 --> 00:01:17.020
is automatically selected.
00:01:17.020 --> 00:01:21.110
And the usual advance track intervention
is reduced and tunes specifically for
00:01:21.110 --> 00:01:22.550
race track usage.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI_seg6.mp4
question: What does the track setting do when selected?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:30.320 --> 00:01:34.050
In fact, there are four different
gaps that you can choose from.
00:01:34.050 --> 00:01:38.140
One bar, or the sportiest setting,
gets you the smallest gap.
00:01:38.140 --> 00:01:40.720
Two bars, which is the default gap.
00:01:40.720 --> 00:01:45.680
Three bars, or four, which is the comfort
setting and gives you the biggest gap.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg7.mp4
question: Where do I adjust the gap settings?

video_name: Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk
video_trans:
00:01:28.840 --> 00:01:31.460
You'll also find
a Connection Checklist tab.
00:01:31.460 --> 00:01:33.332
Here, you can select a particular trailer,
00:01:33.332 --> 00:01:35.540
ensure you're wiring
is hooked up properly,
00:01:35.540 --> 00:01:39.030
your lights are functioning correctly,
and your mirrors are adjusted.
00:01:39.030 --> 00:01:42.310
Trailer Setup allows you to select
the type of trailer you're pulling
00:01:42.310 --> 00:01:45.470
such as Conventional,
Fifth Wheel, or Gooseneck.

video_trans:

To open the moonroof partway,
press the button lightly and
00:00:48.915 --> 00:00:51.115
release it wherever you want it to stop.
00:00:51.115 --> 00:00:55.894
If you just want to vent the roof with the
sunshade open, find the button marked with
00:00:55.894 --> 00:00:59.459
the car icon and an open roof,
then press it firmly and let go.

video_trans:
WEBVTT

video_name: Center High Mounted Stop Lamp (CHMSL) Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Zbm44fDvSB0
video_trans:
00:00:25.708 --> 00:00:28.180
To turn it on, when shifted into reverse,
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:32.135
a 360 degree view will
display on the center screen.
00:00:32.135 --> 00:00:34.475
Touch the expand button, here.
00:00:34.475 --> 00:00:36.945
Then touch the high-mounted camera button.
00:00:36.945 --> 00:00:40.905
When you do, the image also gives you
a dynamic guideline to help locate
00:00:40.905 --> 00:00:43.585
the center of your vehicle for
lining up a trailer.
00:00:43.585 --> 00:00:47.945
For a closer look, you can zoom in on
the image by touching the + button.

video_name: Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:07.714
[MUSIC]
00:00:07.714 --> 00:00:10.584
You may be interested to know,
as part of an effort to provide our
00:00:10.584 --> 00:00:13.938
customers with more information about
what happens with their vehicles,
00:00:13.938 --> 00:00:17.030
we've improved the vehicle
health report feature.
00:00:17.030 --> 00:00:20.800
As a matter of fact, in addition to being
able to view a vehicle health report
00:00:20.800 --> 00:00:22.290
on the Ford Owner's Site,
00:00:22.290 --> 00:00:25.560
you can also have certain information
about your vehicle sent directly to your
00:00:25.560 --> 00:00:29.590
personal email address to help
resolve certain issues that may arise.
00:00:29.590 --> 00:00:30.900
Let me explain.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg1.mp4
question: What feature has been improved by the Ford company in order to provide customers more information on what happens with their vehicles?

video_name: Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs
video_trans:
00:00:57.690 --> 00:01:00.630
To use it, first press the auto
button in the center of the knob.
00:01:01.690 --> 00:01:04.790
Then select the temperature you want
using the temperature control knob
00:01:04.790 --> 00:01:07.590
on the right side of your
climate control panel.
00:01:07.590 --> 00:01:10.940
The temperature will appear in
the center digital display.
00:01:10.940 --> 00:01:14.350
Now, each time you turn on your vehicle
with your climate control on or
00:01:14.350 --> 00:01:15.920
turn on the A/C control,
00:01:15.920 --> 00:01:18.690
the system will automatically adjust
to reach your set temperature.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs_seg4.mp4
question: How is the temperature maintained after setting?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w
video_trans:
00:00:14.600 --> 00:00:17.130
Auto Start-Stop technology is always on
00:00:17.130 --> 00:00:20.450
unless you turn it off by pushing
the Auto Start-Stop off button.
00:00:20.450 --> 00:00:23.760
So, it will be active every
time you start your vehicle.
00:00:23.760 --> 00:00:25.390
When you put your foot
on the brake pedal and
00:00:25.390 --> 00:00:29.625
come to a full start, like at a red light,
your engine automatically shuts off.
00:00:29.625 --> 00:00:31.530
You might not even notice it.
00:00:31.530 --> 00:00:34.720
But a light on the instrument cluster
will let you know that it's off.
00:00:34.720 --> 00:00:36.920
And, once you take your
foot off the brake pedal,
00:00:36.920 --> 00:00:40.240
your car automatically
restarts without any delay.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w_seg2.mp4
question: what happens when you take your foot off the brake pedal?

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en

[MUSIC]

Your Mustang has a great feature
that can help you maximize
00:00:07.409 --> 00:00:11.360
traction from a standing start so
you get smooth, consistent starts.
00:00:11.360 --> 00:00:15.940
It's called Launch Control, and
it's part of the available Track Apps.

video_trans:

One more thing, before you can
run a Vehicle Health Report,

you must ensure nothing is plugged
into the on-board diagnostic port,

Any questions?

video_name: Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM
video_trans:
00:01:19.670 --> 00:01:21.804
To return the seat from
the tumble position,
00:01:21.804 --> 00:01:24.398
just flip it back until you
hear it lock into the floor.
00:01:24.398 --> 00:01:27.510
Then lift the seat back to
the upright position again.
00:01:27.510 --> 00:01:29.790
You'll hear a click when it's latched.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM_seg7.mp4

video_name: Headlamp Adjustment _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Sp3McTgj4ck
video_trans:
00:01:08.320 --> 00:01:12.670
Great, now let's talk about what to do
if your lights do need to be adjusted.
00:01:12.670 --> 00:01:16.450
Or if you're going to be towing
something and need to move them.
00:01:16.450 --> 00:01:20.920
First, open your hood, do you see
the adjuster on your head lamps?
00:01:22.118 --> 00:01:26.320
With your screwdriver, twist each one
until your beams are at the right level.
00:01:26.320 --> 00:01:28.830
And remember to leave the marks
on your door or wall so
00:01:28.830 --> 00:01:31.700
that you can readjust the lights
back when you need to.
00:01:31.700 --> 00:01:32.670
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Headlamp Adjustment _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Sp3McTgj4ck_seg5.mp4
question: What should you do if your lights need to be adjusted?

video_name: Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM
video_trans:
00:00:38.720 --> 00:00:42.410
Your second row seats can move forward and
back by lifting the bar under the front of
00:00:42.410 --> 00:00:45.399
the seat, and then sliding
the entire seat in either direction.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM_seg3.mp4
question: How will you move the second row seat?

00:00:14.600 --> 00:00:17.130
Auto Start-Stop technology is always on
00:00:17.130 --> 00:00:20.450
unless you turn it off by pushing
the Auto Start-Stop off button.
00:00:20.450 --> 00:00:23.760
So, it will be active every
time you start your vehicle.

When you put your foot

00:00:25.390 --> 00:00:29.625
come to a full start, like at a red light,

00:00:29.625 --> 00:00:31.530
You might not even notice it.

But a light on the instrument cluster
