video_name: Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo
video_trans:
00:00:23.690 --> 00:00:29.339
To use line lock, using the five-way
switch scroll down to Track Apps.
00:00:29.339 --> 00:00:31.210
And select Line Lock from the menu.
00:00:31.210 --> 00:00:33.860
There are two steps to using Line Lock.
00:00:33.860 --> 00:00:36.660
This step verifies the driver and
car are ready.
00:00:36.660 --> 00:00:38.670
Simply follow the prompts on the screen.
00:00:38.670 --> 00:00:41.130
If you're unable to select Line Lock,
00:00:41.130 --> 00:00:43.570
check to be sure you're driving
under 25 miles an hour,
00:00:43.570 --> 00:00:49.060
the vehicle is on a level surface, and
you're not in another driving mode.
00:00:49.060 --> 00:00:54.370
To engage, firmly press and hold the
brakes, press OK on the steering wheel,
00:00:54.370 --> 00:00:57.980
remove your foot from the brake pedal,
and hit the accelerator.
00:00:57.980 --> 00:01:02.422
A 15 second countdown timer will
show the remaining time left before
00:01:02.422 --> 00:01:03.785
Line Lock shuts off.
00:01:03.785 --> 00:01:06.480
[MUSIC]
00:01:06.480 --> 00:01:10.670
You can always manually cancel it
by pressing the OK button again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo_seg2.mp4
question: How do I engage line lock?

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:01:15.390 --> 00:01:16.460
When connecting a trailer,
00:01:16.460 --> 00:01:19.840
you can follow a connection checklist
to ensure nothing's been missed.
00:01:19.840 --> 00:01:23.850
To do so, from the towing menu,
scroll down to Connection Checklist,
00:01:23.850 --> 00:01:28.290
then choose type of trailer,
Conventional, Fifth Wheel or Gooseneck.
00:01:28.290 --> 00:01:30.980
And it will walk you through
the connection process to remind you of
00:01:30.980 --> 00:01:32.620
the necessary steps.
00:01:32.620 --> 00:01:33.660
Press OK to confirm.

video_name: Transit Refueling _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vM-EW2gDMn0
video_trans:
00:00:42.260 --> 00:00:43.540
And one more thing.
00:00:43.540 --> 00:00:46.130
To help protect against fuel theft,
splashing, or
00:00:46.130 --> 00:00:49.770
water getting in the tank, the capless
fuel filler is tamper resistant.
00:00:49.770 --> 00:00:53.241
And the self closing spring-loaded flaps
help keep fuel from sloshing out and
00:00:53.241 --> 00:00:56.145
water from leaking in when it rains or
when you wash your vehicle.
00:00:56.145 --> 00:00:57.706
[MUSIC]
00:00:57.706 --> 00:00:58.774
Any questions?

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:01:28.040 --> 00:01:30.508
To set a separate temperature for
the front passenger side,
00:01:30.508 --> 00:01:35.360
press the dual-zone button or just turn
the knob to activate Dual-Zone control,
00:01:35.360 --> 00:01:38.370
and adjust the temperature for
the passenger side.
00:01:38.370 --> 00:01:40.340
An amber light will illuminate
to let you know it's on.
00:01:40.340 --> 00:01:44.270
And you'll see the temperature displayed
in the upper right corner of the screen.
00:01:44.270 --> 00:01:46.560
But, the driver's
temperature will not change.

video_trans:

The trailer tire pressure
monitoring system, or TPMS,
00:01:12.334 --> 00:01:16.778
displays the individual tire pressure of
a connected trailer and provides an alert
00:01:16.778 --> 00:01:21.304
message in your instrument cluster if one or more is significantly under inflated

video_name: How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA
video_trans:
00:00:41.960 --> 00:00:43.760
If you turn the trailer to the right,
00:00:43.760 --> 00:00:47.240
you'll see the right side of your
vehicle and trailer and vice versa.
00:00:47.240 --> 00:00:51.480
You can switch views manually at
any time by using the arrow keys.
00:00:51.480 --> 00:00:57.820
Either full driver, partial driver, 50-50,
partial passenger or full passenger.
00:00:58.990 --> 00:01:01.740
Pressing the Camera icon takes
you to Normal Rear View,
00:01:01.740 --> 00:01:05.160
which allows you to see your trailer hitch
or what is directly behind your truck.
00:01:06.850 --> 00:01:10.340
Pressing the Plus button zooms in,
pressing the Return or
00:01:10.340 --> 00:01:14.610
Back button takes you back to
the 360 degree camera system.
00:01:14.610 --> 00:01:16.650
And Auto returns you to
Automatic View Mode.

refresher of what each option is,

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:01:21.930 --> 00:01:26.230
Once plugged in and charging, the port
light will show the current charge status.
00:01:26.230 --> 00:01:30.020
When one bar is pulsing,
the charge is between 0 and 25%.
00:01:31.220 --> 00:01:34.017
One solid bar and
one pulsing bar is 25 to 50%.
00:01:34.017 --> 00:01:40.604
Two solids and one pulsing is 50 to 75%.
00:01:40.604 --> 00:01:44.169
Three solid and one pulsing is 75 to 100%.
00:01:45.300 --> 00:01:49.340
And when all four bars are solidly lit,
the charge is complete.

video_trans:

00:00:04.512 --> 00:00:08.350
Your vehicle may be equipped with some or

00:00:08.350 --> 00:00:12.610
that are both convenient and offer
a little extra security when traveling.

Bright LED tail lamps and
00:00:25.631 --> 00:00:30.130

video_name: How to Use Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GZQFXF_db7g
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.323
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.323 --> 00:00:07.842
Did you know your vehicle may be equipped
with a convenient feature that helps make
00:00:07.842 --> 00:00:10.070
maneuvering a trailer in reverse easy?
00:00:10.070 --> 00:00:12.320
It's called Pro Trailer Backup Assist.
00:00:12.320 --> 00:00:13.590
Let me tell you about it.
00:00:13.590 --> 00:00:15.940
Whether you're backing
a trailer into a job site or
00:00:15.940 --> 00:00:20.930
launching a boat, if you can turn a knob,
you can now back up your trailer with ease.
00:00:20.930 --> 00:00:23.630
Which means, whichever direction
you want your trailer to go,
00:00:23.630 --> 00:00:27.640
just turn the knob in that direction and
the system will take over the steering,
00:00:27.640 --> 00:00:30.770
instead of having to turn the wheel
in the opposite direction.
00:00:30.770 --> 00:00:34.150
To use it, press the center button on
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist knob.
00:00:34.150 --> 00:00:36.660
A list of available trailers will appear.
00:00:36.660 --> 00:00:37.840
Choose the one you want and
00:00:37.840 --> 00:00:40.990
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
will attempt to locate it.
00:00:40.990 --> 00:00:44.010
Once the targeting sticker is
located by the rearview camera,
00:00:44.010 --> 00:00:47.170
the screen will prompt you to
shift into reverse to activate it.
00:00:47.170 --> 00:00:50.450
Then follow the prompts displayed
on the information screen.
00:00:50.450 --> 00:00:52.390
With your hands off the steering wheel,
00:00:52.390 --> 00:00:55.820
use the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
knob to steer the trailer.
00:00:55.820 --> 00:00:59.730
Turn the knob left, or counter-clockwise,
when you want the rear of the trailer to
00:00:59.730 --> 00:01:04.340
go to the left, and right,
clockwise, to go right.
00:01:04.340 --> 00:01:07.070
You should also make it a habit
to use your side view mirrors
00:01:07.070 --> 00:01:10.230
as your primary visual aid
while maneuvering the trailer.
00:01:10.230 --> 00:01:14.190
Once the trailer is moving in
the direction you want, release the knob.
00:01:14.190 --> 00:01:17.450
Keep in mind, you may need to make
small adjustments with the knob to
00:01:17.450 --> 00:01:20.060
keep the trailer moving
along the desired path.
00:01:20.060 --> 00:01:23.820
As soon as the knob is either released or
turned back to the center position,
00:01:23.820 --> 00:01:26.132
the vehicle will follow
the trailer's path.
00:01:26.132 --> 00:01:28.660
You'll need to control the accelerator and
brakes.
00:01:28.660 --> 00:01:29.712
Any questions?
00:01:29.712 --> 00:01:31.599
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:01:31.599 --> 00:01:41.599
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Use Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GZQFXF_db7g_seg1.mp4
question: How do you use Pro Trailer Back Up assist?

To turn adaptive cruise control on,
press and
00:00:27.780 --> 00:00:30.690
release the on off switch
on your steering wheel.
00:00:30.690 --> 00:00:33.560
The information display will
show a gray indicator light
00:00:33.560 --> 00:00:35.470
as well as the current gap setting.
00:00:35.470 --> 00:00:38.170
Now, accelerate to the speed you want,
00:00:38.170 --> 00:00:40.720
press the set button on your wheel and
release.
00:00:40.720 --> 00:00:43.120
Then take your foot off the accelerator.

To set the cruising speed, use the cruise
control switch on your steering wheel.

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:01:31.820 --> 00:01:34.530
And here are some important
facts you should know.
00:01:34.530 --> 00:01:39.180
On certain vehicles, the system only
allows up to two remote starts an hour or
00:01:39.180 --> 00:01:41.020
between manual starts.
00:01:41.020 --> 00:01:43.730
On others, you can only run your car for
00:01:43.730 --> 00:01:48.030
35 minutes with remote start before
you need to manually start it.

video_name: Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU
video_trans:
00:00:22.890 --> 00:00:25.210
To activate the park assist feature,
00:00:25.210 --> 00:00:28.670
press the active park assist button
on the center console, here.
00:00:28.670 --> 00:00:31.400
Then signal to indicate which side
you'd like the vehicle to search.
00:00:32.520 --> 00:00:35.450
An information screen will
appear on your center display.
00:00:35.450 --> 00:00:39.120
And the system will begin to scan for
available parking spots.
00:00:39.120 --> 00:00:42.160
Once an appropriate spot is found,
youâ€™ll hear a chime and
00:00:42.160 --> 00:00:44.910
see a spot found message on your screen.
00:00:44.910 --> 00:00:48.180
Follow the prompts on your screen,
accelerating, shifting and
00:00:48.180 --> 00:00:50.070
braking as needed.
00:00:50.070 --> 00:00:52.180
And be sure to watch your mirrors and
your surroundings for
00:00:52.180 --> 00:00:54.660
any objects which you may
be getting too close to.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU_seg2.mp4

video_name: Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg
video_trans:
00:01:10.090 --> 00:01:10.830
When braking or
00:01:10.830 --> 00:01:14.970
coasting, you'll see power flow back from
the drive train to charge the battery.
00:01:14.970 --> 00:01:17.890
This represents active
regenerative braking.
00:01:17.890 --> 00:01:21.030
When more power is needed,
the gasoline engine will turn on.
00:01:21.030 --> 00:01:24.650
For instance, when driving on a highway,
under heavy acceleration,
00:01:24.650 --> 00:01:28.670
driving in low gear, or
while the battery is in charge mode
00:01:28.670 --> 00:01:32.180
you'll see a gray power flow cap
when it's switched to hybrid power.
00:01:32.180 --> 00:01:37.063
The flow begins at the fuel tank, and goes
to the engine, and then to the wheels.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg_seg4.mp4
question: When are the batteries charging?

video_trans:

And one more thing.
00:00:45.591 --> 00:00:50.590
If for any reason it doesn't engage
reverse gear, press the clutch pedal down,
00:00:50.590 --> 00:00:55.532
take it out of gear, release the clutch
pedal, then repeat the process again.

video_trans:
00:00:35.570 --> 00:00:39.810
Trip view mode gives you a four quadrant
look that displays trip one and two.
00:00:39.810 --> 00:00:43.870
Both of which allow you to see your timer,
instantaneous fuel economy,
00:00:43.870 --> 00:00:46.620
miles traveled, and
average miles per gallon.
00:00:46.620 --> 00:00:50.340
Under the same mode, you also have a fuel
economy screen that displays your average
00:00:50.340 --> 00:00:55.430
miles per gallon, an instantaneous fuel
economy graph, miles to empty, and
00:00:55.430 --> 00:01:00.210
a fuel history which shows a bar graph of
your fuel history over a period of time,
00:01:00.210 --> 00:01:03.670
a compass as well as your
Auto StartStop status.

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:00:41.850 --> 00:00:43.340
To fold the third row seats,
00:00:43.340 --> 00:00:47.460
find the strap on the seat cushion
located in the seat-bite, here.
00:00:47.460 --> 00:00:50.298
Pull it and flip the cushions so
that the seat bottom is face down.
00:00:51.500 --> 00:00:54.090
Next, locate the red
strap in the seat back.
00:00:54.090 --> 00:00:57.641
It looks like it's tucked into a small
pocket in the lower corner of the seat
00:00:57.641 --> 00:00:58.220
back.
00:00:58.220 --> 00:01:00.980
Pull it, and fold the seat back down.

video_name: Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI
video_trans:

Easily controlled via a toggle switch
on the lower center stack here,
00:00:39.010 --> 00:00:40.980
you can choose from four
modes of operation.
00:00:40.980 --> 00:00:44.684
The mode you select will illuminate
in the information display.
00:00:44.684 --> 00:00:49.040
Normal, Sport +, Track, and Snow/Wet.

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:01:21.930 --> 00:01:26.230
Once plugged in and charging, the port
light will show the current charge status.
00:01:26.230 --> 00:01:30.020
When one bar is pulsing,
the charge is between 0 and 25%.
00:01:31.220 --> 00:01:34.017
One solid bar and
one pulsing bar is 25 to 50%.
00:01:34.017 --> 00:01:40.604
Two solids and one pulsing is 50 to 75%.
00:01:40.604 --> 00:01:44.169
Three solid and one pulsing is 75 to 100%.
00:01:45.300 --> 00:01:49.340
And when all four bars are solidly lit,
the charge is complete.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg5.mp4
question: How will you come to know whether the is car fully charged?

your language, distance in miles or
00:00:59.715 --> 00:01:04.570

to the original factory settings.

video_name: Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.139 --> 00:00:04.420
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.420 --> 00:00:08.054
Programming your HomeLink system
is simple, let me show you how.
00:00:08.054 --> 00:00:10.470
First, turn on your car.
00:00:10.470 --> 00:00:13.491
Hold your old transmitter a couple of
inches away from the HomeLink button
00:00:13.491 --> 00:00:15.880
you want to control your garage door with.
00:00:15.880 --> 00:00:19.880
Now press and hold both the transmitter
button and the home link button
00:00:19.880 --> 00:00:24.560
until the indicator light changes from
a slow blink to a fast one, like this.
00:00:24.560 --> 00:00:27.520
Now, press and hold the button on your
HomeLink that you want to control
00:00:27.520 --> 00:00:30.950
your garage door for
five seconds and release it.
00:00:30.950 --> 00:00:35.120
Your garage door should, move but if it
doesn't, repeat the five second hold.
00:00:35.120 --> 00:00:39.230
If your indicator light is still on
your programming is complete and you can
00:00:39.230 --> 00:00:42.860
just press and release your HomeLink
button to activate your garage door.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g_seg1.mp4
question: Do I need to turn the car on in order to program the homelink system?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:02:29.841 --> 00:02:34.098
First, measure the horizontal distance
from the license plate to the center of
00:02:34.098 --> 00:02:35.889
the hitch ball and write it down.
00:02:35.889 --> 00:02:40.242
Next, measure the horizontal distance from
the center of the hitch ball to the center
00:02:40.242 --> 00:02:41.148
of the sticker and
00:02:41.148 --> 00:02:44.731
the distance from the rear-view
camera to the center of the sticker.
00:02:44.731 --> 00:02:49.037
Keep in mind, the location is not
dependent on a straight or A frame type,
00:02:49.037 --> 00:02:53.211
but based on where a surface is
available that meets the requirements.
00:02:53.211 --> 00:02:57.236
And finally, the horizontal distance from
the tailgate to the center of the trailer
00:02:57.236 --> 00:02:59.000
axle if it's a single axle trailer.
00:03:00.080 --> 00:03:01.280
If the trailer has two or
00:03:01.280 --> 00:03:05.000
more axles, measure to the center
point between both axles, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg5.mp4
question: How can the measurements taken before trailer is connected?

video_name: Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs
video_trans:
00:00:11.610 --> 00:00:14.840
First, you'll notice all the normal
climate features you would typically find
00:00:14.840 --> 00:00:16.150
on most cars.
00:00:16.150 --> 00:00:20.250
A climate system power button, which turns
the climate control system off and on.
00:00:20.250 --> 00:00:24.370
A fan speed control or a circulating air
button that let's you switch between
00:00:24.370 --> 00:00:27.450
outside air and
air circulating within the car.
00:00:27.450 --> 00:00:30.395
A distribution control that lets you
choose whether you want the air flow to
00:00:30.395 --> 00:00:34.505
come through the dashboard vents,
the floor vents, the defrost
00:00:34.505 --> 00:00:39.085
vent at the base of the windshield,
or a combination of multiple vents.
00:00:39.085 --> 00:00:41.552
An air conditioning or AC, button.
00:00:41.552 --> 00:00:44.288
Max defrost and rear defrost buttons.
00:00:44.288 --> 00:00:45.850
And a max A/C button.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs_seg2.mp4
question: What button let the driver switch between outside air and air circulating within the car?

video_trans:

You can set your headlamps and tail lamps
to come on any time you use your wipers.

When your windshield wipers

video_name: Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc
video_trans:
00:00:47.540 --> 00:00:52.500
To use Launch Control, select Launch
Control under the Track App menu.
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.105
Once enabled quickly press
the accelerator all the way to the floor.
00:00:56.105 --> 00:00:58.365
The feature will automatically
set your preferred RPM.
00:00:58.365 --> 00:01:01.535
You'll know it's set when you see
the set icon in the lower right
00:01:01.535 --> 00:01:02.795
corner of the display.
00:01:02.795 --> 00:01:03.296
When ready,
00:01:03.296 --> 00:01:06.265
quickly release the clutch while
maintaining pressure on the accelerator.
00:01:06.265 --> 00:01:08.252
[MUSIC]
00:01:08.252 --> 00:01:09.580
One more thing.
00:01:09.580 --> 00:01:12.110
You can turn it off by
following the same steps.
00:01:12.110 --> 00:01:14.220
Simply select Launch Control and press OK.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc_seg3.mp4
question: How is  the launch control system set?

video_name: Headlamp Adjustment _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Sp3McTgj4ck
video_trans:
00:01:08.320 --> 00:01:12.670
Great, now let's talk about what to do
if your lights do need to be adjusted.
00:01:12.670 --> 00:01:16.450
Or if you're going to be towing
something and need to move them.
00:01:16.450 --> 00:01:20.920
First, open your hood, do you see
the adjuster on your head lamps?
00:01:22.118 --> 00:01:26.320
With your screwdriver, twist each one
until your beams are at the right level.
00:01:26.320 --> 00:01:28.830
And remember to leave the marks
on your door or wall so
00:01:28.830 --> 00:01:31.700
that you can readjust the lights
back when you need to.
00:01:31.700 --> 00:01:32.670
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Headlamp Adjustment _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Sp3McTgj4ck_seg5.mp4
question: Where is the location of your head light adjustor?

video_name: Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM
video_trans:
00:00:29.510 --> 00:00:32.320
Electric range is the estimated
distance you can travel
00:00:32.320 --> 00:00:35.280
while in plug-in power
mode with the engine off.
00:00:35.280 --> 00:00:38.180
This range is based on
calculations determined by
00:00:38.180 --> 00:00:43.090
the amount of energy stored in the battery
and the energy being used while driving.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM_seg2.mp4
question: What does the electric range stand for?

And a vehicle graphic will

00:00:53.040 --> 00:00:54.590

video_name: Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI
video_trans:
00:00:16.330 --> 00:00:18.660
If your vehicle is equipped
with a manual transmission,
00:00:18.660 --> 00:00:22.950
be sure your vehicle is at a complete stop
before attempting to shift into reverse.
00:00:22.950 --> 00:00:26.670
Now, press the clutch pedal all
the way to the floor to disengage it.
00:00:26.670 --> 00:00:31.110
Then use your fingers to pull up on the
collar located below the gear shift knob,
00:00:31.110 --> 00:00:35.105
and move the gear shift lever all
the way to the left, then forward.
00:00:35.105 --> 00:00:39.315
Remember, the gear shift can only be moved
to reverse by raising the lock-out ring.
00:00:39.315 --> 00:00:42.525
It protects the transmission from
accidentally engaging reverse when you're
00:00:42.525 --> 00:00:44.679
intending to shift into first.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI_seg2.mp4
question: How far do I have to press the clutch before shifting?

video_name: Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.139 --> 00:00:04.420
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.420 --> 00:00:08.054
Programming your HomeLink system
is simple, let me show you how.
00:00:08.054 --> 00:00:10.470
First, turn on your car.
00:00:10.470 --> 00:00:13.491
Hold your old transmitter a couple of
inches away from the HomeLink button
00:00:13.491 --> 00:00:15.880
you want to control your garage door with.
00:00:15.880 --> 00:00:19.880
Now press and hold both the transmitter
button and the home link button
00:00:19.880 --> 00:00:24.560
until the indicator light changes from
a slow blink to a fast one, like this.
00:00:24.560 --> 00:00:27.520
Now, press and hold the button on your
HomeLink that you want to control
00:00:27.520 --> 00:00:30.950
your garage door for
five seconds and release it.
00:00:30.950 --> 00:00:35.120
Your garage door should, move but if it
doesn't, repeat the five second hold.
00:00:35.120 --> 00:00:39.230
If your indicator light is still on
your programming is complete and you can
00:00:39.230 --> 00:00:42.860
just press and release your HomeLink
button to activate your garage door.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g_seg1.mp4
question: How can the garrage door be opened using the system?

video_name: How to Use Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GZQFXF_db7g
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.323
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.323 --> 00:00:07.842
Did you know your vehicle may be equipped
with a convenient feature that helps make
00:00:07.842 --> 00:00:10.070
maneuvering a trailer in reverse easy?
00:00:10.070 --> 00:00:12.320
It's called Pro Trailer Backup Assist.
00:00:12.320 --> 00:00:13.590
Let me tell you about it.
00:00:13.590 --> 00:00:15.940
Whether you're backing
a trailer into a job site or
00:00:15.940 --> 00:00:20.930
launching a boat, if you can turn a knob,
you can now back up your trailer with ease.
00:00:20.930 --> 00:00:23.630
Which means, whichever direction
you want your trailer to go,
00:00:23.630 --> 00:00:27.640
just turn the knob in that direction and
the system will take over the steering,
00:00:27.640 --> 00:00:30.770
instead of having to turn the wheel
in the opposite direction.
00:00:30.770 --> 00:00:34.150
To use it, press the center button on
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist knob.
00:00:34.150 --> 00:00:36.660
A list of available trailers will appear.
00:00:36.660 --> 00:00:37.840
Choose the one you want and
00:00:37.840 --> 00:00:40.990
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
will attempt to locate it.
00:00:40.990 --> 00:00:44.010
Once the targeting sticker is
located by the rearview camera,
00:00:44.010 --> 00:00:47.170
the screen will prompt you to
shift into reverse to activate it.
00:00:47.170 --> 00:00:50.450
Then follow the prompts displayed
on the information screen.
00:00:50.450 --> 00:00:52.390
With your hands off the steering wheel,
00:00:52.390 --> 00:00:55.820
use the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
knob to steer the trailer.
00:00:55.820 --> 00:00:59.730
Turn the knob left, or counter-clockwise,
when you want the rear of the trailer to
00:00:59.730 --> 00:01:04.340
go to the left, and right,
clockwise, to go right.
00:01:04.340 --> 00:01:07.070
You should also make it a habit
to use your side view mirrors
00:01:07.070 --> 00:01:10.230
as your primary visual aid
while maneuvering the trailer.
00:01:10.230 --> 00:01:14.190
Once the trailer is moving in
the direction you want, release the knob.
00:01:14.190 --> 00:01:17.450
Keep in mind, you may need to make
small adjustments with the knob to
00:01:17.450 --> 00:01:20.060
keep the trailer moving
along the desired path.
00:01:20.060 --> 00:01:23.820
As soon as the knob is either released or
turned back to the center position,
00:01:23.820 --> 00:01:26.132
the vehicle will follow
the trailer's path.
00:01:26.132 --> 00:01:28.660
You'll need to control the accelerator and
brakes.
00:01:28.660 --> 00:01:29.712
Any questions?
00:01:29.712 --> 00:01:31.599
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:01:31.599 --> 00:01:41.599
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Use Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GZQFXF_db7g_seg1.mp4
question: How does the pro trailer back up function?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:01:52.902 --> 00:01:56.464
The stop and go feature comes in handy
while driving on the highway and
00:01:56.464 --> 00:01:57.947
heavy traffic conditions.
00:01:57.947 --> 00:02:00.656
If the vehicle ahead of
you comes to a stop your
00:02:00.656 --> 00:02:03.093
vehicle will also follow down to a stop.
00:02:03.093 --> 00:02:07.718
Once the lead vehicle begins moving within
a short period of about three seconds,
00:02:07.718 --> 00:02:10.346
your car will automatically
begin to follow.
00:02:10.346 --> 00:02:14.312
If it takes longer to move, you can press
the resume button on your steering wheel.
00:02:14.312 --> 00:02:18.866
Or tap the accelerator pedal to start
following the lead vehicle again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg8.mp4
question: When using the stop and go feature, what happens when the vehicle in front of you comes to a stop?

video_name: Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM
video_trans:
00:00:13.395 --> 00:00:18.150
If your vehicle is equipped with a third
row power fold, you can use the power seat
00:00:18.150 --> 00:00:23.100
buttons located behind the third
row to fold the left, right, or
00:00:23.100 --> 00:00:29.370
both seats to either a stow, fold,
tailgate, or normal position.
00:00:29.370 --> 00:00:31.410
If you have a second row power fold and
00:00:31.410 --> 00:00:33.960
tumble control,
just press the button once, and
00:00:33.960 --> 00:00:38.720
the seat will automatically fold and then
tumble forward to access the third row.

video_name: Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc
video_trans:
00:01:06.820 --> 00:01:08.680
If you have the available power seats,
00:01:08.680 --> 00:01:12.510
using the switch located on the side of
the seat you can move the seats forward or
00:01:12.510 --> 00:01:15.320
backward by sliding it forward or
backward.
00:01:15.330 --> 00:01:18.970
To raise the seat bottom,
move the switch up or down.
00:01:20.160 --> 00:01:24.050
And to tilt, just lift the front of
the switch to tilt backward and
00:01:24.050 --> 00:01:25.500
press down to tilt forward.
00:01:25.500 --> 00:01:29.406
To set the firmest of the lumbar
support using the lumbar button,
00:01:29.406 --> 00:01:35.654
here, press the front of it to increase
the firmness and the back to decrease it.
00:01:35.654 --> 00:01:36.635
Any questions?

a vehicle health report, first,
00:01:31.560 --> 00:01:33.380

00:01:33.380 --> 00:01:36.140
Then from the home screen press settings,
00:01:36.140 --> 00:01:41.440
it's the one that looks like gears,
Vehicle, and then Vehicle Health Report.

video_name: Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g
video_trans:
00:00:45.230 --> 00:00:47.680
In order to see what
the TBC is telling you,
00:00:47.680 --> 00:00:52.470
you'll want to have the trailer screen up
on your LCD productivity screen, here.
00:00:52.470 --> 00:00:54.840
To get there, go to Truck Apps,
00:00:54.840 --> 00:00:57.930
then push the right arrow twice
until you see the trailer display.
00:00:58.940 --> 00:01:03.460
Unless a trailer is connected, the display
will read, Trailer Disconnected.
00:01:03.460 --> 00:01:06.740
As soon as a trailer is connected,
you'll see this message.
00:01:06.740 --> 00:01:08.100
Press OK.
00:01:08.100 --> 00:01:12.680
Once the trailer connected message
goes away, you'll see gain setting.
00:01:12.680 --> 00:01:16.370
This is what we talked about earlier, and
a bar graph that lights up to show you
00:01:16.370 --> 00:01:19.390
the amount of power going
to the trailer brakes.
00:01:19.390 --> 00:01:23.960
From the trailer display, press OK, and
choose the Connection Checklist option.
00:01:25.110 --> 00:01:27.640
It corresponds to
different trailer types and
00:01:27.640 --> 00:01:32.160
walks you through the connection process
to remind you of the necessary steps.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g_seg3.mp4
question: Where can you find the railer screen?

video_trans:
00:02:22.810 --> 00:02:27.370
Keep in mind you can also run a Vehicle
Health Report using voice commands.
00:02:27.370 --> 00:02:29.470
Just use the voice button
on your steering wheel and
00:02:29.470 --> 00:02:32.898
say Vehicle Health, it's that simple.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg7.mp4
question: Does voice command come available as feature?

To release it make sure your
foot is on the brake, and

The towing display gives you information

trailer that is attached,
00:01:29.020 --> 00:01:32.390

trailer setup, and checklist to

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:00:11.300 --> 00:00:15.100
The power button located in the upper
left corner of the function control panel
00:00:15.100 --> 00:00:17.050
turns your climate system on.
00:00:17.050 --> 00:00:21.020
You also have fan speed controls,
a recirculated air button
00:00:21.020 --> 00:00:25.320
that let's you switch between outside air
and air circulated within the vehicle.
00:00:25.320 --> 00:00:28.990
A distribution control that allows you to
choose whether you want the air flow to
00:00:28.990 --> 00:00:32.005
come through the instrument panel vents,
floor vents or
00:00:32.005 --> 00:00:34.115
through the defrost vent at
the base of the wind shield.
00:00:35.205 --> 00:00:39.003
You'll also find an A/C button,
a rear defrost button and
00:00:39.003 --> 00:00:41.945
Max A/C and Max Defrost buttons.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the climate system power button located?

video_trans:
00:01:22.218 --> 00:01:25.740
When you shift into drive,
you'll have to push the camera button for
00:01:25.740 --> 00:01:28.690
front view as it doesn't
automatically come on.
00:01:28.690 --> 00:01:31.900
When you do, it will show
a full screen with a 360-degree
00:01:31.900 --> 00:01:36.170
image on the right side of the screen and
a normal front view on the left side.
00:01:36.170 --> 00:01:40.620
Press it again for a normal front view and
once again for a front-split view.

on what this feature is, scroll to

Go to the main menu Tutorial

00:01:32.130 --> 00:01:34.090

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:26.290 --> 00:00:28.460
When a vehicle enters into
a lane to the right or
00:00:28.460 --> 00:00:33.215
left, BLIS warns you with a solid light
on the corresponding side view mirror.
00:00:33.215 --> 00:00:36.115
The light will stay on until the vehicle
has moved out of your blind spot.
00:00:37.155 --> 00:00:39.805
Also, whenever you
activate your turn signal,
00:00:39.805 --> 00:00:42.995
if a vehicle is within the blind
spot zone, BLIS will give you
00:00:42.995 --> 00:00:46.465
a flashing light warning on
the corresponding side view mirror.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg3.mp4
question: How long will the light stay on ?

video_name: Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U
video_trans:
00:00:12.858 --> 00:00:16.194
The jack is located under
the passenger seat. To get to it,
00:00:16.194 --> 00:00:18.530
simply move the seat all the way forward,
00:00:18.530 --> 00:00:22.937
using either the power control button
located on the side closest to the door,
00:00:22.937 --> 00:00:26.650
or the manual adjust seat bar
located under the front of the seat.
00:00:26.650 --> 00:00:29.475
Lift the cover panel by pulling up on it.
00:00:29.475 --> 00:00:33.807
It's held in position with Velcro, so
just give it a little tug.
00:00:33.807 --> 00:00:38.574
Now unstrap the jack by stretching
the rubber hold down strap and releasing,
00:00:38.574 --> 00:00:39.684
then lift it out.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U_seg2.mp4
question: how do you get to the jack?

video_name: Configurable Daytime Running Lamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-HeJaJ_ufDuc
video_trans:
00:00:46.150 --> 00:00:46.960
Keep in mind,
00:00:46.960 --> 00:00:51.150
your daytime running lamps will only work
when you're in the autolamp position and
00:00:51.150 --> 00:00:54.250
if you've set them to come on under
preferences in the information display.
00:00:55.380 --> 00:00:59.475
If your daytime running lamps are set
to off in the information display,
00:00:59.475 --> 00:01:01.099
they will not turn on at all.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Configurable Daytime Running Lamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-HeJaJ_ufDuc_seg3.mp4
question: How do I keep my daytime running lamps on?

video_name: 180 Camera with Split-View Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0znZlttKkuc
video_trans:
00:00:59.200 --> 00:01:01.920
There's also a rear view camera,
just above the license plate,
00:01:01.920 --> 00:01:04.260
that works independently from
the one in the front, and
 
00:01:04.260 --> 00:01:07.590
shows what's directly behind
you while you're in reverse.
00:01:07.590 --> 00:01:10.100
Another car icon in the upper
right side of the screen,
00:01:10.100 --> 00:01:13.720
the park distance control display,
also shows up when you're in reverse.
00:01:13.720 --> 00:01:15.290
And uses red, yellow, and
00:01:15.290 --> 00:01:19.380
green indicators to show you where
the closest obstacles detected are.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/180 Camera with Split-View Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0znZlttKkuc_seg5.mp4
question: Where is the rear view camera located?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:00:22.880 --> 00:00:24.570
When ready to charge the vehicle,
00:00:24.570 --> 00:00:28.560
first be sure that the cord is
completely unwound to avoid overheating.
00:00:28.560 --> 00:00:33.250
And plug the AC plug into an AC outlet,
making sure to use a dedicated line that
00:00:33.250 --> 00:00:37.010
no other appliances are connected to,
to avoid tripping a circuit.
00:00:37.010 --> 00:00:40.910
Then, connect the charging coupler
to the charge port on the vehicle.
00:00:40.910 --> 00:00:43.410
You'll know it's properly attached
when you hear a click and
00:00:43.410 --> 00:00:44.760
the lock release button pops up.
00:00:45.830 --> 00:00:49.580
The FORD charge port LED lights
will flash in sequence two times,
00:00:49.580 --> 00:00:52.540
to confirm an electrical
connection has been made.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg3.mp4
question: Does the adapter require a dedicated AC line?

If at any time you want a quick refresher
on what this feature is, scroll to

information, use the five way control on

Go to the main menu Tutorial

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:02:22.695 --> 00:02:26.390
Cross-traffic alert warns you
of moving cars coming from
00:02:26.390 --> 00:02:30.490
either side when you're in reverse or
backing up and gives you three warnings.
00:02:30.490 --> 00:02:34.740
A light on the corresponding
side view mirror, a chime, and
00:02:34.740 --> 00:02:36.670
a message in your message center.

video_name: MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM
video_trans:
00:00:17.846 --> 00:00:22.105
Using the five-way controls on your
steering wheel, scroll to the main menu,
00:00:22.105 --> 00:00:25.400
Display/Trip, then scroll to MyView and
00:00:25.400 --> 00:00:27.740
press the right arrow on
the five-way controls.
00:00:27.740 --> 00:00:31.030
It takes you to the Options menu
where you can select Change MyView.
00:00:31.030 --> 00:00:35.100
From here, simply use the up or
down arrows to view the available content,
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:39.280
like Vehicle Range, Trip 1 and
2, Fuel History, Coach, etc,
00:00:39.280 --> 00:00:43.030
and the right and left arrows to move
between the left and right columns.
00:00:44.360 --> 00:00:46.710
Each time you select a screen
that you want to display,
00:00:46.710 --> 00:00:49.650
press the OK button on your
five-way control to save it.
00:00:49.650 --> 00:00:51.980
This will now be your MyView screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM_seg2.mp4
question: What do the left and right arrows do?

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:02:18.170 --> 00:02:21.850
Now, I'm going to tell you how to place
the checkered sticker I just mentioned.
00:02:21.850 --> 00:02:25.340
The sticker acts as a target that
the trailer reverse guidance feature and
00:02:25.340 --> 00:02:28.480
rear view camera use to track which
direction the trailer is moving.
00:02:29.640 --> 00:02:31.250
Take the checkered target sticker and
00:02:31.250 --> 00:02:33.830
measurement card with you
to the rear of the vehicle.
00:02:33.830 --> 00:02:36.790
You'll want to place the sticker
within 7 to 22 inches from
00:02:36.790 --> 00:02:38.890
the center of the trailer hitch ball.
00:02:38.890 --> 00:02:42.696
You'll need to make sure to place the
sticker on a flat horizontal surface, so
00:02:42.696 --> 00:02:46.573
the entire sticker is in the acceptable
zone invisible by the rearview camera.
00:02:46.573 --> 00:02:48.293
[MUSIC]
00:02:48.293 --> 00:02:50.430
This is where an assistant
would be helpful.
00:02:50.430 --> 00:02:54.020
Once the sticker is in place, you'll
need to use your tape measure to get and
00:02:54.020 --> 00:02:56.020
record several measurements.
00:02:56.020 --> 00:02:59.880
First, measure the horizontal distance
from the license plate to the center of
00:02:59.880 --> 00:03:01.720
the hitch ball, and write it down.
00:03:01.720 --> 00:03:06.130
Next, measure the horizontal distance
from the center of the hitch ball to
00:03:06.130 --> 00:03:07.746
the center of the sticker.
00:03:07.746 --> 00:03:11.870
And the distance from the rear view
camera to the center of the sticker.
00:03:11.870 --> 00:03:15.218
Keep in mind, the location is
not dependent on a straight or
00:03:15.218 --> 00:03:20.780
a frame type, but based on where a surface
is available that meets the requirements.
00:03:20.780 --> 00:03:24.740
And finally, the horizontal distance from
the tailgate to the center of the trailer
00:03:24.740 --> 00:03:26.645
axle if it's a single axle trailer.
00:03:28.335 --> 00:03:30.685
If the trailer has two or more axles,
00:03:30.685 --> 00:03:34.680
measure to the center point
between both axles, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg4.mp4
question: What is the checkered sticker for?

video_name: 6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc
video_trans:
00:00:17.320 --> 00:00:20.822
Here's how it works, to use SelectShift,
00:00:20.822 --> 00:00:24.333
move your gear shift into S,
or Sport Mode.
00:00:24.333 --> 00:00:27.600
If your vehicle has the select shift
controls on the steering wheel,
00:00:27.600 --> 00:00:32.040
you'll pull the right paddle to upshift,
or the left paddle to downshift.
00:00:32.040 --> 00:00:35.990
If your controls are located on the
Shifter, you upshift by pressing the plus
00:00:35.990 --> 00:00:40.590
button on the Gear Shift Lever, or
downshift by pressing the minus button.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc_seg3.mp4
question: How to shift the gears of the vehicle?

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:00:43.660 --> 00:00:44.710
Still with me?
00:00:44.710 --> 00:00:46.930
Great, then let's move on.
00:00:46.930 --> 00:00:49.210
In order to see what
the TBC is telling you,
00:00:49.210 --> 00:00:52.970
you'll want to have the towing screen up
on your 8-inch productivity screen.
00:00:52.970 --> 00:00:56.120
To get there, use the five-way
switch on your steering wheel,
00:00:56.120 --> 00:00:58.180
scroll to the right to the Towing tab.
00:00:58.180 --> 00:01:00.890
Select Towing Status, and hit OK.
00:01:00.890 --> 00:01:02.810
Then, you'll see the gain setting screen.
00:01:02.810 --> 00:01:04.940
This is what we talked about earlier.
00:01:04.940 --> 00:01:08.170
And the progress bar that lights up to
show you the amount of power going to
00:01:08.170 --> 00:01:11.000
the trailer brakes when you're
foot is on the brake pedal.
00:01:11.000 --> 00:01:15.390
Unless a trailer is connected,
the display will read no trailer detected.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg4.mp4
question: How is trailer gain monitored when towing a vehicle?

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:00:45.300 --> 00:00:48.655
In order to convert the 40 amp
relays to key off battery use,
00:00:48.655 --> 00:00:50.565
there are a few steps you'll need to take.
00:00:50.565 --> 00:00:53.995
First, you'll need to locate
the relay box under the engine hood,
00:00:53.995 --> 00:00:56.015
next to the driver side fender, here.
00:00:57.115 --> 00:01:00.950
Then remove the relay cover by
pressing the tab and lifting it off.
00:01:00.950 --> 00:01:03.060
Next, locate the five amp fuse.
00:01:04.180 --> 00:01:07.900
You'll then need to pull it out,
slide the spacer over, and place it so
00:01:07.900 --> 00:01:12.740
the left prong is in the far left slot and
the right prong is in the middle slot.
00:01:12.740 --> 00:01:16.900
Replace the cover and your 40 amp circuits
are now set to run on battery power
00:01:16.900 --> 00:01:18.930
even with the key out of the truck.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs_seg4.mp4
question: What is the benefit in having the 40 amp relays key off battery use?

video_name: Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g
video_trans:
00:01:20.190 --> 00:01:23.630
Keep in mind, if your transmitter stops
working which you're programming,
00:01:23.630 --> 00:01:25.890
you'll have to hold the function
button while you press and
00:01:25.890 --> 00:01:28.380
release the transmitter every two seconds.
00:01:28.380 --> 00:01:30.950
You'll see the indicator
light flash slowly at first
00:01:30.950 --> 00:01:34.590
then faster once the signal has
been sent and accepted again.
00:01:34.590 --> 00:01:35.175
Still with me?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g_seg4.mp4
question: What will the indicator light do when a signal is being sent?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:02:36.670 --> 00:02:39.370
Keep in mind,
anytime a trailer is connected and
00:02:39.370 --> 00:02:43.160
information is input, cross-traffic
alert automatically turns off.
00:02:44.260 --> 00:02:48.160
And finally, extreme weather
conditions could block the sensors, but
00:02:48.160 --> 00:02:52.450
if that happens, you'll get a warning
message and a chime to let you know.
00:02:52.450 --> 00:02:54.460
As with most radar, infrared and
00:02:54.460 --> 00:02:58.660
ultrasonic type sensing systems,
there is a possibility of false alerts.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg7.mp4
question: Does the cross traffic automatically turn off?

video_name: Forward Collision Warning with Brake Support - F-Series _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1MCegMMMIS0
video_trans:
00:00:14.740 --> 00:00:18.920
The forward collision warning with brake
support, uses a radar sensor to detect
00:00:18.920 --> 00:00:22.445
slower moving vehicles traveling
in the same direction as you and
00:00:22.445 --> 00:00:24.880
warns you if you're
rapidly approaching them.
00:00:24.880 --> 00:00:28.520
If this happens, a red warning light
will illuminate on your windshield and
00:00:28.520 --> 00:00:30.110
the warning chime will sound.
00:00:30.110 --> 00:00:33.120
If you don't react after the alert and
continue to get closer to
00:00:33.120 --> 00:00:36.870
the other vehicle, the system will
pre-charge your breaks for rapid breaking.
00:00:36.870 --> 00:00:39.420
So, they can respond faster once
you do press your brake pedal.
00:00:40.470 --> 00:00:43.720
Once your brakes have been pre-charged,
even if you press them lightly,
00:00:43.720 --> 00:00:46.300
they'll apply full stopping
power to help stop you quickly.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Forward Collision Warning with Brake Support - F-Series _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1MCegMMMIS0_seg2.mp4
question: At what speed the system is active?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:07.404
[MUSIC]
00:00:07.404 --> 00:00:10.866
The second and third row seats in your
Transit Connect wagon can be folded down
00:00:10.866 --> 00:00:13.800
when you need extra space for
transporting cargo.
00:00:13.800 --> 00:00:15.050
Here's how to do it.
00:00:15.050 --> 00:00:19.640
To fold the second row seats,
first push down the head restraints, like this.
00:00:19.640 --> 00:00:24.793
Now, find the strap located on the side of
the seat back closest to the door, here.
00:00:24.793 --> 00:00:26.442
And pull it to fold the seat back down.
00:00:26.442 --> 00:00:28.665
[MUSIC]
00:00:28.665 --> 00:00:32.680
You'll notice that you have two straps on
the seat back, a long one and a short one.
00:00:32.680 --> 00:00:35.050
I'll tell you about the shorter one later.
00:00:35.050 --> 00:00:38.920
So, for now, find the longer strap and
pull up to unlock it.
00:00:38.920 --> 00:00:41.850
Now, move the entire seat forward and
down.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg1.mp4
question: How can we make extra space in the vehicle?

video_name: Improve Your Windshield Wiper Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-esaKAXXG0KM
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.277
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.277 --> 00:00:06.654
Did you know that dirty glass or wiper
blades are one of the major reasons for
00:00:06.654 --> 00:00:09.020
streaks and
smears on your windshield when wiping?
00:00:10.170 --> 00:00:12.640
If this happens,
lift your wiper blades up and
  
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:16.680
clean the entire windshield glass,
as well as the rubber blades.
00:00:16.680 --> 00:00:19.270
Be sure to clean the windshield
using a neutral detergent
00:00:19.270 --> 00:00:23.030
such as Motorcraft Premium
Windshield Washer Concentrate or
00:00:23.030 --> 00:00:26.960
Motorcraft Ultra-Clear Spray
Glass Cleaner, and a soft cloth.
00:00:26.960 --> 00:00:28.090
Then rinse with clear water.
00:00:29.330 --> 00:00:32.405
In extreme cases,
you may need to use a mild abrasive,
00:00:32.405 --> 00:00:36.480
non-chlorinated cleaner, and
wash the wiper blades using a sponge or
00:00:36.480 --> 00:00:40.860
soft cloth and rubbing alcohol, or
Premium Windshield Washer Fluid.
00:00:40.860 --> 00:00:45.060
If your wipers continue to smear your
windshield, you may need to replace them.
00:00:45.060 --> 00:00:45.920
Any questions?
00:00:45.920 --> 00:00:48.075
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:48.075 --> 00:00:58.075
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Improve Your Windshield Wiper Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-esaKAXXG0KM_seg1.mp4
question: What is 1 of the major reasons for a dirty windshield?

video_name: Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk
video_trans:
00:00:31.810 --> 00:00:36.120
When you come to a stop, the Brake Coach
screen appears in your display.
00:00:36.120 --> 00:00:38.830
And shows you your
braking efficiency score.
00:00:38.830 --> 00:00:41.820
You'll get higher percentages by
coming to gradual stops and
00:00:41.820 --> 00:00:46.220
100% means that you maximize
your braking efficiency.
00:00:46.230 --> 00:00:49.060
If at any time you want a quick
refresher on what this feature is,
00:00:49.076 --> 00:00:52.260
use the five way control on the left
side of your steering wheel.
00:00:52.260 --> 00:00:56.420
Go to the Main Menu,
scroll to Information, Tutorial,
00:00:56.420 --> 00:00:59.320
then select Brake Coach and
a brief description will appear.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk_seg3.mp4
question: How do I get higher brake coach efficiency scores?

video_name: Inflatable Rear Safety Belt Owner Tips _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GIbrDEGm-hc
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.090 --> 00:00:06.099
[MUSIC]
00:00:06.099 --> 00:00:10.110
Your vehicle may be equipped with
inflatable rear outboard safety belts.
00:00:10.110 --> 00:00:13.222
They work similarly to standard
belts in everyday use.
00:00:13.222 --> 00:00:16.254
But in the event of an accident
they work a little differently.
00:00:16.254 --> 00:00:17.647
Let me explain.
00:00:17.647 --> 00:00:22.222
Unlike a standard safety belt the
inflatable outboard rear safety belt uses
00:00:22.222 --> 00:00:23.303
two retractors.
00:00:23.303 --> 00:00:25.981
One for your torso and one for your lap.
00:00:25.981 --> 00:00:30.081
To fasten it, just grab the tongue, that's
the part that connects the torso and
00:00:30.081 --> 00:00:30.820
lap portion.
00:00:30.820 --> 00:00:36.081
Pull the entire belt over your body at the
same time, then latch it into the buckle.
00:00:36.081 --> 00:00:39.196
Make sure to insert the tongue in
a straight-in motion to the buckle.
00:00:39.196 --> 00:00:42.434
This will help ensure
the inflation mechanism lines up.
00:00:42.434 --> 00:00:44.869
And that it inflates properly if needed.
00:00:44.869 --> 00:00:49.316
If you're in an accident, the crash system
in your vehicle will determine when, and
00:00:49.316 --> 00:00:52.176
if, the inflatable rear
safety belts should deploy.
00:00:52.176 --> 00:00:56.496
If they're needed, the air bags will
inflate with cold, compressed gas and
00:00:56.496 --> 00:01:01.149
expand across the passengers' bodies to
distribute the forces from the crash over
00:01:01.149 --> 00:01:03.551
a larger area to reduce
the risk of injury.
00:01:03.551 --> 00:01:04.604
Any questions?
00:01:04.604 --> 00:01:06.484
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:06.484 --> 00:01:16.484
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Inflatable Rear Safety Belt Owner Tips _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GIbrDEGm-hc_seg1.mp4
question: What is the difference between a standard safety belt and an inflatable rear safety belt?

video_name: What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I
video_trans:
00:00:38.005 --> 00:00:41.420
To adjust the auto lamp time delay,
or how long your head lamps
00:00:41.420 --> 00:00:46.290
stay on after you've turned off your car,
use the information display controls.
00:00:46.290 --> 00:00:51.210
Press the down arrow to find settings,
then press OK and the right arrow.
00:00:51.210 --> 00:00:55.520
And scroll down to vehicle, or
convenience depending on your vehicle.
00:00:55.520 --> 00:00:59.370
Next, press the right arrow and
scroll to auto lamp delay.
00:00:59.370 --> 00:01:03.880
Press the right arrow again,
select off or the time delay you wish.
00:01:03.880 --> 00:01:05.350
Then press OK to set it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I_seg3.mp4
question: Where are the information display controls located?

video_name: Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM
video_trans:
00:00:13.395 --> 00:00:18.150
If your vehicle is equipped with a third
row power fold, you can use the power seat
00:00:18.150 --> 00:00:23.100
buttons located behind the third
row to fold the left, right, or
00:00:23.100 --> 00:00:29.370
both seats to either a stow, fold,
tailgate, or normal position.
00:00:29.370 --> 00:00:31.410
If you have a second row power fold and
00:00:31.410 --> 00:00:33.960
tumble control,
just press the button once, and
00:00:33.960 --> 00:00:38.720
the seat will automatically fold and then
tumble forward to access the third row.

video_trans:
00:00:44.181 --> 00:00:46.430

press the up and
00:00:46.430 --> 00:00:49.590

wheel control switch.
00:00:49.590 --> 00:00:52.240
Pressing it up decreases your
follow distance setting and
00:00:52.240 --> 00:00:54.330
allows your car to follow
at a closer distance.
00:00:55.530 --> 00:00:58.530
And pressing it down, increases
your follow distance setting, and
00:00:58.530 --> 00:01:01.460
expands the distance between you and
a car in front of you.

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:14.360
Here's how it works.
00:00:14.360 --> 00:00:18.500
Auto Start Stop automatically turns on
at startup unless you decided to turn it
00:00:18.500 --> 00:00:22.840
off using the on off button located
on the center console, here.
00:00:22.840 --> 00:00:25.570
You'll know it's activated when
you see the start-stop icon
00:00:25.570 --> 00:00:28.180
illuminated in your instrument cluster.
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:29.590
When you put your foot on the brake and
00:00:29.590 --> 00:00:33.690
come to a full stop, like at a red light,
your engine shuts off.
00:00:33.690 --> 00:00:35.580
You might not even notice it, but
00:00:35.580 --> 00:00:38.800
a light on the instrument cluster
will let you know the engine is off.
00:00:38.800 --> 00:00:39.580
But don't worry.
00:00:39.580 --> 00:00:44.100
Your climate control settings, radio,
and head lamps will function normally.
00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:45.870
And when you take your
foot off the brake pedal,
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.710
your car automatically restarts,
without any delay.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg2.mp4
question: when if it possible to drive on the city side

video_name: Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E
video_trans:
00:00:38.180 --> 00:00:41.900
To access the other two cup holders and
storage bin, pull the middle seat back
00:00:41.900 --> 00:00:46.540
down by pushing the button on
the passenger side of the console, here.
00:00:46.540 --> 00:00:50.180
You can open the storage
bin by squeezing the small latch.
00:00:50.190 --> 00:00:54.160
For your added security, this storage bin
will only open when the seat is folded.
00:00:54.160 --> 00:00:57.783
So there's no worry of things falling
out when it's in the upright position.
00:00:57.783 --> 00:01:02.415
And keep in mind, because the cup holders
have small rubber pads on the inside,
00:01:02.415 --> 00:01:06.234
they can hold different size cups and
plastic bottles securely.

video_name: Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs
video_trans:
00:00:11.610 --> 00:00:14.840
First, you'll notice all the normal
climate features you would typically find
00:00:14.840 --> 00:00:16.150
on most cars.
00:00:16.150 --> 00:00:20.250
A climate system power button, which turns
the climate control system off and on.
00:00:20.250 --> 00:00:24.370
A fan speed control or a circulating air
button that let's you switch between
00:00:24.370 --> 00:00:27.450
outside air and
air circulating within the car.
00:00:27.450 --> 00:00:30.395
A distribution control that lets you
choose whether you want the air flow to
00:00:30.395 --> 00:00:34.505
come through the dashboard vents,
the floor vents, the defrost
00:00:34.505 --> 00:00:39.085
vent at the base of the windshield,
or a combination of multiple vents.
00:00:39.085 --> 00:00:41.552
An air conditioning or AC, button.
00:00:41.552 --> 00:00:44.288
Max defrost and rear defrost buttons.
00:00:44.288 --> 00:00:45.850
And a max A/C button.

video_name: SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0
video_trans:
00:01:09.170 --> 00:01:13.070
To manually shift gears,
move your gear shift from D to M.
00:01:13.070 --> 00:01:15.820
Now, only your current gear will appear.
00:01:15.820 --> 00:01:19.590
And you can use the plus button to up
shift and the minus to down shift.
00:01:19.590 --> 00:01:23.690
Keep in mind, even though you're manually
changing gears, SelectShift will prevent
00:01:23.690 --> 00:01:28.510
some shifts if your engine speed is
too high or if your RPMs are too low.
00:01:28.510 --> 00:01:32.710
And if you come to a stop while in Manual
Mode, the transmission will automatically
00:01:32.710 --> 00:01:36.600
downshift to a lower gear for
easier acceleration when you drive away.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0_seg4.mp4

video_trans:

video_name: Trailer Sway Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-jBHFDhd7638
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.784
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.784 --> 00:00:08.220
Is there any way to keep
my trailer from swaying?
00:00:10.150 --> 00:00:12.310
>> Is there any way to reduce
the sway from my trailer?
00:00:13.350 --> 00:00:16.510
>> For those of you who like to tow,
Ford has something that can help reduce
00:00:16.510 --> 00:00:19.330
how much your trailer sways
while you are driving.
00:00:19.330 --> 00:00:20.180
Here's how it works.
00:00:20.180 --> 00:00:25.060
If your trailer starts to sway, you'll see
the stability control light flash, and
00:00:25.060 --> 00:00:29.150
a trailer sway reduce speed message
in your information display.
00:00:29.150 --> 00:00:32.380
The trailer sway controller feature
will begin to apply the brakes to
00:00:32.380 --> 00:00:36.210
individual wheels, and
reduce your engine power if needed.
00:00:36.210 --> 00:00:39.800
If this happens, it's likely that
your trailer is improperly loaded, or
00:00:39.800 --> 00:00:42.620
the speed of your vehicle and
trailer are too high.
00:00:42.620 --> 00:00:45.960
Slow down, pull your vehicle off the road,
and make sure that
00:00:45.960 --> 00:00:50.270
your trailer is connected correctly and
your load is distributed properly.
00:00:50.270 --> 00:00:53.250
Then drive at a slower speed than
you were before the sway occurred.
00:00:54.390 --> 00:00:56.300
And here's something
else you need to know.
00:00:56.300 --> 00:01:00.173
Trailer sway control will not affect how
your vehicle handles in normal driving
00:01:00.173 --> 00:01:02.725
conditions, or
when you're not towing a trailer.
00:01:02.725 --> 00:01:03.518
Any questions?
00:01:03.518 --> 00:01:04.904
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:04.904 --> 00:01:14.904
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Sway Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-jBHFDhd7638_seg1.mp4
question: How does the Trailer sway control feature functions and what are it's advantages?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:00:41.850 --> 00:00:43.340
To fold the third row seats,
00:00:43.340 --> 00:00:47.460
find the strap on the seat cushion
located in the seat-bite, here.
00:00:47.460 --> 00:00:50.298
Pull it and flip the cushions so
that the seat bottom is face down.
00:00:51.500 --> 00:00:54.090
Next, locate the red
strap in the seat back.
00:00:54.090 --> 00:00:57.641
It looks like it's tucked into a small
pocket in the lower corner of the seat
00:00:57.641 --> 00:00:58.220
back.
00:00:58.220 --> 00:01:00.980
Pull it, and fold the seat back down.

video_trans:

Keep in mind, the charge port light
illumination will time out after 1 minute.
00:01:54.030 --> 00:01:57.439
If a fault is detected at any time,
all the lights will flash continuously.

the number of lights which represents your
00:02:02.930 --> 00:02:06.140
current minimum state of
charge will be solidly lit.

And the charge port lights
will timeout after one minute.

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:01:10.071 --> 00:01:13.546
To access the battery compartment
on Transit Wagon models,
00:01:13.546 --> 00:01:17.973
first remove the protective plastic
molding, by pulling up on the tabs, and
00:01:17.973 --> 00:01:19.420
sliding it towards you.
00:01:19.420 --> 00:01:23.326
Next, lift the fabric covered trim by
pulling up on the tabs, and tuck, or
00:01:23.326 --> 00:01:25.074
fold it to keep it out of your way.
00:01:25.074 --> 00:01:28.962
You'll need to remove the rear metal
battery cover by unscrewing two fastening
00:01:28.962 --> 00:01:30.130
bolts, here and here.
00:01:31.350 --> 00:01:34.113
Next, unfasten the two electrical cords,
00:01:34.113 --> 00:01:38.526
by unclipping them from the fasteners
like this, and remove the bar.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg4.mp4
question: How to access the battery compartment?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:01:31.910 --> 00:01:35.030
Here are a few helpful tips for
unfolding the third row seats.
00:01:35.030 --> 00:01:38.130
You may need to do the next two
steps from the rear of the vehicle.
00:01:38.130 --> 00:01:42.500
First, retract the floor panels by
pulling up on the attached strap.
00:01:42.500 --> 00:01:46.620
Next, grab the third row seat back strap
located behind the head restraint and
00:01:46.620 --> 00:01:47.830
lift it to its locked position.
00:01:49.130 --> 00:01:52.725
Now, go back to the rear side of the door
and use the strap on the front of
00:01:52.725 --> 00:01:55.070
the seat cushion to flip it
back to its original position.
00:01:56.380 --> 00:01:57.950
And here's something you'll appreciate.
00:01:57.950 --> 00:02:02.210
You can also move the third row seats
forward and back and recline them.
00:02:02.210 --> 00:02:04.250
Just lift the metal bar
under the seat cushion and
00:02:04.250 --> 00:02:06.140
slide the seat forward or back.
00:02:06.140 --> 00:02:09.530
And pull the same strap you used to
fold the seat back down to recline them.
00:02:09.530 --> 00:02:12.160
Only now, just lean back to recline.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg4.mp4
question: How do you move the third row seat forward or back?

video_trans:

Here are few simple steps you'll
need to know when using them.
00:00:26.800 --> 00:00:31.170
If you want to use auto lamp, turn the
control knob to the auto lamp position.
00:00:31.170 --> 00:00:35.355
Your head lamps will come on automatically
as needed and will stay on for
00:00:35.355 --> 00:00:38.005
a while even after you
switch the ignition off.

To turn it on, when shifted into reverse,
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:32.135
a 360 degree view will
display on the center screen.
00:00:32.135 --> 00:00:34.475
Touch the expand button, here.
00:00:34.475 --> 00:00:36.945
Then touch the high-mounted camera button.

video_name: What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I
video_trans:
00:00:38.005 --> 00:00:41.420
To adjust the auto lamp time delay,
or how long your head lamps
00:00:41.420 --> 00:00:46.290
stay on after you've turned off your car,
use the information display controls.
00:00:46.290 --> 00:00:51.210
Press the down arrow to find settings,
then press OK and the right arrow.
00:00:51.210 --> 00:00:55.520
And scroll down to vehicle, or
convenience depending on your vehicle.
00:00:55.520 --> 00:00:59.370
Next, press the right arrow and
scroll to auto lamp delay.
00:00:59.370 --> 00:01:03.880
Press the right arrow again,
select off or the time delay you wish.
00:01:03.880 --> 00:01:05.350
Then press OK to set it.

question: What is the minimum time for the autolamp delay in the settings?

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:00:13.870 --> 00:00:17.290
To maintain the appearance of
the bright chrome exterior finishes,
00:00:17.290 --> 00:00:19.620
regular cleaning is highly recommended.
00:00:19.620 --> 00:00:24.440
To clean, use water and a mild liquid
automotive soap from an auto supply store.
00:00:24.440 --> 00:00:28.590
Or a 50/50 solution of water and
white vinegar also works well.
00:00:28.590 --> 00:00:33.411
And remove all excess water as hard water
spots can deposit iron which can lead
00:00:33.411 --> 00:00:34.013
to rust.
00:00:34.013 --> 00:00:35.947
To remove tar and bugs from the grill,
00:00:35.947 --> 00:00:39.720
it's recommended to use
an oil-based bug and tar remover.
00:00:39.720 --> 00:00:43.220
In extreme winter climates, be sure
to rinse away salt residue as soon as
00:00:43.220 --> 00:00:47.070
possible as salt contains chlorides
that can damage the surface finish.
00:00:48.570 --> 00:00:51.750
Avoid all cleaning products that
contain ammonia, bleach, and
00:00:51.750 --> 00:00:54.600
alcohol as they may
also damage the finish.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk_seg2.mp4
question: How will salt from the roads damage the chrome?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:01:52.902 --> 00:01:56.464
The stop and go feature comes in handy
while driving on the highway and
00:01:56.464 --> 00:01:57.947
heavy traffic conditions.
00:01:57.947 --> 00:02:00.656
If the vehicle ahead of
you comes to a stop your
00:02:00.656 --> 00:02:03.093
vehicle will also follow down to a stop.
00:02:03.093 --> 00:02:07.718
Once the lead vehicle begins moving within
a short period of about three seconds,
00:02:07.718 --> 00:02:10.346
your car will automatically
begin to follow.
00:02:10.346 --> 00:02:14.312
If it takes longer to move, you can press
the resume button on your steering wheel.
00:02:14.312 --> 00:02:18.866
Or tap the accelerator pedal to start
following the lead vehicle again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg8.mp4

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:01:55.850 --> 00:01:59.360
Now, I'm going to tell you how to place
the checkered sticker I just mentioned.
00:01:59.360 --> 00:02:03.473
The sticker acts as a target with
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist feature and
00:02:03.473 --> 00:02:07.537
rear-view camera used to track which
direction the trailer is moving.
00:02:07.537 --> 00:02:09.147
Take the checkered target sticker and
00:02:09.147 --> 00:02:11.419
measurement card with you
to the rear of the vehicle.
00:02:11.419 --> 00:02:15.521
You want to place the sticker within 7 to
22 inches from the center of the trailer
00:02:15.521 --> 00:02:16.198
hitch ball.
00:02:16.198 --> 00:02:19.879
You'll need to make sure to place the
sticker on a flat horizontal service that
00:02:19.879 --> 00:02:21.681
is visible by the rear-view camera.
00:02:21.681 --> 00:02:24.369
This is where an assistant
would be helpful.
00:02:24.369 --> 00:02:28.192
One the sticker is in place, you'll
need to use your tape measure to get and
00:02:28.192 --> 00:02:29.841
record several measurements.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg4.mp4
question: What does the checkered sticker access and helps camera review cues to check movement of the trailer?

00:00:27.410 --> 00:00:29.194
When a vehicle enters into your left or
00:00:29.194 --> 00:00:32.561
right adjacent lane radar sensors in
the rear of the vehicle detect it.
00:00:32.561 --> 00:00:35.482
And BLIS warns you with a solid
light on the corresponding side
00:00:35.482 --> 00:00:39.060
view mirror when the vehicle
is within blind spot zone.
00:00:39.060 --> 00:00:41.860
The light will stay on until the vehicle
has moved out of your blind spot.
00:00:43.250 --> 00:00:44.615
When you activate your turn signal,
00:00:44.615 --> 00:00:48.070
BLIS will give you a secondary flashing
light warning on the corresponding
00:00:48.070 --> 00:00:50.590
side view mirror when a vehicle's
within the blind spot zone.
00:00:51.854 --> 00:00:55.264
And remember, the system only
warns you of motorized vehicles,
00:00:55.264 --> 00:00:58.497
it does not detect bicycles,
pedestrians or other objects.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0_seg3.mp4
question: What color is the car shown at the beginning of this video?

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:01:13.290 --> 00:01:17.170
And to help give you control of how long
your car stays running, you can program
00:01:17.170 --> 00:01:21.910
your engine to run in five, ten, or
15 minute intervals using the five way
00:01:21.910 --> 00:01:26.300
steering wheel controls on the left side
to navigate through the settings menu.
00:01:26.300 --> 00:01:28.010
And if you want some extra run time,
00:01:28.010 --> 00:01:31.820
you can repeat the remote
start process to extend it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s_seg5.mp4
question: What can you do if you want some extra run time?
